 14070                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14071                                  
 14072                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14073                                  
 14074                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14075                                  ;	BootIo
 14076                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14077                                  ;
 14078                                  ; function: read/write the boot record into boot sector.
 14079                                  ;
 14080                                  ; input :
 14081                                  ;	    al=logical drive number
 14082                                  ;	    rFlag = operation (read/write)
 14083                                  ;
 14084                                  ; output:   for read operation,the boot record of the drive specified in bds
 14085                                  ;	    be read into the DiskSector buffer.
 14086                                  ;	    for write operation,the DiskSector buffer image will be written
 14087                                  ;	    to the drive specified in bds.
 14088                                  ;	    if carry set,then al contains the device driver error number
 14089                                  ;	    that will be returned to dos.
 14090                                  ;	    AX,CX,DX register destroyed.
 14091                                  ;	    if carry set,then al will contain the error code from DiskIO.
 14092                                  ;
 14093                                  ; subroutines to be called:
 14094                                  ;	DiskIO:NEAR
 14095                                  ;
 14096                                  ; logic:
 14097                                  ;
 14098                                  ; {
 14099                                  ;	first_sector = 0;	 /*logical sector 0 is the boot sector */
 14100                                  ;	sectorcount = 1;	 /*read 1 sector only */
 14101                                  ;	buffer = DiskSector;	 /*read it into the DiskSector buffer */
 14102                                  ;	call DiskIO (rFlag,drive_number,first_sector,sectorcount,buffer);
 14103                                  ; }
 14104                                  ; ==========================================================================
 14105                                  
 14106                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14107                                  BootIo:	
 14108 00001244 06                      		push	es
 14109 00001245 57                      		push	di
 14110 00001246 53                      		push	bx
 14111 00001247 1E                      		push	ds
 14112 00001248 07                      		pop	es		; Point ES: to Bios_Data
 14113                                  
 14114                                  		; Call DiskIO to read/write the boot sec. The parameters which
 14115                                  		; need to be initialized for this subroutine out here are
 14116                                  		; - Transfer address to Bios_Data:DiskSector
 14117                                  		; - Low sector needs to be initalized to 0. this is a reg. param
 14118                                  		; - Hi sector in [Start_Sec_H] needs to be initialised to 0.
 14119                                  		; - Number of sectors <-- 1
 14120                                  
 14121 00001249 BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector	; es:di -> transfer address
 14122 0000124C 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx		; First	sector (h) -> 0
 14123 0000124E 8916[1C05]              		mov	[start_sec_h], dx ; Start sector (h) -> 0
 14124 00001252 B90100                  		mov	cx, 1
 14125 00001255 E8FBF6                  		call	diskio
 14126 00001258 5B                      		pop	bx
 14127 00001259 5F                      		pop	di
 14128 0000125A 07                      		pop	es
 14129 0000125B C3                      		retn
 14130                                  
 14131                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14132                                  
 14133                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14134                                  
 14135                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14136                                  ;	ChangeLineChk
 14137                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14138                                  ;
 14139                                  ; when the user calls get/set media id call before dos establishes the media
 14140                                  ; by calling "media_chk",the change line activity of the drive is going to be
 14141                                  ; lost.	this routine will check the change line activity and will save the
 14142                                  ; history in the flags.
 14143                                  ;
 14144                                  ; FUNCTION: check the change line error activity
 14145                                  ;
 14146                                  ; INPUT :  ES:di -> bds table.
 14147                                  ;
 14148                                  ; OUTPUT:   flag in bds table will be updated if change line occurs.
 14149                                  ;
 14150                                  ; SUBROUTINES TO BE CALLED:
 14151                                  ;	Set_Changed_DL
 14152                                  ;
 14153                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14154                                  
 14155                                  ChangeLineChk:	
 14156 0000125C 268A5504                		mov	dl, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 14157 00001260 08D2                    		or	dl, dl		; Fixed	disk?
 14158 00001262 7821                    		js	short ChangeLnChkRet ; Yes, skip it.
 14159                                  		; 12/12/2022
 14160 00001264 26F6452304              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 4
 14161                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 4 ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 14162                                  					; return_fake_bpb
 14163 00001269 751A                    		jnz	short ChangeLnChkRet
 14164 0000126B 803E[7700]01            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 1	; This rom support change line?
 14165 00001270 7513                    		jnz	short ChangeLnChkRet
 14166 00001272 E8EA06                  		call	haschange	; This drive support change line?
 14167 00001275 740E                    		jz	short ChangeLnChkRet ; Do nothing
 14168                                  
 14169                                  		; Execute the rom disk interrupt to check changeline activity.
 14170                                  
 14171 00001277 B416                    		mov	ah, 16h
 14172 00001279 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - FLOPPY	DISK - CHANGE OF DISK STATUS (AT,XT2,XT286,CONV,PS)
 14173                                  					; DL = drive to	check
 14174                                  					; Return: AH = disk change status
 14175 0000127B 7308                    		jnb	short ChangeLnChkRet
 14176 0000127D 53                      		push	bx
 14177 0000127E BB4000                  		mov	bx, 40h		; fchanged
 14178                                  					; Update flag in BDS for this
 14179                                  					; physical drive
 14180 00001281 E8B406                  		call	set_changed_dl
 14181 00001284 5B                      		pop	bx
 14182                                  ChangeLnChkRet:				
 14183 00001285 C3                      		retn
 14184

 14189                                  ; ==========================================================================
 14190                                  ;	GetAccessFlag
 14191                                  ; ==========================================================================
 14192                                  ;
 14193                                  ; FUNCTION: get the status of UNFORMATTED_MEDIA bit of flags in bds table
 14194                                  ;
 14195                                  ; INPUT :
 14196                                  ;	    ES:di -> bds table
 14197                                  ;

 14199                                  ;						 = 1 if disk i/o allowed.
 14200                                  ; ==========================================================================

 14202                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14203                                  GetAccessFlag:
 14204 00001286 C51E[1200]              		lds	bx, [ptrsav]	; DS:BX	points to request header
 14205 0000128A C55F13                  		lds	bx, [bx+19]	; [bx+IOCTL_REQ.GENERICIOCTL_PACKET]
 14206                                  		;mov	al, 0		; Assume result	is unformatted
 14207                                  		; 10/12/2022

 14209                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14210 0000128F 26F6452402              		test	byte [es:di+36], 02h
 14211                                  		;test	word [es:di+35], 200h ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 14212                                  					; unformatted_media
 14213 00001294 7501                    		jnz	short GafDone	; Done if unformatted
 14214                                  		;inc	al		; Return true for formatted
 14215                                  		; 24/12/2023
 14216 00001296 40                      		inc	ax
 14217                                  GafDone:
 14218 00001297 884701                  		mov	[bx+1],	al	; [bx+A_DISKACCESS_CONTROL.DAC_ACCESS_FLAG]
 14219 0000129A C3                      		retn
 14220                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14221

 14245 000012AB 7505                    		jnz	short saf_Done

 14256                                  ; ==========================================================================
 14257                                  ; Ioctl_Support_Query
 14258                                  ; ==========================================================================
 14259                                  ;
 14260                                  ; New device command which was added in DOS 5.00 to allow a query of a 
 14261                                  ; specific GENERIC IOCtl to see if it is supported. Bit 7 in the
 14262                                  ; device attributes specifies if this function is supported.
 14263                                  ;
 14264                                  ; ==========================================================================
 14265                                  
 14266                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14267                                  ioctl_support_query:
 14268 000012B3 06                      		push	es
 14269 000012B4 C41E[1200]              		les	bx, [ptrsav]	; ES:BX Points to request header.
 14270 000012B8 268B470D                		mov	ax, [es:bx+13]	; [es:bx+IOCTL_REQ.MAJORFUNCTION]
 14271                                  					; AL ==	Major, AH == Minor
 14272                                  
 14273                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 14274                                  		;cmp	al, 48h		; IOC_NEW_DC (PCDOS 7.1)
 14275                                  		;			; new generic ioctl function (FAT32)
 14276                                  		;jz	short ioctl_support
 14277                                  
 14278 000012BC 3C08                    		cmp	al, 8		; IOC_DC
 14279                                  					; See if major code is 8
 14280 000012BE 7513                    		jnz	short nosupport
 14281                                  ioctl_support:
 14282 000012C0 0E                      		push	cs
 14283 000012C1 07                      		pop	es
 14284                                  		; 02/09/2023
 14285                                  		;mov	cx, 14          ; (PCDOS 7.1) IOC_DC_TABLE_LEN
 14286 000012C2 B90B00                  		mov	cx, 11		; IOC_DC_TABLE_LEN
 14287                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14288 000012C5 BF[B80C]                		mov	di, IOC_DC_Table
 14289                                  		;mov	di, 0C60h	; IOC_DC_Table
 14290                                  					; at 2C7h:0C60h	= 70h:31D0h
 14291 000012C8 86E0                    		xchg	al, ah		; Put minor code in AL
 14292 000012CA F2AE                    		repne scasb		; Scan for minor code in AL
 14293 000012CC 7505                    		jnz	short nosupport	; it was not found
 14294 000012CE B80001                  		mov	ax, 100h
 14295                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14296                                  		; (jump to ioctlsupexit is not required)
 14297                                  		;jmp	short $+2	; ioctlsupexit
 14298                                  					; Signal ioctl is supported
 14299                                  		;;jmp	short ioctlsupexit
 14300                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14301                                  ioctlsupexit:
 14302 000012D1 07                      		pop	es
 14303                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14304                                  		; cf = 0
 14305                                  		;clc
 14306 000012D2 C3                      		retn
 14307                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14308                                  nosupport:
 14309 000012D3 07                      		pop	es
 14310 000012D4 E9FEED                  		jmp	bc_cmderr

 14315                                  ; ==========================================================================
 14316                                  ;	GetMediaSenseStatus
 14317                                  ; ==========================================================================
 14318                                  ;
 14319                                  ; FUNCTION: Will return the type of diskette media in the specified DOS
 14320                                  ;	    diskette drive and whether the media is the default type
 14321                                  ;	    for that drive. (default type means the max size for that
 14322                                  ;	    drive)
 14323                                  ;
 14324                                  ; INPUT :   ES:DI -> BDS table
 14325                                  ; OUTPUT:   If carry clear
 14326                                  ;	    DS:BX -> Updated IOCtlPacket
 14327                                  ;
 14328                                  ;			 Special Function at offset 0:
 14329                                  ;				0	- Media detected is not default type
 14330                                  ;				1	- Media detected is default type
 14331                                  ;
 14332                                  ;			 Device Type at offset 1:
 14333                                  ;				2       - 720K 3.5" 80 tracks
 14334                                  ;				7	- 1.44M 3.5" 80 tracks
 14335                                  ;				9	- 2.88M 3.5" 80 tracks
 14336                                  ;
 14337                                  ; Error Codes returned in AX if carry set:
 14338                                  ;
 14339                                  ; 8102 - Drive not ready	- No disk is in the drive.
 14340                                  ; 8107 - Unknown media type	- Drive doesn't support this function or
 14341                                  ;				  the media is really unkown, any error
 14342                                  ;				  other than "media not present"
 14343                                  ; 
 14344                                  ; ==========================================================================
 14345                                  
 14346                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14347                                  SenseMediaType:				
 14348 000012D7 C51E[1200]              		lds	bx, [ptrsav]	; DS:BX	points to request header.
 14349 000012DB C55F13                  		lds	bx, [bx+19]	; bx+IOCTL_REQ.GENERICIOCTL_PACKET]
 14350                                  		; 10/10/2022
 14351                                  		;mov	word [bx], 0	; Initialize the 2 packet bytes
 14352 000012DE 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 14353 000012E0 8917                    		mov	[bx], dx ; 0
 14354                                  		;
 14355 000012E2 268A5504                		mov	dl, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 14356                                  					; Get int 13h drive number from	BDS
 14357                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14358                                  		;xor	dh, dh		; DX = physical	drive number
 14359 000012E6 B420                    		mov	ah, 20h		; Get Media Type function
 14360                                  					; If no	carry media type in AL
 14361 000012E8 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - QCACHE	- DISMOUNT
 14362 000012EA 7216                    		jb	short MediaSenseEr ; error code	in AH
 14363 000012EC FE07                    		inc	byte [bx]	; Signal media type is default (bit 1)
 14364                                  DetermineMediaType:			
 14365 000012EE FEC8                    		dec	al
 14366 000012F0 3C02                    		cmp	al, 2		; Chk for 720K ie: (3-1) = 2
 14367 000012F2 740A                    		jz	short GotMediaType
 14368 000012F4 0404                    		add	al, 4
 14369 000012F6 3C07                    		cmp	al, 7		; Chk for 1.44M ie: (4-1+4) = 7
 14370 000012F8 7404                    		jz	short GotMediaType
 14371 000012FA 3C09                    		cmp	al, 9		; Chk for 2.88M	ie: (6-1+4) = 9
 14372 000012FC 7510                    		jnz	short UnknownMediaType ; Just didn't recognize media type
 14373                                  GotMediaType:				
 14374 000012FE 884701                  		mov	[bx+1],	al	; Save the return value
 14375                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14376                                  		; cf = 0
 14377                                  		;clc			; Signal success
 14378 00001301 C3                      		retn
 14379                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14380                                  
 14381                                  MediaSenseEr:				
 14382 00001302 80FC32                  		cmp	ah, 32h		; See if not default media error
 14383 00001305 74E7                    		jz	short DetermineMediaType ; Not really an error
 14384 00001307 B002                    		mov	al, 2		; Now assume drive not ready
 14385 00001309 80FC31                  		cmp	ah, 31h		; See if media was present
 14386 0000130C 7402                    		jz	short SenseErrExit ; Return drive not ready
 14387                                  UnknownMediaType:			
 14388 0000130E B007                    		mov	al, 7		; Just don't know the media type
 14389                                  SenseErrExit:				
 14390 00001310 B481                    		mov	ah, 81h		; Signal error return
 14391 00001312 F9                      		stc
 14392 00001313 C3                      		retn
 14393                                  
 14394                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14395                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14396                                  		;db    0
 14397                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14398                                  
 14399                                  ; 16/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 14400                                  
 14401                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14402                                  ; MSINT13.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
 14403                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14404                                  ; 16/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 14405                                  
 14406                                  ;	int 2f function 13h allows the user to change the orig13 int_13 vector
 14407                                  ;	after booting. this allows testing and implementation of custom int_13
 14408                                  ;	handlers, without giving up ms-dos error recovery
 14409                                  ;	entry:	ds:dx	== addr. of new int_13 handler
 14410                                  ;		es:bx	== addr. of new int_13 vector used by warm boot (int19)
 14411                                  ;	exit:	orig13	== address of new int_13 handler
 14412                                  ;		ds:dx	== old orig13 value
 14413                                  ;		es:bx	== old old13  value
 14414                                  ;
 14415                                  ; int 2f handler for external block drivers to communicate with the internal
 14416                                  ; block driver in msdisk. the multiplex number chosen is 8. the handler
 14417                                  ; sets up the pointer to the request packet in [ptrsav] and then jumps to
 14418                                  ; dsk_entry, the entry point for all disk requests.
 14419                                  ;
 14420                                  ; on exit from this driver, we will return to the external driver
 14421                                  ; that issued this int 2f, and can then remove the flags from the stack.
 14422                                  ; this scheme allows us to have a small external device driver, and makes
 14423                                  ; the maintainance of the various drivers (driver and msbio) much easier,
 14424                                  ; since we only need to make changes in one place (most of the time).
 14425                                  ;
 14426                                  ;   ax=800h - check for installed handler - reserved
 14427                                  ;   ax=801h - install the bds into the linked list
 14428                                  ;   ax=802h - dos request
 14429                                  ;   ax=803h - return bds table starting pointer in ds:di
 14430                                  ;	   (ems device driver hooks int 13h to handle 16kb dma overrun
 14431                                  ;	    problem. bds table is going to be used to get head/sector
 14432                                  ;	    informations without calling generic ioctl get device parm call.)
 14433                                  
 14434                                  ;BIOSSEGMENT equ 70h
 14435                                  DOSBIOSSEG equ 0070h ; 17/10/2022	
 14436                                  
 14437                                  ;;BIOSCODE:1302h (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS)
 14438                                  
 14439                                  i2f_handler:				; here is 02C7h:1302h =	0070h:3872h
 14440 00001314 80FC13                  		cmp	ah, 13h
 14441 00001317 7413                    		jz	short int2f_replace_int13
 14442 00001319 80FC08                  		cmp	ah, 8
 14443 0000131C 7431                    		jz	short mine
 14444                                  
 14445                                  ; Check for WIN386 startup and return the BIOS instance data
 14446                                  
 14447 0000131E 80FC16                  		cmp	ah, 16h		; MultWin386
 14448 00001321 746C                    		jz	short win386call
 14449 00001323 80FC4A                  		cmp	ah, 4Ah		; multMULT
 14450 00001326 7503                    		jnz	short i2f_handler_iret
 14451 00001328 E99700                  		jmp	handle_multmult
 14452                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14453                                  
 14454                                  i2f_handler_iret:			
 14455 0000132B CF                      		iret
 14456                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14457

 14461                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h] ; 15/10/2022

 14463                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 14464 0000132F 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD] ; 17/10/2022
 14465                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14466                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Orig13	; save old value of old13 and
 14467                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Orig13+2	; orig13 so that we can
 14468                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Old13	; return them to caller
 14469                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Old13+2
 14470                                  		
 14471                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 14472                                  		;push	word [Orig13]
 14473 00001334 FF36[B600]              		push	word [Orig13+2]
 14474                                  		;push	word [Old13]
 14475 00001338 FF36[0801]              		push	word [Old13+2]
 14476                                  
 14477                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Orig13, dx	; orig13 := addr. of new int_13
 14478                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Orig13+2, ax
 14479                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Old13, bx	; old13 := addr. of new boot_13
 14480                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Old13+2, es
 14481                                  		
 14482                                  		;mov	[Orig13], dx
 14483                                  		; 02/09/2023
 14484 0000133C 8716[B400]              		xchg	dx, [Orig13]
 14485 00001340 A3[B600]                		mov	[Orig13+2], ax
 14486                                  		;mov	[Old13], bx
 14487                                  		; 02/09/2023
 14488 00001343 871E[0601]              		xchg	bx, [Old13]
 14489 00001347 8C06[0801]              		mov	[Old13+2], es
 14490

 14492                                  		; 02/09/2023

 14494 0000134C 1F                      		pop	ds			; ds:dx := old orig13 vector
 14495                                  		;pop	dx ; 02/09/2023
 14496 0000134D 58                      		pop	ax

 14577                                  ; WIN386 startup stuff is done here. If starting up we set our WIN386 present
 14578                                  ; flag and return instance data. If exiting, we reset the WIN386 present flag
 14579                                  ; NOTE: We assume that the BIOS int 2fh is at the bottom of the chain.

 14581                                  win386call:				
 14582 0000138F 1E                      		push	ds
 14583 00001390 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 14584                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 14585                                  					; at 2C7h:30h =	70h:25A0h

 14587                                  					; is it	win386 initializing?

 14589 00001399 3C06                    		cmp	al, 6		; Win386_Exit
 14590                                  					; is it	win386 exiting?
 14591 0000139B 7523                    		jnz	short win_iret	; if not, continue int2f chain
 14592                                  		; 12/12/2022
 14593 0000139D F6C201                  		test	dl, 1
 14594                                  		;test	dx, 1		; is it	win386 or win286 dos extender?
 14595 000013A0 751E                    		jnz	short win_iret	; if not win386, then continue
 14596                                  		;and	ds:IsWin386, 0	; indicate that	win386 is not present

 14624                                  handle_multmult:

 14628 000013C7 E84500                  		call	HMAPtr		; get offset of free HMA
 14629                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14630                                  		;xor	bx, bx
 14631                                  		;dec	bx
 14632 000013CA BBFFFF                  		mov	bx, 0FFFFh
 14633 000013CD 8EC3                    		mov	es, bx		; seg of HMA
 14634 000013CF 89FB                    		mov	bx, di
 14635 000013D1 F7D3                    		not	bx
 14636 000013D3 09DB                    		or	bx, bx
 14637 000013D5 7401                    		jz	short try_1
 14638 000013D7 43                      		inc	bx
 14639                                  try_1:

 14645                                  
 14646                                  try_2:
