 14697                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14698                                  
 14699                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14700                                  
 14701                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14702                                  ;
 14703                                  ; procedure : HMAPtr
 14704                                  ;
 14705                                  ;		Gets the offset of the free HMA area ( with respect to
 14706                                  ;							seg ffff )
 14707                                  ;		If DOS has not moved high, tries to move DOS high.
 14708                                  ;		In the course of doing this, it will allocate all the HMA
 14709                                  ;		and set the FreeHMAPtr to past the end of the BIOS and 
 14710                                  ;		DOS code. The call to MoveDOSIntoHMA (which is a pointer)
 14711                                  ;		enters the routine in sysinit1 called FTryToMovDOSHi.
 14712                                  ;
 14713                                  ;	RETURNS : offset of free HMA in DI
 14714                                  ;		  BIOS_DATA, seg in DS
 14715                                  ;
 14716                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14717                                  
 14718                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14719                                  HMAPtr:
 14720 0000140F 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 14721                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 14722 00001414 8B3E[8C08]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 14723                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 14724 00001418 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 14725 0000141B 750F                    		jnz	short HMAPtr_retn
 14726 0000141D 803E[9208]00            		cmp	byte [SysinitPresent], 0
 14727                                  		;cmp	ds:SysinitPresent, 0
 14728 00001422 7408                    		jz	short HMAPtr_retn
 14729 00001424 FF1E[8E08]              		call	far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 14730                                  		;call	ds:MoveDOSIntoHMA ; call far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 14731 00001428 8B3E[8C08]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 14732                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 14733                                  HMAPtr_retn:				
 14734 0000142C C3                      		retn
 14735                                  
 14736                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14737                                  
 14738                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14739                                  
 14740                                  ; move a 512 byte sector from ds:si to es:di, do not trash cx
 14741                                  ; but go ahead and update direction flag, si, & di
 14742                                  
 14743                                  move_sector:
 14744                                  
 14745                                  ; The 80386 microprocessor considers an access to WORD 0FFFFh in
 14746                                  ; any segment to be a fault. Theoretically, this could be handled
 14747                                  ; by the fault handler and the behavior of an 8086 could be emulated
 14748                                  ; by wrapping the high byte to offset 0000h. This would be a lot
 14749                                  ; of work and was, indeed, blown off by the Win386 guys. COMPAQ
 14750                                  ; also handles the fault incorrectly in their ROM BIOS for real
 14751                                  ; mode. Their fault handler was only designed to deal with one
 14752                                  ; special case which occurred in a magazine benchmark, but didn't
 14753                                  ; handle the general case worth beans.
 14754                                  ;
 14755                                  ; Simply changing this code to do a byte loop would work okay but
 14756                                  ; would involve a general case performance hit. Therefore, we'll
 14757                                  ; check for either source or destination offsets being within one
 14758                                  ; sector of the end of their segments and only in that case fall
 14759                                  ; back to a byte move.
 14760                                  
 14761 0000142D FC                      		cld
 14762 0000142E 51                      		push	cx
 14763 0000142F B90001                  		mov	cx, 256
 14764 00001432 81FE00FE                		cmp	si, 0FE00h
 14765 00001436 770A                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 14766 00001438 81FF00FE                		cmp	di, 0FE00h
 14767 0000143C 7704                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 14768 0000143E F3A5                    		rep movsw
 14769 00001440 59                      		pop	cx
 14770 00001441 C3                      		retn
 14771                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14772                                  
 14773                                  movsec_bytes:				
 14774 00001442 D1E1                    		shl	cx, 1
 14775 00001444 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 14776 00001446 59                      		pop	cx
 14777 00001447 C3                      		retn
 14778                                  
 14779                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14780                                  
 14781                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14782                                  
 14783                                  ; check_wrap is a routine that adjusts the starting sector, starting head
 14784                                  ; and starting cylinder for an int 13 request that requests i/o of a lot
 14785                                  ; of sectors. it only does this for fixed disks. it is used in the sections
 14786                                  ; of code that handle ecc errors and dma errors. it is necessary, because
 14787                                  ; ordinarily the rom would take care of wraps around heads and cylinders,
 14788                                  ; but we break down a request when we get an ecc or dma error into several
 14789                                  ; i/o of one or more sectors. in this case, we may already be beyond the
 14790                                  ; number of sectors on a track on the medium, and the request would fail.
 14791                                  ;
 14792                                  ; input conditions:
 14793                                  ;	all registers set up for an int 13 request.
 14794                                  ;
 14795                                  ; output:
 14796                                  ;	dh - contains starting head number for request
 14797                                  ;	cx - contains starting sector and cylinder numbers
 14798                                  ;	(the above may or may not have been changed, and are 0-based)
 14799                                  ;	all other registers preserved.
 14800                                  
 14801                                  check_wrap:	
 14802 00001448 50                      		push	ax
 14803 00001449 53                      		push	bx
 14804 0000144A 06                      		push	es
 14805 0000144B 57                      		push	di
 14806 0000144C E86C00                  		call	find_bds	; get pointer to bds for drive in dl
 14807 0000144F 725E                    		jb	short no_wrap	; finished if DOS doesn't use it
 14808                                  		; 12/12/2022
 14809 00001451 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 14810                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 14811 00001456 7457                    		jz	short no_wrap	; no wrapping for removable media
 14812 00001458 268B5D13                		mov	bx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 14813 0000145C 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
 14814 0000145E 83E03F                  		and	ax, 3Fh		; extract sector number
 14815 00001461 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx		; are we going to wrap?
 14816 00001463 764A                    		jbe	short no_wrap
 14817 00001465 F6F3                    		div	bl		; ah=new sector	#, al=#	of head	wraps
 14818                                  
 14819                                  ; we need to be careful here. if the new sector # is 0, then we are on the
 14820                                  ; last sector on that track.
 14821                                  
 14822 00001467 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
 14823 00001469 7503                    		jnz	short not_on_bound
 14824                                  		; 18/12/2022
 14825 0000146B 48                      		dec	ax ; *
 14826 0000146C 88DC                    		mov	ah, bl		; set sector=BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK
 14827                                  					; if on	boundary
 14828                                  		;dec	al ; *		; also decrement # of head wraps
 14829                                  not_on_bound:
 14830 0000146E 80E1C0                  		and	cl, 0C0h	; zero out sector #
 14831 00001471 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; or in	new sector #
 14832 00001473 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; ax = # of head wraps
 14833 00001475 40                      		inc	ax
 14834 00001476 00F0                    		add	al, dh		; add in starting head #
 14835 00001478 80D400                  		adc	ah, 0		; catch	any carry
 14836                                  		; 02/09/2023
 14837 0000147B 268B5D15                		mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 14838 0000147F 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx
 14839                                  		;cmp	ax, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 14840                                  					; are we going to wrap around a	head?
 14841 00001481 7632                    		jbe	short no_wrap_head ; do	not lose new head number!!
 14842 00001483 52                      		push	dx		; preserve drive number and head number
 14843 00001484 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 14844                                  		;mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 14845 00001486 F7F3                    		div	bx		; dx=new head #, ax=# of cylinder wraps
 14846                                  
 14847                                  ; careful here! if new head # is 0, then we are on the last head.
 14848                                  
 14849 00001488 09D2                    		or	dx, dx
 14850 0000148A 7507                    		jnz	short no_head_bound
 14851 0000148C 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		; on boundary. set to BDS_BPB.BPB_HEADS
 14852                                  
 14853                                  ; if we had some cylinder wraps, we need to reduce them by one!!
 14854                                  
 14855 0000148E 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
 14856 00001490 7401                    		jz	short no_head_bound
 14857 00001492 48                      		dec	ax		; reduce number	of cylinder wraps
 14858                                  no_head_bound:				
 14859 00001493 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; bh has new head number
 14860 00001495 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore drive number and head number
 14861 00001496 FECF                    		dec	bh		; get it 0-based
 14862 00001498 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; set up new head number in dh
 14863 0000149A 88CF                    		mov	bh, cl
 14864 0000149C 80E73F                  		and	bh, 3Fh		; preserve sector number
 14865 0000149F B306                    		mov	bl, 6
 14866 000014A1 86D9                    		xchg	cl, bl
 14867 000014A3 D2EB                    		shr	bl, cl		; get ms cylinder bits to ls end
 14868 000014A5 00C5                    		add	ch, al		; add in cylinder wrap
 14869 000014A7 10E3                    		adc	bl, ah		; add in high byte
 14870 000014A9 D2E3                    		shl	bl, cl		; move up to ms	end
 14871 000014AB 86CB                    		xchg	bl, cl		; restore cylinder bits	into cl
 14872 000014AD 08F9                    		or	cl, bh		; or in	sector number
 14873                                  no_wrap:				
 14874 000014AF F8                      		clc
 14875 000014B0 5F                      		pop	di
 14876 000014B1 07                      		pop	es
 14877 000014B2 5B                      		pop	bx
 14878 000014B3 58                      		pop	ax
 14879 000014B4 C3                      		retn
 14880                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14881                                  
 14882                                  no_wrap_head:				
 14883 000014B5 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; do not lose new head number
 14884 000014B7 FECE                    		dec	dh		; get it 0-based
 14885 000014B9 EBF4                    		jmp	short no_wrap
 14886                                  
 14887                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14888                                  
 14889                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14890                                  
 14891                                  ; this is a special version of the bds lookup code which is
 14892                                  ; based on physical drives rather than the usual logical drives
 14893                                  ; carry is set if the physical drive in dl is found, es:di -> its bds
 14894                                  ; otherwise carry is clear
 14895                                  ;
 14896                                  ; guaranteed to trash no registers except es:di
 14897                                  
 14898                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14899                                  find_bds:	
 14900 000014BB C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds]	; point es:di to first bds
 14901                                  fbds_1:					
 14902 000014BF 26385504                		cmp	[es:di+4], dl	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 14903 000014C3 7409                    		jz	short fdbs_2
 14904 000014C5 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 14905                                  					; go to next bds
 14906 000014C8 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 14907 000014CB 75F2                    		jnz	short fbds_1
 14908 000014CD F9                      		stc
 14909                                  fdbs_2:					
 14910 000014CE C3                      		retn
 14911                                  
 14912                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14913                                  
 14914                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14915                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14916                                  doint:
 14917                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14918 000014CF 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14919                                  					; get physical drive number
 14920                                  		; 19/10/2022 - Temporary !
 14921                                  		;db	8Ah, 96h, 8, 0	; mov dl, [bp+8]	
 14922                                  		
 14923 000014D2 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 14924 000014D4 08C0                    		or	al, al
 14925 000014D6 7410                    		jz	short dointdone	; if zero sectors, return ax=0
 14926                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14927 000014D8 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 14928                                  					; get request code
 14929                                  		;db	8Ah, 0A6h, 3, 0	; mov ah, [bp+3]
 14930 000014DB FF7610                  		push	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 14931                                  		;db	0FFh, 0B6h, 10h, 0 ; push word [bp+10h]
 14932 000014DE 9D                      		popf
 14933                                  		;call	far 70h:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:14EAh
 14934                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14935 000014DF 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14936                                  		;;call	call_orig13	; call far 70h:797h
 14937                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14938 000014E4 9C                      		pushf
 14939                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14940 000014E5 8F4610                  		pop	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 14941                                  		;db	8Fh, 86h, 10h, 0 ; pop word [bp+10h]
 14942                                  dointdone:				
 14943 000014E8 C3                      		retn
 14944                                  
 14945                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14946                                  
 14947                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14948                                  
 14949                                  ; this is the true int 13 handler. we parse the request to see if there is
 14950                                  ; a dma violation. if so, depending on the function, we:
 14951                                  ;   read/write break the request into three pieces and move the middle one
 14952                                  ;	       into our internal buffer.
 14953                                  ;
 14954                                  ;   format     copy the format table into the buffer
 14955                                  ;   verify     point the transfer address into the buffer
 14956                                  ;
 14957                                  ; this is the biggest bogosity of all. the ibm controller does not handle
 14958                                  ; operations that cross physical 64k boundaries. in these cases, we copy
 14959                                  ; the offending sector into the buffer below and do the i/o from there.
 14960                                  
 14961                                  ;struc INT13FRAME
 14962                                  ;.oldbp: resw
 14963                                  ;.oldax: resw 
 14964                                  ;.oldbx: resw
 14965                                  ;.oldcx: resw
 14966                                  ;.olddx: resw
 14967                                  ;.oldds: resw	; now we save caller's ds, too
 14968                                  ;.olddd: resd
 14969                                  ;.oldf:	resw
 14970                                  ;end struc
 14971                                  
 14972                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14973                                  
 14974                                  ;   entry conditions:
 14975                                  ;	ah = function
 14976                                  ;	al = number of sectors
 14977                                  ;	es:bx = dma address
 14978                                  ;	cx = packed track and sector
 14979                                  ;	dx = head and drive
 14980                                  ;   output conditions:
 14981                                  ;	no dma violation.
 14982                                  
 14983                                  ;	use extreme caution when working with this code. In general,
 14984                                  ;	  all registers are hot at all times.
 14985                                  ;
 14986                                  ;	question:  does this code handle cases where dma errors
 14987                                  ;	  occur during ecc retries, and where ecc errors occur during
 14988                                  ;	  dma breakdowns???? Hmmmmm.
 14989                                  
 14990                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14991                                  
 14992                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14993                                  
 14994 000014E9 90004000                dtype_array:	dd 400090h		; 40:90	is drive type array
 14995                                  
 14996                                  ; 17/10/2022
 14997                                  ;DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h ; (14F5h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 14998                                  ; 09/12/2022
 14999                                  DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array
 15000                                  
 15001                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15002                                  
 15003                                  ; stick some special stuff out of mainline
 15004                                  
 15005                                  ; we know we're doing a format command. if we have changeline
 15006                                  ; support, then flag some special changed stuff and set changed
 15007                                  ; by format bit for all logical drives using this physical drive
 15008                                  
 15009                                  format_special_stuff:
 15010 000014ED 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; do we have changeline support?
 15011 000014F2 7459                    		jz	short format_special_stuff_done ; brif not
 15012 000014F4 53                      		push	bx
 15013 000014F5 BB4001                  		mov	bx, 140h	; fchanged_by_format+fchanged
 15014 000014F8 E83D04                  		call	set_changed_dl	; indicate that media changed by format
 15015 000014FB 5B                      		pop	bx
 15016 000014FC EB4F                    		jmp	short format_special_stuff_done
 15017                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15018                                  
 15019                                  ; 16/10/2022
 15020                                  
 15021                                  ; we know we've got ec35's on the system. Now see if we're doing
 15022                                  ; a floppy. If so, create a mask and see if this particular
 15023                                  ; drive is an ec35. If so, set dtype_array[drive]=93h
 15024                                  
 15025                                  		; 19/10/2022
 15026                                  ec35_special_stuff:
 15027 000014FE 84D2                    		test	dl, dl		; floppy or hard disk?
 15028 00001500 7852                    		js	short ec35_special_stuff_done ;	if hard	drive, we're done
 15029 00001502 50                      		push	ax		; see if this PARTICULAR drive is ec35
 15030 00001503 51                      		push	cx
 15031 00001504 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl		; turn drive number into bit map
 15032 00001506 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; assume drive 0
 15033 00001508 D2E0                    		shl	al, cl		; shift	over correct number of times
 15034 0000150A 8406[2005]              		test	[ec35flag], al	; electrically compatible 3.5 incher?
 15035 0000150E 59                      		pop	cx
 15036 0000150F 58                      		pop	ax
 15037 00001510 7442                    		jz	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 15038                                  					; done if this floppy is not an	ec35
 15039 00001512 53                      		push	bx		; free up a far	pointer	(es:bx)
 15040 00001513 06                      		push	es
 15041                                  		; 17/10/2022
 15042 00001514 2EC41E[E914]            		les	bx, [cs:DTYPEARRAY]
 15043                                  		;les	bx, dword ptr cs:DTYPEARRAY ; [cs:dtype_array]
 15044                                  					; 0070h:3A65h =	2C7h:14F5h
 15045 00001519 00D3                    		add	bl, dl
 15046 0000151B 80D700                  		adc	bh, 0		; find entry for this drive
 15047 0000151E 26C60793                		mov	byte [es:bx], 93h ; establish drive type as:
 15048                                  					; (360k	disk in	360k drive,
 15049                                  					; no double-stepping, 250 kbs transfer rate)
 15050 00001522 07                      		pop	es
 15051 00001523 5B                      		pop	bx
 15052 00001524 EB2E                    		jmp	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 15053                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15054                                  
 15055                                  ; 16/10/2022
 15056                                  
 15057                                  ; ps2_30 machine has some problem with ah=8h (read drive parm), int 13h.
 15058                                  ; this function does not reset the common buses after the execution.
 15059                                  ; to solve this problem, when we detect ah=8h, then we will save the result and
 15060                                  ; will issue ah=1 (read status) call to reset the buses.
 15061                                  
 15062                                  ps2_special_stuff:
 15063 00001526 803E[1E00]08            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 8 ; (ps2_30)
 15064                                  					; read driver parm ?
 15065 0000152B 7407                    		jz	short ps2_30_problem
 15066 0000152D 803E[1E00]15            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 15h
 15067                                  					; apparently function 15h fails, too
 15068 00001532 752D                    		jnz	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 15069                                  ps2_30_problem:
 15070 00001534 50                      		push	ax
 15071 00001535 B401                    		mov	ah, 1
 15072                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1543h
 15073                                  		; 17/10/2022
 15074 00001537 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 15075                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far 70:797h
 15076                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 15077 0000153C 58                      		pop	ax
 15078 0000153D EB22                    		jmp	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 15079                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15080                                  
 15081                                  ; 17/10/2022
 15082                                  ; 16/10/2022
 15083                                  
 15084                                  ; here is the actual int13 handler
 15085                                  
 15086                                  i13z:					; 0070h:3ABBh =	02C7h:154Bh
 15087                                  
 15088                                  ; cas -- inefficient! could push ds and load ds-> Bios_Data before
 15089                                  ; vectoring up here from Bios_Data
 15090                                  
 15091                                  		; 19/10/2022
 15092 0000153F 1E                      		push	ds		; save caller's ds register first thing
 15093                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h]
 15094                                  					; and set up our own ds -> Bios_Data
 15095 00001540 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 15096                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 15097                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 15098                                  
 15099                                  ; let the operation proceed. if there is a dma violation, then we do things
 15100                                  
 15101 00001545 A3[1E00]                		mov	[prevoper], ax	; save request
 15102 00001548 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 15103 0000154B 74A0                    		jz	short format_special_stuff
 15104                                  					; go do special stuff for format
 15105                                  format_special_stuff_done:		
 15106 0000154D 803E[2005]00            		cmp	byte [ec35flag], 0 ; any electrically compat 3.5 inchers?
 15107 00001552 75AA                    		jnz	short ec35_special_stuff
 15108                                  					; go handle it out of line if so
 15109                                  ec35_special_stuff_done:
 15110                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1560h
 15111 00001554 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 15112                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 15113                                  		
 15114 00001559 9C                      		pushf			; save result flags
 15115                                  		
 15116 0000155A 803E[2D06]FA            		cmp	byte [model_byte], 0FAh ; is this a ps2/30?
 15117                                  					; mdl_ps2_30
 15118 0000155F 74C5                    		jz	short ps2_special_stuff
 15119                                  					; exit mainline to address special
 15120                                  ps2_special_stuff_done:			; ps2/30 problem if so
 15121 00001561 9D                      		popf
 15122 00001562 7221                    		jb	short goterr13	; error	on original orig13 call-thru?
 15123                                  ret_from_i13:
 15124 00001564 1F                      		pop	ds
 15125 00001565 CA0200                  		retf	2		; restore ds &	iret w/flags
 15126                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15127                                  
 15128                                  ; most of our code exits through here. If carry isn't set, then
 15129                                  ; just do a simple exit. Else doublecheck that we aren't getting
 15130                                  ; a changeline error.
 15131                                  
 15132                                  i13ret_ck_chglinerr:
 15133 00001568 73FA                    		jnb	short ret_from_i13 ; done if not an error termination
 15134                                  i13_ret_error:				
 15135 0000156A 80FC06                  		cmp	ah, 6		; did i	see a change event?
 15136 0000156D 7513                    		jnz	short int13b	; skip if wrong	error
 15137 0000156F 08D2                    		or	dl, dl		; is this for the hard disk?
 15138 00001571 780F                    		js	short int13b	; yes, ignore
 15139 00001573 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
 15140 00001578 7408                    		jz	short int13b	; just in case ROM returned this
 15141                                  					; error	even though it told us it
 15142                                  					; never	would
 15143 0000157A 53                      		push	bx
 15144 0000157B BB4000                  		mov	bx, 40h		; fchanged
 15145 0000157E E8B703                  		call	set_changed_dl
 15146 00001581 5B                      		pop	bx
 15147                                  int13b:
 15148 00001582 F9                      		stc			; now return the error
 15149 00001583 EBDF                    		jmp	short ret_from_i13
 15150                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15151                                  
 15152                                  ; some kind of error occurred. see if it is dma violation
 15153                                  
 15154                                  goterr13:
 15155 00001585 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; dma error?
 15156 00001588 747C                    		jz	short gotdmaerr
 15157                                  goterr13_xxxx:
 15158 0000158A 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; ecc error?
 15159 0000158D 75DB                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error ; other error. just	return back.
 15160 0000158F 803E[2706]01            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 1 ; formatting?
 15161 00001594 74D4                    		jz	short i13_ret_error
 15162                                  
 15163 00001596 803E[1F00]02            		cmp	byte [prevoper+1], 2
 15164                                  		;cmp	byte ptr ds:prevoper+1,	2 ; ecc-corrected error
 15165                                  					; (2 = romread)
 15166                                  					; ECC correction only applies to reads
 15167 0000159B 75CD                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error
 15168                                  
 15169 0000159D 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 15170                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15ABh
 15171                                  		; 17/10/2022
 15172 0000159F 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 15173                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 15174                                  					; call far 70:797h
 15175 000015A4 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]
 15176 000015A7 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; return code =	no error
 15177 000015A9 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1		; if request for one sector, assume ok
 15178 000015AB 74B7                    		jz	short ret_from_i13 ; return with carry clear
 15179 000015AD 53                      		push	bx
 15180 000015AE 51                      		push	cx
 15181 000015AF 52                      		push	dx
 15182 000015B0 A2[2000]                		mov	[number_of_sec], al
 15183                                  loop_ecc:
 15184 000015B3 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 15185                                  
 15186                                  ; we do reads one sector at a time. this ensures that we will eventually
 15187                                  ; finish the request since ecc errors on one sector do read in that sector.
 15188                                  ;
 15189                                  ; we need to put in some "intelligence" into the ecc handler to handle reads
 15190                                  ; that attempt to read more sectors than are available on a particular
 15191                                  ; track.
 15192                                  ;
 15193                                  ; we call check_wrap to set up the sector #, head # and cylinder # for
 15194                                  ; this request.
 15195                                  ;
 15196                                  ; at this point, all registers are set up for the call to orig13, except
 15197                                  ; that there may be a starting sector number that is bigger than the number
 15198                                  ; of sectors on a track.
 15199                                  ;
 15200 000015B6 E88FFE                  		call	check_wrap	; get correct parameters for int 13
 15201                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15C5h
 15202                                  		; 17/10/2022
 15203 000015B9 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 15204                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 15205 000015BE 730C                    		jnb	short ok11_op
 15206 000015C0 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; DMA error during ECC read?
 15207 000015C3 741B                    		jz	short handle_dma_during_ecc
 15208 000015C5 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; only allow ecc errors
 15209 000015C8 7510                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err
 15210                                  		; 10/12/2022
 15211                                  		; xor ax ax -> ah = 0
 15212                                  		;mov	ah, 0		; ecc error. reset the system again.
 15213 000015CA 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; clear	the error code so that if this
 15214                                  					; was the last sector, no error	code
 15215                                  					; will be returned for the corrected
 15216                                  					; read.	(clear carry too.)
 15217                                  ok11_op:
 15218 000015CC FE0E[2000]              		dec	byte [number_of_sec]
 15219 000015D0 7409                    		jz	short ok11_exit	; all done?
 15220 000015D2 FEC1                    		inc	cl		; advance sector number
 15221                                  					; add 200h to address
 15222 000015D4 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 15223 000015D6 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 15224 000015D8 EBD9                    		jmp	short loop_ecc
 15225                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15226                                  
 15227                                  ; locate error returns centrally
 15228                                  
 15229                                  ok11_exit_err:
 15230 000015DA F9                      		stc			; set carry bit again.
 15231                                  ok11_exit:
 15232 000015DB 5A                      		pop	dx
 15233 000015DC 59                      		pop	cx
 15234 000015DD 5B                      		pop	bx
 15235 000015DE EB88                    		jmp	short i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 15236                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15237                                  
 15238                                  ; do the single sector read again, this time into our temporary
 15239                                  ; buffer, which is guaranteed not to have a DMA error, then
 15240                                  ; move the data to its proper location and proceed
 15241                                  
 15242                                  handle_dma_during_ecc:
 15243 000015E0 06                      		push	es
 15244 000015E1 53                      		push	bx
 15245 000015E2 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 15246 000015E5 1E                      		push	ds
 15247 000015E6 07                      		pop	es		; point es:bx to buffer
 15248 000015E7 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 15249                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15F8h
 15250                                  		; 17/10/2022
 15251 000015EA 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 15252                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 15253 000015EF 5B                      		pop	bx
 15254 000015F0 07                      		pop	es
 15255 000015F1 7305                    		jnb	short handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr
 15256 000015F3 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h
 15257 000015F6 75E2                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err ; if anything but ecc error, bomb out
 15258                                  
 15259                                  ; now we're kosher. Copy the data to where it belongs and resume
 15260                                  ; the ECC looping code.
 15261                                  
 15262                                  handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr:
 15263 000015F8 56                      		push	si
 15264 000015F9 57                      		push	di
 15265 000015FA 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 15266 000015FC BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 15267 000015FF E82BFE                  		call	move_sector
 15268 00001602 5F                      		pop	di
 15269 00001603 5E                      		pop	si
 15270 00001604 EBC6                    		jmp	short ok11_op
 15271                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15272                                  
 15273                                  ; we truly have a dma violation. restore register ax and retry the
 15274                                  ; operation as best we can.
 15275                                  
 15276                                  gotdmaerr:
 15277 00001606 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]	; 19/10/2022
 15278 00001609 FB                      		sti
 15279 0000160A 80FC02                  		cmp	ah, 2		; romread
 15280 0000160D 723B                    		jb	short i13_done_dmaerr
 15281                                  					; just pass dma error thru for
 15282                                  					; functions we don't handle
 15283 0000160F 80FC04                  		cmp	ah, 4		; romverify
 15284 00001612 743C                    		jz	short intverify
 15285 00001614 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 15286 00001617 7448                    		jz	short intformat
 15287 00001619 772F                    		ja	short i13_done_dmaerr
 15288                                  
 15289                                  ; we are doing a read/write call. check for dma problems
 15290                                  
 15291                                  ;	******** set up stack frame here!!! ********
 15292                                  
 15293 0000161B 52                      		push	dx
 15294 0000161C 51                      		push	cx
 15295 0000161D 53                      		push	bx
 15296 0000161E 50                      		push	ax
 15297 0000161F 55                      		push	bp
 15298 00001620 89E5                    		mov	bp, sp
 15299 00001622 8CC2                    		mov	dx, es		; check	for 64k	boundary error
 15300 00001624 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 15301 00001626 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 15302 00001628 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 15303 0000162A D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1		; segment converted to absolute	address
 15304 0000162C 01DA                    		add	dx, bx		; combine with offset
 15305 0000162E 81C2FF01                		add	dx, 511		; simulate a transfer
 15306                                  
 15307                                  ; if carry is set, then we are within 512 bytes of the end of the segment.
 15308                                  ; we skip the first transfer and perform the remaining buffering and transfer
 15309                                  
 15310 00001632 7303                    		jnb	short no_skip_first
 15311 00001634 E98300                  		jmp	bufferx		; restore dh=head & do buffer
 15312                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15313                                  
 15314                                  no_skip_first:
 15315 00001637 D0EE                    		shr	dh, 1		; dh = number of sectors before	address
 15316 00001639 B480                    		mov	ah, 128		; ah = max number of sectors in	segment
 15317 0000163B 28F4                    		sub	ah, dh
 15318                                  
 15319                                  ; ah is now the number of sectors that we can successfully write in this
 15320                                  ; segment. if this number is above or equal to the requested number, then we
 15321                                  ; continue the operation as normal. otherwise, we break it into pieces.
 15322                                  ;
 15323                                  ; wait a sec. this is goofy. the whole reason we got here in the
 15324                                  ; first place is because we got a dma error. so it's impossible
 15325                                  ; for the whole block to fit, unless the dma error was returned
 15326                                  ; in error.
 15327                                  
 15328 0000163D 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; can we fit it	in?
 15329 0000163F 7236                    		jb	short doblock	; no, perform blocking.
 15330                                  
 15331                                  ; yes, the request fits. let it happen.
 15332                                  
 15333 00001641 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 15334                                  					; set up head number
 15335 00001644 E888FE                  		call	doint
 15336 00001647 E9D900                  		jmp	bad13		; and return from this place
 15337                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15338                                  
 15339                                  i13_done_dmaerr:
 15340 0000164A B409                    		mov	ah, 9		; pass dma error thru to caller
 15341 0000164C F9                      		stc
 15342 0000164D E914FF                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; return with error,
 15343                                  					; we know it's not a changeline error
 15344                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15345                                  
 15346                                  ; verify the given sectors. place the buffer pointer into our space.
 15347                                  
 15348                                  intverify:
 15349 00001650 06                      		push	es		; save caller's dma address
 15350 00001651 53                      		push	bx
 15351 00001652 1E                      		push	ds		; es:bx	-> Bios_Data:disksector
 15352 00001653 07                      		pop	es
 15353                                  dosimple:
 15354 00001654 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 15355                                  					; do the i/o from Bios_Data:disksector
 15356                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1665h
 15357                                  		; 17/10/2022
 15358 00001657 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 15359                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 15360 0000165C 5B                      		pop	bx
 15361 0000165D 07                      		pop	es
 15362 0000165E E907FF                  		jmp	i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 15363                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15364                                  
 15365                                  ; format operation. copy the parameter table into Bios_Data:disksector
 15366                                  
 15367                                  intformat:
 15368 00001661 06                      		push	es
 15369 00001662 53                      		push	bx
 15370 00001663 56                      		push	si
 15371 00001664 57                      		push	di
 15372 00001665 1E                      		push	ds
 15373                                  
 15374                                  ; point ds to the caller's dma buffer, es to Bios_Data
 15375                                  ; in other words, swap (ds, es)
 15376                                  
 15377 00001666 06                      		push	es
 15378 00001667 1E                      		push	ds
 15379 00001668 07                      		pop	es
 15380 00001669 1F                      		pop	ds
 15381 0000166A 89DE                    		mov	si, bx
 15382 0000166C BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector
 15383 0000166F E8BBFD                  		call	move_sector	; user's data into Bios_Data:disksector
 15384 00001672 1F                      		pop	ds
 15385 00001673 5F                      		pop	di
 15386 00001674 5E                      		pop	si		; do the i/o from
 15387 00001675 EBDD                    		jmp	short dosimple	; Bios_Data:disksector
 15388                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15389                                  
 15390                                  ; we can't fit the request into the entire block. perform the operation on
 15391                                  ; the first block.
 15392                                  ;
 15393                                  ; doblock is modified to correctly handle multi-sector disk i/o.
 15394                                  ; old doblock had added the number of sectors i/oed (ah in old doblock) after
 15395                                  ; the doint call to cl. observing only the lower 6 bits of cl(=max. 64) can
 15396                                  ; represent a starting sector, if ah was big, then cl would be clobbered.
 15397                                  ; by the way, we still are going to use cl for this purpose since checkwrap
 15398                                  ; routine will use it as an input. to prevent cl from being clobbered, a
 15399                                  ; safe number of sectors should be calculated like "63 - # of sectors/track".
 15400                                  ; doblock will handle the first block of requested sectors within the
 15401                                  ; boundary of this safe value.
 15402                                  
 15403                                  doblock:
 15404                                  
 15405                                  ; try to get the # of sectors/track from bds via rom drive number.
 15406                                  ; for any mini disks installed, here we have to pray that they have the
 15407                                  ; same # of sector/track as the main dos partition disk drive.
 15408                                  				
 15409 00001677 8B5608                  		mov	dx, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 15410                                  					; get head #, drive #
 15411 0000167A 51                      		push	cx
 15412 0000167B 06                      		push	es
 15413 0000167C 57                      		push	di		; ah - # of sectors before dma boundary
 15414                                  					; al - requested # of sectors for i/o.
 15415 0000167D E83BFE                  		call	find_bds
 15416 00001680 268B4D13                		mov	cx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 15417                                  		; 12/12/2022
 15418 00001684 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 15419                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 15420 00001689 5F                      		pop	di
 15421 0000168A 07                      		pop	es
 15422 0000168B 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; set al=ah for	floppies
 15423 0000168D 7404                    		jz	short doblockflop ; they are track by track operation
 15424 0000168F B43F                    		mov	ah, 63		; ah = 63-secpt	(# safe	sectors??)
 15425 00001691 28CC                    		sub	ah, cl		; al - # of sectors before dma boundary
 15426                                  doblockflop:
 15427 00001693 59                      		pop	cx
 15428                                  doblockcontinue:
 15429 00001694 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; if safe_# >= #_of_sectors_to_go_before dma,
 15430 00001696 7305                    		jnb	short doblocklast ; then #_of_sectors_to_go as it is for doint.
 15431 00001698 50                      		push	ax
 15432 00001699 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; otherwise, set al to ah to operate.
 15433 0000169B EB03                    		jmp	short doblockdoint
 15434                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15435                                  
 15436                                  doblocklast:
 15437 0000169D 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 15438 0000169F 50                      		push	ax
 15439                                  doblockdoint:				; let ah = al =	# of sectors for this shot
 15440 000016A0 E82CFE                  		call	doint
 15441 000016A3 727E                    		jb	short bad13	; something happened, bye!
 15442 000016A5 58                      		pop	ax
 15443 000016A6 286602                  		sub	[bp+2],	ah	; sub [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax], ah
 15444                                  					; decrement by the successful operation
 15445 000016A9 00E1                    		add	cl, ah		; advance sector #. safety gauranteed.
 15446 000016AB 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; advance dma addres
 15447 000016AD 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; twice	for 512	byte sectors
 15448 000016AF 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; check	the previous value
 15449 000016B1 740A                    		jz	short buffer	; if #_of_sectors_to_go	< safe_#,
 15450                                  					; then we are done already.
 15451 000016B3 28E0                    		sub	al, ah		; otherwise,
 15452                                  					; #_sector_to_go = #_of_sector_to_go - safe_#
 15453 000016B5 E890FD                  		call	check_wrap	; get new cx, dh for the next operation.
 15454 000016B8 EBDA                    		jmp	short doblockcontinue ;	handles	next sectors left.
 15455                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15456                                  
 15457                                  bufferx:
 15458 000016BA 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 15459                                  					; set up head number
 15460                                  buffer:
 15461 000016BD 53                      		push	bx
 15462 000016BE 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 15463 000016C1 80FC03                  		cmp	ah, 3		; romwrite
 15464 000016C4 7525                    		jnz	short doread	;
 15465                                  
 15466                                  ; copy the offending sector into local buffer
 15467                                  
 15468 000016C6 06                      		push	es
 15469 000016C7 1E                      		push	ds
 15470 000016C8 56                      		push	si
 15471 000016C9 57                      		push	di
 15472 000016CA 1E                      		push	ds		; exchange segment registers
 15473 000016CB 06                      		push	es
 15474 000016CC 1F                      		pop	ds
 15475 000016CD 07                      		pop	es
 15476 000016CE BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector	; where to move
 15477 000016D1 57                      		push	di		; save it
 15478 000016D2 89DE                    		mov	si, bx		; source
 15479 000016D4 E856FD                  		call	move_sector	; move sector into local buffer
 15480 000016D7 5B                      		pop	bx		; new transfer address
 15481                                  					; (es:bx = Bios_Data:diskbuffer)
 15482 000016D8 5F                      		pop	di		; restore caller's di & si
 15483 000016D9 5E                      		pop	si
 15484 000016DA 1F                      		pop	ds		; restore Bios_Data
 15485                                  
 15486                                  ; see if we are wrapping around a track or head
 15487                                  
 15488 000016DB B001                    		mov	al, 1		; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 15489                                  					; get drive number
 15490 000016DD 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]
 15491 000016E0 E865FD                  		call	check_wrap	; sets up registers if wrap-around
 15492                                  					;
 15493                                  					; ah is	function
 15494                                  					; al is	1 for single sector transfer
 15495                                  					; es:bx	is local transfer addres
 15496                                  					; cx is	track/sector number
 15497                                  					; dx is	head/drive number
 15498                                  					; si,di	unchanged
 15499 000016E3 E8E9FD                  		call	doint
 15500 000016E6 07                      		pop	es		; restore caller's dma segment
 15501 000016E7 723A                    		jb	short bad13	; go clean up
 15502 000016E9 EB22                    		jmp	short dotail
 15503                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15504                                  
 15505                                  ; reading a sector. do int first, then move things around
 15506                                  
 15507                                  doread:
 15508 000016EB 06                      		push	es
 15509 000016EC 53                      		push	bx
 15510 000016ED 1E                      		push	ds		; es = Bios_Code
 15511 000016EE 07                      		pop	es
 15512 000016EF BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 15513 000016F2 B001                    		mov	al, 1
 15514 000016F4 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 15515                                  					; get drive number
 15516 000016F7 E84EFD                  		call	check_wrap	;
 15517                                  					; ah = function
 15518                                  					; al = 1 for single sector
 15519                                  					; es:bx	points to local	buffer
 15520                                  					; cx, dx are track/sector, head/drive
 15521 000016FA E8D2FD                  		call	doint
 15522 000016FD 5B                      		pop	bx
 15523 000016FE 07                      		pop	es
 15524 000016FF 7222                    		jb	short bad13
 15525 00001701 56                      		push	si
 15526 00001702 57                      		push	di
 15527 00001703 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 15528 00001705 BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 15529 00001708 E822FD                  		call	move_sector
 15530 0000170B 5F                      		pop	di
 15531 0000170C 5E                      		pop	si
 15532                                  
 15533                                  ; note the fact that we've done 1 more sector
 15534                                  
 15535                                  dotail:
 15536 0000170D 5B                      		pop	bx		; retrieve new dma area
 15537 0000170E 80C702                  		add	bh, 2		; advance over sector
 15538 00001711 41                      		inc	cx
 15539 00001712 8A4602                  		mov	al, [bp+2]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax]
 15540 00001715 F8                      		clc
 15541 00001716 FEC8                    		dec	al
 15542 00001718 7409                    		jz	short bad13	; no more i/o
 15543                                  
 15544                                  ; see if we wrap around a track or head boundary with starting sector
 15545                                  ; we already have the correct head number to pass to check_wrap
 15546                                  
 15547 0000171A 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 15548 0000171D E828FD                  		call	check_wrap
 15549 00001720 E8ACFD                  		call	doint
 15550                                  
 15551                                  ; we are done. ax has the final code; we throw away what we got before
 15552                                  
 15553                                  ; M046  -- okay gang. Now we've either terminated our DMA loop,
 15554                                  ;	   or we've finished. If carry is set now, our only
 15555                                  ;	   hope for salvation is that it was a read operation
 15556                                  ;	   and the error code is ECC error. In that case, we'll
 15557                                  ;	   just pop the registers and go do the old ECC thing.
 15558                                  ;	   When the DMA error that got us here in the first
 15559                                  ;	   place occurs, it'll handle it.
 15560                                  
 15561                                  bad13:
 15562 00001723 89EC                    		mov	sp, bp
 15563 00001725 5D                      		pop	bp
 15564 00001726 5B                      		pop	bx
 15565 00001727 5B                      		pop	bx
 15566 00001728 59                      		pop	cx
 15567 00001729 5A                      		pop	dx
 15568 0000172A 7203                    		jb	short xgoterr13_xxxx ; go handle ECC errors
 15569 0000172C E935FE                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; non-error exit
 15570                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15571                                  
 15572                                  xgoterr13_xxxx:
 15573 0000172F E958FE                  		jmp	goterr13_xxxx
 15574                                  
 15575                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15576                                  		; 10/12/2022
 15577                                  		;db 	0
 15578                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15579                                  
 15580                                  ;Bios_Code ends
 15581                                  
 15582                                  ; 16/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 15583                                  
 15584                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15585                                  ; MSBIO2.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
 15586                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15587                                  ; 17/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 15588                                  
 15589                                  		; 19/10/2022
 15590                                  dsk_init:				; 2C7h:1742h = 70h:3CB2h
 15591 00001732 8A26[7500]              		mov	ah, [drvmax]
 15592 00001736 BF[7606]                		mov	di, dskdrvs
 15593 00001739 1E                      		push	ds		; pass result in es:di
 15594 0000173A 07                      		pop	es
 15595 0000173B E912EF                  		jmp	SetPtrSav
 15596                                  
 15597                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 15598                                  
 15599                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15600                                  ; install_bds installs a bds at location es:di into the current linked list of
 15601                                  ; bds maintained by this device driver. it places the bds at the end of the
 15602                                  ; list. Trashes (at least) ax, bx, di, si
 15603                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15604                                  
 15605                                  install_bds:
 15606 0000173E 1E                      		push	ds		; save Bios_Data segment
 15607 0000173F BE[1901]                		mov	si, start_bds	; beginning of chain
 15608                                  
 15609                                  		; ds:si now points to link to first bds
 15610                                  		; assume bds list is non-empty
 15611                                  loop_next_bds:
 15612 00001742 C534                    		lds	si, [si]	; [si+BDS.link]
 15613                                  					; fetch	next bds
 15614 00001744 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 15615 00001748 384404                  		cmp	[si+4],	al	; does this one	share a	physical
 15616                                  					; drive	with new one?
 15617 0000174B 7518                    		jnz	short next_bds
 15618 0000174D B310                    		mov	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 15619 0000174F 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 15620                                  					; set both of them to i_am_mult	if so
 15621 00001753 085C23                  		or	[si+23h], bl	; [si+BDS.flags]
 15622 00001756 26806523DF              		and	byte [es:di+23h], 0DFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags],~fi_own_physical
 15623                                  					; we don't own it
 15624 0000175B 8A5C23                  		mov	bl, [si+23h]	; [si+BDS.flags]
 15625                                  					; determine if changeline available
 15626 0000175E 80E302                  		and	bl, 2		; fchangeline
 15627 00001761 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 15628                                  next_bds:
 15629                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 15630 00001765 B8FFFF                  		mov	ax, 0FFFFh	; -1
 15631 00001768 3904                    		cmp	[si], ax	; [si+BDS.link],-1
 15632                                  		;cmp	word [si], 0FFFFh ; [si+BDS.link],-1
 15633                                  					; are we at end	of list?
 15634 0000176A 75D6                    		jnz	short loop_next_bds
 15635 0000176C 8C4402                  		mov	[si+2], es	; [si+BDS.link+2],es
 15636                                  					; install bds
 15637 0000176F 893C                    		mov	[si], di
 15638 00001771 268905                  		mov	[es:di], ax	; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 15639                                  		;mov	word [es:di], 0FFFFh ; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 15640                                  					; set next pointer to null
 15641 00001774 1F                      		pop	ds
 15642                                  
 15643                                  ; 01/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:1785h)
 15644                                  ; 16/10/2022 (MSDOS 6.0 Code)
 15645                                  
 15646                                  ; **** If the new drive has a higher EOT value, we must alter the
 15647                                  ;      'eot' variable appropriately.
 15648                                  
 15649                                  		; 01/06/2019
 15650 00001775 268A4534                		mov	al,[es:di+52]
 15651                                  		; 22/07/2023
 15652                                  		;mov	al,[es:di+BDS.rsecpertrack]

 15656                                  _eot_ok:

 15677 00001783 F606[6608]01            swpdsk:		test	byte [IsWin386], 1

 15691                                  					; get the drive	letter

 15704 000017A2 741E                    		jz	short swpdsk9	; somebody has handled it
