 16879                                  struc	SYS_FCB
 16880 00000000 ??                      .fcb_drive:	resb 1
 16881 00000001 ????????????????        .fcb_name:	resb 8
 16882 00000009 ??????                  .fcb_ext:	resb 3
 16883 0000000C ????                    .fcb_EXTENT:	resw 1
 16884 0000000E ????                    .fcb_RECSIZ:	resw 1	; Size of record (user settable)
 16885 00000010 ????                    .fcb_FILSIZ:	resw 1	; Size of file in bytes; used with the following
 16886                                                          ; word
 16887 00000012 ????                    .fcb_DRVBP:	resw 1	; BP for SEARCH FIRST and SEARCH NEXT
 16888 00000014 ????                    .fcb_FDATE:	resw 1	; Date of last writing
 16889 00000016 ????                    .fcb_FTIME:	resw 1	; Time of last writing
 16890 00000018 ??                      .fcb_DEVID:	resb 1	; Device ID number, bits 0-5 if file.
 16891                                                          ; bit 7=0 for file, bit 7=1 for I/O device
 16892                                                          ; If file, bit 6=0 if dirty
 16893                                                          ; If I/O device, bit 6=0 if EOF (input)
 16894                                                          ;               Bit 5=1 if Raw mode
 16895                                                          ;               Bit 0=1 if console input device
 16896                                                          ;               Bit 1=1 if console output device
 16897                                                          ;               Bit 2=1 if null device
 16898                                                          ;               Bit 3=1 if clock device
 16899 00000019 ????                    .fcb_FIRCLUS:	resw 1	; First cluster of file
 16900 0000001B ????                    .fcb_CLUSPOS:	resw 1	; Position of last cluster accessed
 16901 0000001D ????                    .fcb_LSTCLUS:	resw 1	; Last cluster accessed and directory
 16902 0000001F ??                                   	resb 1	; pack 2 12 bit numbers into 24 bits...
 16903 00000020 ??                      .fcb_NR:	resb 1	; Next record
 16904 00000021 ????????                .fcb_RR:	resb 4	; Random record
 16905                                  .size:
 16906                                  endstruc

 16908                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16909                                  ; Field definition for I/O buffer information
 16910                                  
 16911                                  ; 22/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, BUFFER.INC, 1991)
 16912                                  
 16913                                  struc buffinfo
 16914 00000000 ????                    .buf_next:	resw 1	; Pointer to next buffer in list
 16915 00000002 ????                    .buf_prev:	resw 1	; Pointer to previous buffer in list
 16916 00000004 ??                      .buf_ID:	resb 1	; Drive of buffer (bit 7 = 0)
 16917                                  			; SFT table index (bit 7 = 1)
 16918                                  			; = FFh if buffer free
 16919 00000005 ??                      .buf_flags:	resb 1	; Bit 7 = 1 if Remote file buffer
 16920                                  			;	= 0 if Local device buffer
 16921                                  			; Bit 6 = 1 if buffer dirty
 16922                                  			; Bit 5 = Reserved
 16923                                  			; Bit 4 = Search bit (bit 7 = 1)
 16924                                  			; Bit 3 = 1 if buffer is DATA
 16925                                  			; Bit 2 = 1 if buffer is DIR
 16926                                  			; Bit 1 = 1 if buffer is FAT
 16927                                  			; Bit 0 = Reserved
 16928 00000006 ????????                .buf_sector:	resd 1	; Sector number of buffer (bit 7 = 0)
 16929                                  ; The next two items are often refed as a word (bit 7 = 0)
 16930 0000000A ??                      .buf_wrtcnt:	resb 1	; For FAT sectors, # times sector written out
 16931 0000000B ????                    .buf_wrtcntinc:	resw 1	; "   "     "   , # sectors between each write
 16932 0000000D ????????                .buf_DPB :	resd 1	; Pointer to drive parameters
 16933 00000011 ????                    .buf_fill:	resw 1	; How full buffer is (bit 7 = 1)
 16934 00000013 ??                      .buf_reserved:	resb 1	; make DWORD boundary for 386
 16935                                  .size:
 16936                                  endstruc
 16937                                  
 16938                                  %define buf_offset	dword [buf_sector]
 16939                                  			;For bit 7 = 1, this is the byte
 16940                                  			;offset of the start of the buffer in
 16941                                  			;the file pointed to by buf_ID.  Thus
 16942                                  			;the buffer starts at location
 16943                                  			;buf_offset in the file and contains
 16944                                  			;buf_fill bytes.
 16945                                  
 16946                                  bufinsiz	equ	buffinfo.size ; ; Size of structure in bytes
 16947                                  
 16948                                  
 16949                                  buf_Free	equ	0FFh		; buf_id of free buffer
 16950                                  
 16951                                  ;Flag byte masks
 16952                                  buf_isnet	EQU	10000000B
 16953                                  buf_dirty	EQU	01000000B
 16954                                  ;***
 16955                                  buf_visit	EQU	00100000B
 16956                                  ;***
 16957                                  buf_snbuf	EQU	00010000B
 16958                                  
 16959                                  buf_isDATA	EQU	00001000B
 16960                                  buf_isDIR	EQU	00000100B
 16961                                  buf_isFAT	EQU	00000010B
 16962                                  buf_type_0	EQU	11110001B	; AND sets type to "none"

 16968                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16969                                  ;**	DPB - Drive Parameter Block
 16970                                  
 16971                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, DPB.INC, 1991)
 16972                                  
 16973                                  ;	BUGBUG - this isn't authorative - it's my probably incomplete and
 16974                                  ;	possibly inaccurate deductions from code study... - jgl
 16975                                  ;
 16976                                  ;	The DPB is DOS's main structure for describing block devices.
 16977                                  ;	It contains info about the "Drive" intermingled with info about
 16978                                  ;	the FAT file system which is presumably on the drive.  I don't know
 16979                                  ;	how those fields are used if it's not the FAT file system - BUGBUG
 16980                                  ;
 16981                                  ;	The DPBs are statically allocated and chained off of DPBHead.
 16982                                  ;	Users scan this chain looking for a match on DPB_DRIVE.
 16983                                  ;	The DPBs are built at init time from info in the SYSDEV structure.
 16984                                  
 16985                                  ; 08/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 (MSDOS 3.3, DPB.INC, 24/07/1987)
 16986                                  
 16987                                  ; 12/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 16988                                  
 16989                                  struc	DPB
 16990 00000000 ??                      .DRIVE:		resb 1		; Logical drive # assoc with DPB (A=0,B=1,...)
 16991 00000001 ??                      .UNIT:		resb 1		; Driver unit number of DPB
 16992 00000002 ????                    .SECTOR_SIZE:	resw 1		; Size of physical sector in bytes
 16993 00000004 ??                      .CLUSTER_MASK:	resb 1		; Sectors/cluster - 1
 16994 00000005 ??                      .CLUSTER_SHIFT:	resb 1		; Log2 of sectors/cluster
 16995 00000006 ????                    .FIRST_FAT:	resw 1		; Starting record of FATs
 16996 00000008 ??                      .FAT_COUNT:	resb 1		; Number of FATs for this drive
 16997 00000009 ????                    .ROOT_ENTRIES:	resw 1		; Number of directory entries
 16998 0000000B ????                    .FIRST_SECTOR:	resw 1		; First sector of first cluster
 16999 0000000D ????                    .MAX_CLUSTER:	resw 1		; Number of clusters on drive + 1
 17000                                  ;.FAT_SIZE:	resb 1  ; MSDOS 3.3
 17001 0000000F ????                    .FAT_SIZE:	resw 1		; Number of records occupied by FAT
 17002 00000011 ????                    .DIR_SECTOR:	resw 1		; Starting record of directory
 17003 00000013 ????????                .DRIVER_ADDR:	resd 1		; Pointer to driver
 17004 00000017 ??                      .MEDIA:		resb 1		; Media byte
 17005 00000018 ??                      .FIRST_ACCESS:	resb 1		; This is initialized to -1 to force a media
 17006                                  				; check the first time this DPB is used
 17007 00000019 ????????                .NEXT_DPB:	resd 1		; Pointer to next Drive parameter block
 17008 0000001D ????                    .NEXT_FREE:	resw 1		; Cluster # of last allocated cluster
 17009 0000001F ????                    .FREE_CNT:	resw 1		; Count of free clusters, -1 if unknown
 17010                                  .size:
 17011                                  endstruc
 17012                                  
 17013                                  DPBSIZ  EQU     DPB.size	; Size of the structure in bytes
 17014                                  
 17015                                  DSKSIZ  EQU	DPB.MAX_CLUSTER	; Size of disk (temp used during init only)

 17072                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0  (MSDOS 6.0, BPB.INC, IOCTL.INC)
 17073                                  
 17074                                  ;**	BIOS PARAMETER BLOCK DEFINITION
 17075                                  ;
 17076                                  ;	The BPB contains information about the disk structure.  It dates
 17077                                  ;	back to the earliest FAT systems and so FAT information is
 17078                                  ;	intermingled with physical driver information.
 17079                                  ;
 17080                                  ;	A boot sector contains a BPB for its device; for other disks
 17081                                  ;	the driver creates a BPB.  DOS keeps copies of some of this
 17082                                  ;	information in the DPB.
 17083                                  ;
 17084                                  ;	The BDS structure contains a BPB within it.
 17085

 17365                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17366                                  ; BIOSTRUC.INC (MSDOS 3.3 - 24/07/1987) 	
 17367                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17368                                  					  ;;Rev 3.30 Modification
 17369                                  ; ROM BIOS CALL PACKET STRUCTURES					  
 17370                                  									  
 17371                                  ;*******************************					  
 17372                                  ;System Service call ( Int 15h )					  
 17373                                  ;*******************************					  
 17374                                  ;Function AH = 0C0h, Return system configuration			  
 17375                                  ;For PC and PCJR on return:						  
 17376                                  ;	(AH)	= 80h							  
 17377                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 17378                                  ;For PCXT, PC PORTABLE and PCAT on return:				  
 17379                                  ;	(AH)	= 86h							  
 17380                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 17381                                  ;For all others:							  
 17382                                  ;	(AH)	= 0							  
 17383                                  ;	(CY)	= 0							  
 17384                                  ;	(ES:BX) = pointer to system descriptor vector in ROS		  
 17385                                  ; System descriptor :							  
 17386                                  ;	DW	xxxx		length of descriptor in bytes,		  
 17387                                  ;				minimum length = 8			  
 17388                                  ;	DB	xx		model byte				  
 17389                                  ;				0FFh	= PC				  
 17390                                  ;				0FEh	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 17391                                  ;				0FDh	= PC/JR 			  
 17392                                  ;				0FCh	= PC/AT				  
 17393                                  ;				0F9h	= Convertable			  
 17394                                  ;				0F8h	= Model 80			  
 17395                                  ;				0E0 thru 0EFh = reserved		  
 17396                                  ;									  
 17397                                  ;	DB	xx		secondary model byte			  
 17398                                  ;				000h	= PC1				  
 17399                                  ;				000h	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 17400                                  ;				000h	= PC/JR 			  
 17401                                  ;				000h	= PC/AT 			  
 17402                                  ;				001h	= PC/AT Model 339		  
 17403                                  ;				003h	= PC/RT				  
 17404                                  ;				000h	= Convertable			  
 17405                                  ;									  
 17406                                  ;	DB	xx		bios revision level			  
 17407                                  ;				00 for first release, subsequent release  
 17408                                  ;				of code with same model byte and	  
 17409                                  ;				secondary model byte require revison level
 17410                                  ;				to increase by one.			  
 17411                                  ;									  
 17412                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 1		  
 17413                                  ;				X0000000 = 1, bios use DMA channel 3	  
 17414                                  ;					 = 0, DMA channel 3 not used	  
 17415                                  ;									  
 17416                                  ;				0X000000 = 1, 2nd Interrupt chip present  
 17417                                  ;					 = 0, 2nd Interrupt chip not present
 17418                                  ;									  
 17419                                  ;				00X00000 = 1, Real Time Clock present	  
 17420                                  ;					 = 0, Real Time Clock not present 
 17421                                  ;									  
 17422                                  ;				000X0000 = 1, Keyboard escape sequence(INT 15h)
 17423                                  ;						called in keyboard interrupt
 17424                                  ;						(Int 09h).		  
 17425                                  ;					 = 0, Keyboard escape sequence not
 17426                                  ;						called. 		  
 17427                                  ;				0000XXXX reserved			  
 17428                                  ;									  
 17429                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 17430                                  ;									  
 17431                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 17432                                  ;									  
 17433                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 17434                                  ;									  
 17435                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 17436                                  ;									  
 17437                                  
 17438                                  ; 22/03/2019									  
 17439                                  struc ROMBIOS_DESC		; BIOS_SYSTEM_DESCRIPTOR						  
 17440 00000000 ????                    .bios_sd_leng:		resw 1				  
 17441 00000002 ??                      .bios_sd_modelbyte:	resb 1					  
 17442                                  .bios_sd_scnd_modelbyte: 
 17443 00000003 ??                      			resb 1					  
 17444 00000004 ??                      			resb 1					  
 17445 00000005 ??                      .bios_sd_featurebyte1:	resb 1					  
 17446 00000006 ????????                			resb 4					  
 17447                                  endstruc					  
 17448                                  									  
 17449                                  ;FeatureByte1	bit map equates 					  
 17450                                  DMAchannel3		equ 10000000b					  
 17451                                  ScndIntController	equ 01000000b					  
 17452                                  RealTimeClock		equ 00100000b					  
 17453                                  KeyEscapeSeq		equ 00010000b					  
 17454                                  					;;End of Modification

 17556                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17557                                  ; CURDIR.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 17558                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17559                                  ; 22/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 17560                                  
 17561                                  ;**	CDS - Current Directory Structure
 17562                                  ;
 17563                                  ; CDS items are used bu the internal routines to store cluster numbers and
 17564                                  ; network identifiers for each logical name.  The ID field is used dually,
 17565                                  ; both as net ID and for a cluster number for local devices. In the case
 17566                                  ; of local devices, the cluster number will be -1 if there is a potential
 17567                                  ; of the disk being changed or if the path must be recracked.
 17568                                  ;
 17569                                  ;	Some pathnames have special preambles, such as
 17570                                  ;
 17571                                  ;		\\machine\sharename\...
 17572                                  ;	For these pathnames we can't allow ".." processing to back us
 17573                                  ;	up into the special front part of the name.  The CURDIR_END field
 17574                                  ;	holds the address of the seperator character which marks
 17575                                  ;	the split between the special preamble and the regular
 17576                                  ;	path list; ".." processing isn't allowed to back us up past
 17577                                  ;	(i.e., before) CURDIR_END
 17578                                  ;	For the root, it points at the leading /. For net
 17579                                  ;	assignments it points at the end (nul) of the initial assignment:
 17580                                  ;	A:/	\\foo\bar	    \\foo\bar\blech\bozo
 17581                                  ;	  ^		 ^		     ^
 17582                                  
 17583                                  DIRSTRLEN	EQU	64+3		; Max length in bytes of directory strings
 17584                                  TEMPLEN 	EQU	DIRSTRLEN*2
 17585                                  
 17586                                  struc 		curdir_list
 17587                                  ; MSDOS 3.3
 17588 00000000 <res 43h>               .cdir_text	resb	DIRSTRLEN	; text of assignment and curdir
 17589 00000043 ????                    .cdir_flags	resw	1		; various flags
 17590 00000045 ????????                .cdir_devptr	resd	1		; local pointer to DPB or net device
 17591 00000049 ????????                .cdir_ID	resw	2		; cluster of current dir (net ID)
 17592 0000004D ????                    .cdir_usr_word	resw	1
 17593 0000004F ????                    .cdir_end	resw	1		; end of assignment
 17594                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 17595 00000051 ??                      .cdir_type:	resb	1		; IFS drive (2=ifs, 4=netuse)
 17596 00000052 ????????                .cdir_ifd_hdr:	resd	1		; Ptr to File System Header
 17597 00000056 ????                    .cdir_fsda:	resb	2		; File System Dependent Data Area
 17598                                  .size:
 17599                                  endstruc
 17600                                  
 17601                                  curdirlen	EQU	curdir_list.size	; Needed for screwed up
 17602                                  						; ASM87 which doesn't allow
 17603                                  						; Size directive as a macro
 17604                                  						; argument
 17605                                  %define curdir_netID	dword [curdir_list.cdir_ID]
 17606                                  
 17607                                  ;**	Flag values for CURDIR_FLAGS
 17608                                  
 17609                                  ;Flag word masks
 17610                                  curdir_isnet	EQU	1000000000000000B
 17611                                  curdir_isifs	EQU	1000000000000000B
 17612                                  curdir_inuse	EQU	0100000000000000B
 17613                                  curdir_splice	EQU	0010000000000000B
 17614                                  curdir_local	EQU	0001000000000000B

 17616                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17617                                  ; SF.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 17618                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17619                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 17620                                  
 17621                                  ; 09/04/2024 - Retro DOS v4.2 (BugFix)
 17622                                  
 17623                                  ; system file table
 17624                                  
 17625                                  ;**	System File Table SuperStructure
 17626                                  ;
 17627                                  ;	The system file table entries are allocated in contiguous groups.
 17628                                  ;	There may be more than one such groups; the SF "superstructure"
 17629                                  ;	tracks the groups.
 17630                                  
 17631                                  struc	SF
 17632 00000000 ????????                .SFLink:	resd	1
 17633 00000004 ????                    .SFCount:	resw	1		; number of entries
 17634 00000006 ????                    .SFTable:	resw	1		; beginning of array of the following
 17635                                  .size:
 17636                                  endstruc
 17637                                  
 17638                                  ;**	System file table entry
 17639                                  ;
 17640                                  ;	These are the structures which are at SFTABLE in the SF structure.
 17641                                  
 17642                                  struc	SF_ENTRY
 17643 00000000 ????                    .sf_ref_count:	resw	1		; number of processes sharing entry
 17644                                  					;   if FCB then ref count
 17645 00000002 ????                    .sf_mode: 	resw	1		; mode of access or high bit on if FCB
 17646 00000004 ??                      .sf_attr: 	resb	1		; attribute of file
 17647 00000005 ????                    .sf_flags:	resw	1		;Bits 8-15
 17648                                  					; Bit 15 = 1 if remote file
 17649                                  					;	 = 0 if local file or device
 17650                                  					; Bit 14 = 1 if date/time is not to be
 17651                                  					;   set from clock at CLOSE.  Set by
 17652                                  					;   FILETIMES and FCB_CLOSE.  Reset by
 17653                                  					;   other reseters of the dirty bit
 17654                                  					;   (WRITE)
 17655                                  					; Bit 13 = Pipe bit (reserved)
 17656                                  					;
 17657                                  					; Bits 0-7 (old FCB_devid bits)
 17658                                  					; If remote file or local file, bit
 17659                                  					; 6=0 if dirty Device ID number, bits
 17660                                  					; 0-5 if local file.
 17661                                  					; bit 7=0 for local file, bit 7
 17662                                  					;      =1 for local I/O device
 17663                                  					; If local I/O device, bit 6=0 if EOF (input)
 17664                                  					;		Bit 5=1 if Raw mode
 17665                                  					;		Bit 0=1 if console input device
 17666                                  					;		Bit 1=1 if console output device
 17667                                  					;		Bit 2=1 if null device
 17668                                  					;		Bit 3=1 if clock device
 17669 00000007 ????????                .sf_devptr:	resd	1		; Points to DPB if local file, points
 17670                                  					; to device header if local device,
 17671                                  					; points to net device header if
 17672                                  					; remote
 17673 0000000B ????                    .sf_firclus:	resw	1		; First cluster of file (bit 15 = 0)
 17674                                  ;.sf_lstclus:	resw	1 ; *	
 17675 0000000D ????                    .sf_time: 	resw	1		; Time associated with file
 17676 0000000F ????                    .sf_date: 	resw	1		; Date associated with file
 17677 00000011 ????????                .sf_size: 	resd	1		; Size associated with file
 17678 00000015 ????????                .sf_position:	resd	1		; Read/Write pointer or LRU count for FCBs
 17679                                  ;
 17680                                  ; Starting here, the next 7 bytes may be used by the file system to store an
 17681                                  ; ID
 17682                                  ;
 17683 00000019 ????                    .sf_cluspos:	resw	1		; Position of last cluster accessed
 17684 0000001B ????????                .sf_dirsec:	resd	1 ; 09/04/2024	; Sector number of directory sector for this file
 17685 0000001F ??                      .sf_dirpos:	resb	1		; Offset of this entry in the above
 17686                                  ;
 17687                                  ; End of 7 bytes of file-system specific info.
 17688                                  ;
 17689 00000020 <res Bh>                .sf_name:	resb	11		; 11 character name that is in the
 17690                                  					; directory entry.  This is used by
 17691                                  					; close to detect file deleted and
 17692                                  					; disk changed errors.
 17693                                  ; SHARING INFO
 17694 0000002B ????????                .sf_chain:	resd	1		; link to next SF
 17695 0000002F ????                    .sf_UID:	resw	1
 17696 00000031 ????                    .sf_PID:	resw	1
 17697 00000033 ????                    .sf_MFT:	resw	1
 17698 00000035 ????                    .sf_lstclus:	resw	1 ; *		; Last cluster accessed
 17699 00000037 ????????                .sf_IFS_HDR:	resd 	1 ; **
 17700                                  .size:
 17701                                  endstruc

 17980                                  ; 05/07/2018
 17981                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17982                                  ; 04/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 17983                                  
 17984                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17985                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT)
 17986                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17987                                  
 17988                                  ;	MSStack.inc
 17989                                  ;
 17990                                  ;	Interrupt level 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7,(10, 11, 12, 14, 15 - AT level)
 17991                                  ;	should follow the standard Interrupt Sharing Scheme which has
 17992                                  ;	a standard header structure.
 17993                                  ;	Fyi, the following shows the relations between
 17994                                  ;	the interrupt vector and interrupt level.
 17995                                  ; VEC(Hex)    2  8  9  A  B  C	D  E  70  72  73  74  76  77
 17996                                  ; LVL(Deci)   9  0  1  2  3  4	5  6   8  10  11  12  14  15
 17997                                  ;	MSSTACK module modifies the following interrupt vectors
 17998                                  ;	to meet the standard Interrupt Sharing standard;
 17999                                  ;	  A, B, C, D, E, 72, 73, 74, 76, 77.
 18000                                  ;	Also, for interrupt level 7 and 15, the FirstFlag in a standard header
 18001                                  ;	should be initialized to indicat whether this interrupt handler is
 18002                                  ;	the first (= 80h) or not.  The FirstFlag entry of INT77h's
 18003                                  ;	program header is initialized in STKINIT.INC module.
 18004                                  ;	FirstFlag is only meaningful for interrupt level 7 and 15.
 18005                                  ;
 18006                                  
 18007                                  ;  User specifies the number of stack elements - default = 9
 18008                                  ;						 minimum = 8
 18009                                  ;						 maximum = 64
 18010                                  ;
 18011                                  ;  Intercepts Asynchronous Hardware Interrupts only
 18012                                  ;
 18013                                  ;  Picks a stack from pool of stacks and switches to it
 18014                                  ;
 18015                                  ;  Calls the previously saved interrupt vector after pushing flags
 18016                                  ;
 18017                                  ;  On return, returns the stack to the stack pool
 18018                                  ;
 18019                                  
 18020                                  ; This is a modification of STACKS:
 18021                                  ; 1. To fix a bug which was causing the program to take up too much space.
 18022                                  ; 2. To dispense stack space from hi-mem first rather than low-mem first.
 18023                                  ;    . Clobbers the stack that got too big instead of innocent stack
 18024                                  ;    . Allows system to work if the only stack that got too big was the most
 18025                                  ;      deeply nested one
 18026                                  ; 3. Disables NMI interrupts while setting the NMI vector.
 18027                                  ; 4. Does not intercept any interupts on a PCjr.
 18028                                  ; 5. Double checks that a nested interrupt didn't get the same stack.
 18029                                  ; 6. Intercepts Ints 70, 72-77 for PC-ATs and other future products
 18030                                  
 18031                                  		;EVEN
 18032                                  ;align 2
 18033                                  		; 21/10/2022
 18034                                  
 18035 00000000 0000                    		dw	0	; spare field but leave these in order
 18036 00000002 0000                    stackcount:	dw	0
 18037 00000004 0000                    stackat: 	dw	0
 18038 00000006 0000                    stacksize:	dw	0
 18039 00000008 0000                    stacks:		dw	0
 18040 0000000A 0000                    		dw	0
 18041                                  
 18042 0000000C [0800]                  firstentry:	dw	stacks
 18043 0000000E [4800]                  lastentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 18044 00000010 [4800]                  nextentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 18045                                  
 18046                                  ;***********************************************************************
 18047                                  ; THESE ARE THE INDIVIDUAL INTERRUPT HANDLERS
 18048                                  
 18049                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18050                                  
 18051 00000012 00000000                old02:	dd	0
 18052                                  
 18053                                  int02:
 18054                                  
 18055                                  ; *********************************************************************
 18056                                  ;
 18057                                  ; this is special support for the pc convertible / nmi handler
 18058                                  ;
 18059                                  ;	on the pc convertible, there is a situation where an nmi can be 
 18060                                  ;	caused by using the "out" instructions to certain ports. when this
 18061                                  ;	occurs, the pc convertible hardware *guarantees* that **nothing** 
 18062                                  ;	can stop the nmi or interfere with getting to the nmi handler. this
 18063                                  ;	includes other type of interrupts (hardware and software), and
 18064                                  ;	also includes other type of nmi's. when any nmi has occured,
 18065                                  ;	no other interrtupt (hardware, software or nmi) can occur until
 18066                                  ;	the software takes specific steps to allow further interrupting.
 18067                                  ;
 18068                                  ;	for pc convertible, the situation where the nmi is generated by the
 18069                                  ;	"out" to a control port requires "fixing-up" and re-attempting. in
 18070                                  ;	otherwords, it is actually a "restartable exception". in this
 18071                                  ;	case, the software handler must be able to get to the stack in
 18072                                  ;	order to figure out what instruction caused the problem, where
 18073                                  ;	it was "out"ing to and what value it was "out"ing.  therefore,
 18074                                  ;	we will not switch stacks in this situation. this situation is
 18075                                  ;	detected by interrogating port 62h, and checking for a bit value
 18076                                  ;	of 80h. if set, *****do not switch stacks*****.
 18077                                  ;
 18078                                  ; *********************************************************************
 18079                                  
 18080 00000016 50                      	push	ax
 18081 00000017 06                      	push	es
 18082 00000018 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h
 18083 0000001B 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 18084                                  	; 02/11/2022
 18085 0000001D 26803EFEFFF9            	cmp	byte [es:0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; check if convertible
 18086 00000023 07                      	pop	es
 18087 00000024 750C                    	jne	short normal02
 18088                                  
 18089 00000026 E462                    	in	al,62h		; PC/XT PPI port C. Bits:
 18090                                  				; 0-3: values of DIP switches
 18091                                  				; 5: 1=Timer 2 channel out
 18092                                  				; 6: 1=I/O channel check
 18093                                  				; 7: 1=RAM parity check error occurred.
 18094 00000028 A880                    	test	al,80h
 18095 0000002A 7406                    	jz	short normal02
 18096                                  special02:
 18097 0000002C 58                      	pop	ax
 18098 0000002D 2EFF2E[1200]            	jmp	far [cs:old02]
 18099                                  normal02:
 18100 00000032 58                      	pop	ax
 18101 00000033 E81101                  	call	do_int_stacks
 18102 00000036 [1200]                  	dw	old02

 18330                                  ;********************************************************************
 18331                                  ;common routines
 18332                                  ;********************************************************************
 18333                                  
 18334                                  ; do interrupt stack switching. the fake return address holds
 18335                                  ; a pointer to the far-pointer of the actual interrupt
 18336                                  ; service routine
 18337                                  
 18338                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 18339                                  ; 21/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 18340                                  
 18341                                  ;allocbyte   equ 0
 18342                                  ;intlevel    equ 1
 18343                                  ;savedsp     equ 2
 18344                                  ;savedss     equ 4
 18345                                  ;newsp       equ 6
 18346                                  
 18347                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT)
 18348                                  ; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:0147h)
 18349                                  
 18350                                  do_int_stacks:
 18351 00000147 50                      	push	ax
 18352 00000148 55                      	push	bp
 18353 00000149 06                      	push	es
 18354 0000014A 2E8E06[0A00]            	mov	es,[cs:stacks+2]	; Get segment of stacks
 18355 0000014F 2E8B2E[1000]            	mov	bp,[cs:nextentry]	; get most likely candidate
 18356 00000154 B001                    	mov	al,allocated ; 1
 18357                                  	; 21/10/2022
 18358                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al 
 18359                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18360 00000156 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al		; grab the entry
 18361 0000015A 3C00                    	cmp	al,free ; 0		; still avail?
 18362 0000015C 7551                    	jne	short notfree02
 18363                                  
 18364 0000015E 2E832E[1000]08          	sub	word [cs:nextentry],entrysize ; set for next interrupt
 18365                                  
 18366                                  found02:
 18367 00000164 26896602                	mov	[es:bp+savedsp],sp	; save sp value
 18368 00000168 268C5604                	mov	[es:bp+savedss],ss	; save ss also
 18369                                  
 18370 0000016C 89E8                    	mov	ax,bp			; temp save of table offset
 18371                                  
 18372 0000016E 268B6E06                	mov	bp,[es:bp+newsp]	; get new SP value
 18373                                  	; 21/10/2022
 18374                                  	;mov	bp,[es:bp+6]
 18375                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18376                                  	;cmp	[es:bp+0],ax	
 18377 00000172 26394600                	cmp	[es:bp],ax		; check for offset into table
 18378 00000176 7544                    	jne	short foundbad02
 18379                                  
 18380                                  	; 02/07/2023 (MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT code)
 18381 00000178 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es			; point ss,sp to the new stack
 18382 0000017A 8EC5                    	mov	es,bp
 18383 0000017C 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 18384 0000017E 8B6E06                  	mov	bp,[bp+6]
 18385 00000181 8ED0                    	mov	ss,ax
 18386 00000183 8CC4                    	mov	sp,es
 18387 00000185 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 18388 00000187 2E8B6E00                	mov	bp,[cs:bp]
 18389                                  
 18390                                  	; 21/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT code)
 18391                                  	;push    bp
 18392                                  	;mov     bp,sp
 18393                                  	;mov     ax,[bp+8]
 18394                                  	;pop     bp
 18395                                  	;push    es
 18396                                  	;pop     ss
 18397                                  	;mov     sp,bp
 18398                                  	;mov     bp,ax
 18399                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18400                                  	;;mov	bp,[cs:bp+0]	
 18401                                  	;mov	bp,[cs:bp]	
 18402                                  
 18403 0000018B 9C                      	pushf				; go execute the real interrupt handler
 18404                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18405 0000018C 2EFF5E00                	call	far [cs:bp]		;  which will iret back to here
 18406                                  	; 21/10/2022
 18407                                  	;call	far [cs:bp+0]
 18408                                  
 18409 00000190 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp			; retrieve the table offset for us
 18410                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18411 00000192 268B6E00                	mov	bp,[es:bp]		;  but leave it on the stack
 18412                                  	; 21/10/2022
 18413                                  	;mov	bp,[es:bp+0]
 18414 00000196 268E5604                	mov	ss,[es:bp+savedss]	; get old stack back
 18415 0000019A 268B6602                	mov	sp,[es:bp+savedsp]
 18416                                  
 18417                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18418                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free ; free the entry
 18419                                  	; 21/10/2022
 18420 0000019E 26C6460000              	mov	byte [es:bp],free ; 0
 18421 000001A3 2E892E[1000]            	mov	[cs:nextentry],bp	; setup to use next time
 18422                                  
 18423 000001A8 07                      	pop	es
 18424 000001A9 5D                      	pop	bp			; saved on entry
 18425 000001AA 58                      	pop	ax			; saved on entry
 18426 000001AB 83C402                  	add	sp,2
 18427 000001AE CF                      	iret				; done with this interrupt
 18428                                  
 18429                                  notfree02:
 18430 000001AF 3C01                    	cmp	al,allocated		; error flag
 18431 000001B1 7404                    	je	short findnext02	;  no, continue
 18432                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18433                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	;  yes, restore error value
 18434                                  	; 21/10/2022
 18435 000001B3 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al
 18436                                  
 18437                                  findnext02:
 18438 000001B7 E81200                  	call	longpath
 18439 000001BA EBA8                    	jmp	short found02
 18440                                  
 18441                                  foundbad02:
 18442 000001BC 2E3B2E[0C00]            	cmp	bp,[cs:firstentry]
 18443 000001C1 72F4                    	jc	short findnext02
 18444 000001C3 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax			; flag this entry
 18445                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18446                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],clobbered
 18447                                  	; 21/10/2022
 18448 000001C5 26C6460003              	mov	byte [es:bp],clobbered ; 3
 18449 000001CA EBEB                    	jmp	short findnext02	; keep looking
 18450                                  
 18451                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18452                                  
 18453                                  ; Common routines
 18454                                  
 18455                                  longpath:
 18456                                  	; 21/03/2019
 18457 000001CC 2E8B2E[0E00]            	mov	bp,[cs:lastentry]	; start with last entry in table
 18458                                  lploopp:
 18459                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18460                                  	;cmp	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free ; is entry free?
 18461                                  	; 21/10/2022
 18462 000001D1 26807E0000              	cmp	byte [es:bp],free
 18463 000001D6 7512                    	jne	short inuse		;  no, try next one
 18464                                  
 18465 000001D8 B001                    	mov	al,allocated
 18466                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18467                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	; allocate entry
 18468                                  	; 21/10/2022
 18469 000001DA 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al
 18470 000001DE 3C00                    	cmp	al,free 		; is it still free?
 18471 000001E0 7414                    	je	short found		;  yes, go use it
 18472                                  
 18473 000001E2 3C01                    	cmp	al,allocated		; is it other than Allocated or Free?
 18474 000001E4 7404                    	je	short inuse		;  no, check the next one
 18475                                  
 18476                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18477                                  	;mov	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	;  yes, put back the error state
 18478                                  	; 21/10/2022
 18479 000001E6 26884600                	mov	[es:bp],al
 18480                                  inuse:
 18481 000001EA 2E3B2E[0C00]            	cmp	bp,[cs:firstentry]
 18482 000001EF 7406                    	je	short fatal
 18483 000001F1 83ED08                  	sub	bp,entrysize
 18484 000001F4 EBDB                    	jmp	short lploopp
 18485                                  found:
 18486 000001F6 C3                      	retn
 18487                                  fatal:
 18488 000001F7 1E                      	push	ds
 18489 000001F8 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h		;look at the model byte
 18490 000001FB 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 18491 000001FD 803EFEFFF9              	cmp	byte [0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; convertible?
 18492 00000202 1F                      	pop	ds
 18493 00000203 7504                    	jne	short skip_nmis
 18494                                  
 18495 00000205 B007                    	mov	al,07h			; disable pc convertible nmis
 18496 00000207 E672                    	out	72h,al
 18497                                  
 18498                                  skip_nmis:
 18499 00000209 FA                      	cli				; disable and mask
 18500 0000020A B0FF                    	mov	al,0FFh			;   all other ints
 18501 0000020C E621                    	out	021h,al
 18502 0000020E E6A1                    	out	0A1h,al
 18503                                  
 18504 00000210 8CCE                    	mov	si,cs
 18505 00000212 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si
 18506 00000214 BE[3B02]                	mov	si,fatal_msg
 18507                                  ;SR;
 18508                                  ;   We set all foci to this VM to issue the stack failure message
 18509                                  ;
 18510 00000217 50                      	push	ax
 18511 00000218 1E                      	push	ds
 18512                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 0070h
 18513                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 0070h
 18514                                  	; 21/10/2022
 18515 00000219 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG
 18516 0000021C 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 18517                                  
 18518                                  	;test	byte [08D0h],1 	; (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS - SYSINIT:021Eh)
 18519 0000021E F606[6608]01            	test	byte [IsWin386],1 ; (retrodos4.sys, offset: ****h)
 18520 00000223 1F                      	pop	ds
 18521 00000224 58                      	pop	ax

 19795                                  	; ds = cs (at return from doconf)
 19796                                  
 19797                                  ; Now, if this is not romdos, we decide what to do with the DOS code.
 19798                                  ; It will either be relocated to low memory, above the DOS data structures,
 19799                                  ; or else it will be located in HiMem, in which case a stub with the DOS
 19800                                  ; code entry points will be located in low memory. Dos_segreinit is used
 19801                                  ; to tell the DOS data where the code has been placed, and to install the
 19802                                  ; low memory stub if necessary. If the DOS is going to go into HiMem, we
 19803                                  ; must first initialize it in its present location and load the installable
 19804                                  ; device drivers. Then, if a HiMem driver has been located, we can actually
 19805                                  ; relocate the DOS code into HiMem.
 19806                                  ;
 19807                                  ; For ROMDOS, if DOS=HIGH is indicated, then we need to call dos_segreinit
 19808                                  ; to install the low memory stub (this must be done before allowing any
 19809                                  ; device drivers to hook interrupt vectors). Otherwise, we don't need to 
 19810                                  ; call dos_segreinit at all, since the interrupt vector table has already 
 19811                                  ; been patched.
 19812                                  
 19813                                  	; 22/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
 19814                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:0749h)

 20141                                  ;   Once we get to this point, the above code, which is below "retry"

 20145                                  retry:
 20146 0000076B BA[8645]                	mov	dx,commnd	; now pointing to file description
 20147                                  
 20148                                  ; we are going to open the command interpreter and size it as is done in
 20149                                  ; ldfil. the reason we must do this is that sysinit is in free memory. if
 20150                                  ; there is not enough room for the command interpreter,exec will probably
 20151                                  ; overlay our stack and code so when it returns with an error sysinit won't be
 20152                                  ; here to catch it. this code is not perfect (for instance .exe command
 20153                                  ; interpreters are possible) because it does its sizing based on the
 20154                                  ; assumption that the file being loaded is a .com file. it is close enough to
 20155                                  ; correctness to be usable.
 20156                                  
 20157                                  ; first, find out where the command interpreter is going to go.
 20158                                  
 20159 0000076E 52                      	push	dx		; save pointer to name
 20160 0000076F BBFFFF                  	mov	bx,0FFFFh

 20162 00000774 CD21                            int     21h             ; get biggest piece
 20163 00000776 B448                    	mov	ah,48h	; ALLOC
 20164 00000778 CD21                    	int	21h		; second time gets it
 20165 0000077A 726B                    	jc	short memerrjx	; oooops
 20166                                  
 20167 0000077C 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 20168 0000077E B449                    	mov	ah,49h	; DEALLOC
 20169 00000780 CD21                    	int	21h		; give it right back
 20170 00000782 89DD                    	mov	bp,bx
 20171                                  
 20172                                  ; es:0 points to block,and bp is the size of the block in para.
 20173                                  
 20174                                  ; we will now adjust the size in bp down by the size of sysinit.
 20175                                  ; we need to do this because exec might get upset if some of the exec
 20176                                  ; data in sysinit is overlayed during the exec.
 20177                                  
 20178                                  	; 22/10/2022
 20179                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT:083Bh)
 20180 00000784 8B1E[9402]                      mov     bx,[MEMORY_SIZE] ; get location of end of memory
 20181 00000788 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs		 ; get location of beginning of sysinit
 20182                                  
 20183                                  ; Note that the "config_wrkseg" environment data is a segment in
 20184                                  ; unallocated memory (as of the Dealloc of [area], above). This is ideal
 20185                                  ; in one sense, because Exec is going to make a copy of it for COMMAND.COM
 20186                                  ; anyway, and no one has responsibility for freeing "config_wrkseg". But
 20187                                  ; we need to make sure that there's no way Exec will stomp on that data
 20188                                  ; before it can copy it, and one way to do that is to make the available
 20189                                  ; memory calculation even more "paranoid", by subtracting "config_wrkseg"
 20190                                  ; from the "memory_size" segment value (which is typically A000h) instead
 20191                                  ; of the current sysinit CS....
 20192                                  ;
 20193                                  ; The reason I use the term "paranoid" is because this code should have
 20194                                  ; slid the data required by Exec up to the very top of memory, because as
 20195                                  ; it stands, you have to have sizeof(COMMAND.COM) PLUS 64K to load just
 20196                                  ; COMMAND.COM (64k is about what sysinit, and all the goop above sysinit,
 20197                                  ; consumes). Now it's just a little worse (65K or more, depending on
 20198                                  ; the size of your CONFIG.SYS, since the size of the environment workspace
 20199                                  ; is determined by the size of CONFIG.SYS.... -JTP

 21048                                  
 21049                                  ; BUGBUG -- 5 Aug 92 -- chuckst -- Allocating space for DOS
 21050                                  ;	  using DOS itself causes an arena to be generated.
 21051                                  ;	  Unfortunately, certain programs (like PROTMAN$)
 21052                                  ;	  assume that the device drivers are loaded into
 21053                                  ;	  the first arena. For this reason, MagicDrv's
 21054                                  ;	  main device driver header arena is manually
 21055                                  ;	  truncated from the arena chain, and the space
 21056                                  ;	  for DOS is allocated using the following
 21057                                  ;	  simple code, which also assumes that the
 21058                                  ;	  first arena is the free one where DOS's low
 21059                                  ;	  stub will go.
 21060                                  ;
 21061                                  ; M012 : BEGIN
 21062                                  
 21063                                  	; 23/10/2022
 21064                                  update_arena:
 21065 00000A00 1E                      	push	ds ; ds = cs
 21066 00000A01 57                      	push	di
 21067 00000A02 51                      	push	cx
 21068 00000A03 52                      	push	dx
 21069                                  	; 23/10/2022
 21070                                  	;lds	di,[cs:DOSINFO]			; get ptr to DOS var
 21071                                  	; 11/12/2022
 21072                                  	; ds = cs 
 21073 00000A04 C53E[6D02]              	lds	di,[DOSINFO] ; 27/03/2019	
 21074 00000A08 4F                      	dec	di
 21075 00000A09 4F                      	dec	di				; Arena head is immediately
 21076                                  						;  before sysvar
 21077 00000A0A 8E05                    	mov	es,[di]				; es = arena head
 21078                                  	;mov	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]		; cx = total low mem size
 21079 00000A0C 268B0E0300              	mov	cx,[es:3]
 21080 00000A11 39D9                    	cmp	cx,bx				; is it sufficient ?
 21081 00000A13 7227                    	jb	short FatalErr			; no, fatal error
 21082                                  
 21083                                  	;mov	dl,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 21084 00000A15 268A160000              	mov	dl,[es:0]
 21085 00000A1A 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 21086 00000A1C 01D8                    	add	ax,bx				; ax = new arena head
 21087 00000A1E 8905                    	mov	[di],ax				; store it in DOS data area
 21088 00000A20 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 21089                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIGNATURE],dl		; type of arena
 21090 00000A22 88160000                	mov	[0],dl
 21091                                  	;mov	word [ARENA.OWNER],0		; free
 21092 00000A26 C70601000000            	mov	word [1],0
 21093 00000A2C 29D9                    	sub	cx,bx				; size of the new block
 21094                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIZE],cx			; store it in the arena
 21095 00000A2E 890E0300                	mov	[3],cx
 21096 00000A32 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es				; return seg to the caller
 21097                                  	; 23/10/2022
 21098                                  	;; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ORG 0)	; Take care ORG 30h of
 21099 00000A34 83E803                  	sub	ax,3				;  BIOS code
 21100 00000A37 5A                      	pop	dx
 21101 00000A38 59                      	pop	cx
 21102 00000A39 5F                      	pop	di
 21103 00000A3A 1F                      	pop	ds ; ds = cs
 21104 00000A3B C3                      	retn
 21105                                  ;
 21106                                  ; M012 : END
 21107                                  ;
 21108                                  FatalErr:
 21109 00000A3C 0E                      	push	cs
 21110 00000A3D 1F                      	pop	ds
 21111 00000A3E BA[0909]                	mov	dx,FEmsg
 21112 00000A41 B409                    	mov	ah,9
 21113 00000A43 CD21                    	int	21h 		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 21114                                  				; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 21115                                  	; 30/12/2022 (MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT)
 21116 00000A45 E92007                  	jmp	stall
 21117                                  	; 23/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 21118                                  	;cli
 21119                                  	;hlt
 21120

 21125                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21126                                  ;
 21127                                  ; procedure : AllocHMA
 21128                                  ;
 21129                                  ;	grab_the_hma tries to enable a20 and make sure there is memory
 21130                                  ;	  up there. If it gets any sort of error, it will return with
 21131                                  ;	  carry set so that we can resort to running low.
 21132                                  ;
 21133                                  ;	It also returns ES: -> 0ffffh if it returns success
 21134                                  ;
 21135                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21136                                  
 21137                                  AllocHMA:
 21138                                  ;	cas note:  The pre-286 check is no longer needed here since the
 21139                                  ;		   presence of XMS is sufficient. However, this code hasn't
 21140                                  ;		   been deleted because it can be recycled for skipping the
 21141                                  ;		   extra pass of CONFIG.SYS and assuming we're running low
 21142                                  ;		   in the case of a pre-286.
 21143                                  
 21144                                  ;;	see if we're running on a pre-286. If not, force low.
 21145                                  ;
 21146                                  ;	xor	ax,ax
 21147                                  ;	pushf			; save flags (like int)
 21148                                  ;	push	ax
 21149                                  ;	popf
 21150                                  ;	pushf
 21151                                  ;	pop	ax
 21152                                  ;	popf			; restore original flags (like int)
 21153                                  ;	and	ax,0F000h
 21154                                  ;	cmp	ax,0F000h	; 8088/8086?
 21155                                  ;	jz	short grab_hma_error
 21156                                  
 21157                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 21158                                  	; (SYSINIT:0A26h)
 21159                                  
 21160 00000A48 1E                      	push	ds
 21161                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data
 21162                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT
 21163                                  	; 21/10/2022
 21164 00000A49 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG
 21165 00000A4C 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 21166                                  
 21167 00000A4E E84A00                  	call	IsXMSLoaded
 21168 00000A51 7545                    	jnz	short grabhma_error
 21169                                  
 21170 00000A53 B81043                  	mov	ax,4310h
 21171 00000A56 CD2F                    	int	2Fh		; get the vector into es:bx
 21172                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - GET DRIVER ADDRESS
 21173                                  		; Return: ES:BX -> driver entry point
 21174                                  
 21175 00000A58 891E[0E00]              	mov	[xms],bx
 21176                                  	;mov	[0Eh], bx
 21177 00000A5C 8C06[1000]              	mov	[xms+2],es
 21178                                  	;mov	[10h],es
 21179                                  
 21180 00000A60 B401                    	mov	ah,1		; request HMA
 21181 00000A62 BAFFFF                  	mov	dx,0FFFFh
 21182                                  	;call	dword ptr ds:0Eh
 21183 00000A65 FF1E[0E00]              	call	far [xms]
 21184 00000A69 48                      	dec	ax
 21185 00000A6A 7409                    	jz	short allocHMA_1 ; error if not able to allocate HMA
 21186                                  
 21187                                  ;------ Himem may be lying because it has allocated mem for int 15
 21188                                  
 21189 00000A6C B488                    	mov	ah,88h
 21190 00000A6E CD15                    	int	15h
 21191                                  		; Get Extended Memory Size
 21192                                  		; Return: CF clear on success
 21193                                  		; AX = size of memory above 1M in K
 21194 00000A70 83F840                  	cmp	ax,64		; less than 64 K of hma ?
 21195                                  	;jb	short grabhma_error
 21196                                  	; 11/12/2022
 21197 00000A73 7224                    	jb	short grabhma_err ; cf=1
 21198                                  allocHMA_1:
 21199 00000A75 B405                    	mov	ah,5		; localenableA20
 21200                                  	;call	dword ptr ds:0Eh
 21201 00000A77 FF1E[0E00]              	call	far [xms]
 21202 00000A7B 48                      	dec	ax
 21203 00000A7C 751A                    	jnz	short grabhma_error ; error if couldn't enable A20
 21204                                  
 21205 00000A7E E88501                  	call	IsVDiskInstalled
 21206 00000A81 7415                    	jz	short grabhma_error ; yes, we cant use HMA
 21207                                  
 21208 00000A83 B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh
 21209 00000A86 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 21210 00000A88 26C70610003412          	mov	word [es:10h],1234h ; see if we can really read/write there
 21211 00000A8F 26813E10003412          	cmp	word [es:10h],1234h
 21212                                  	;jne	short grabhma_error ; don't try to load there if XMS lied
 21213                                  	; 11/12/2022
 21214 00000A96 7401                    	je	short allocHMA_ok	
 21215                                  
 21216                                  ; 11/12/2022
 21217                                  ;	; 11/12/2022
 21218                                  ;	; cf=0
 21219                                  ;	;clc
 21220                                  ;	pop	ds
 21221                                  ;	retn
 21222                                  
 21223                                  grabhma_error:
 21224 00000A98 F9                      	stc
 21225                                  	; 11/12/022
 21226                                  grabhma_err:	; cf=1
 21227                                  allocHMA_ok:	; cf=0
 21228 00000A99 1F                      	pop	ds
 21229 00000A9A C3                      	retn

 21232                                  ;
 21233                                  ; procedure : IsXMSLoaded
 21234                                  ;
 21235                                  ;             Checks whether a XMS driver is loaded
 21236                                  ;
 21237                                  ; Returns : Z flag set if XMS driver loaded
 21238                                  ;           Z flag reset if no XMS drivers are present
 21239                                  ;
 21240                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21241                                  
 21242                                  IsXMSLoaded:
 21243 00000A9B B80043                  	mov	ax,4300h
 21244 00000A9E CD2F                    	int	2Fh		; - Multiplex - XMS - INSTALLATION CHECK
 21245                                  				; Return: AL = 80h XMS driver installed
 21246                                  				; AL <> 80h no driver
 21247 00000AA0 3C80                    	cmp	al,80h		; XMS installed?
 21248 00000AA2 C3                      	retn
