 21295                                  
 21296                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21297                                  ;
 21298                                  ; following piece of code will be moved into a para boundary. And the para
 21299                                  ; address posted in seg of int 19h vector. Offset of int 19h will point to
 21300                                  ; VDint19. This is to protect HMA from apps which use VDISK header method
 21301                                  ; to determine free extended memory.
 21302                                  ;
 21303                                  ; For more details read "power programming" column by Ray Duncan in the
 21304                                  ; May 30 1989 issue of PC Magazine (pp 377-388) [USING EXTENDED MEMORY,PART 1]
 21305                                  ;
 21306                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21307                                  
 21308                                  StartVDHead:
 21309                                  ;-------------- what follows is a dummy device driver header (not used by DOS)
 21310                                  
 21311 00000AC0 00000000                	dd	0		; link to next device driver
 21312 00000AC4 0080                    	dw	8000h		; device attribute
 21313 00000AC6 0000                    	dw	0		; strategy routine offset
 21314 00000AC8 0000                    	dw	0		; interrupt routine offset
 21315 00000ACA 01                      	db	1		; number of units
 21316                                  	;db	7 dup(0) 
 21317 00000ACB 00<rep 7h>              	times	7 db 0 		; reserved area
 21318                                  VDiskSig1:
 21319 00000AD2 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 21320                                  
 21321                                  VLEN1	equ	($-VDiskSig1)
 21322                                  
 21323 00000AD7 202056332E33            	db	'  V3.3'	; vdisk label
 21324                                  	;db	15 dup (0)	; pad
 21325 00000ADD 00<rep Fh>              	times	15 db 0
 21326 00000AEC 0000                    	dw	0		; bits 0-15 of free HMA
 21327 00000AEE 11                      	db	11h		; bits 16-23 of free HMA (1M + 64K)
 21328                                  VDInt19:
 21329 00000AEF EA                      	db	0EAh		; jmp to old vector
 21330                                  OldVDInt19:
 21331 00000AF0 00000000                	dd	0		; Saved int 19 vector
 21332                                  
 21333                                  EndVDHead: ; label byte
 21334                                  
 21335                                  VDiskHMAHead:	
 21336 00000AF4 000000                  	db	0,0,0		; non-bootable disk
 21337                                  VDiskSig2:
 21338 00000AF7 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 21339                                  
 21340                                  VLEN2	equ	($-VDiskSig2)
 21341                                  
 21342 00000AFC 332E33                  	db	'3.3'		; OEM - signature
 21343 00000AFF 8000                    	dw	128		; number of bytes/sector
 21344 00000B01 01                      	db	1		; sectors/cluster
 21345 00000B02 0100                    	dw	1		; reserved sectors
 21346 00000B04 01                      	db	1		; number of FAT copies
 21347 00000B05 4000                    	dw	64		; number of root dir entries
 21348 00000B07 0002                    	dw	512		; number of sectors
 21349 00000B09 FE                      	db	0FEh		; media descriptor
 21350 00000B0A 0600                    	dw	6		; number of sectors/FAT
 21351 00000B0C 0800                    	dw	8		; sectors per track
 21352 00000B0E 0100                    	dw	1		; number of heads
 21353 00000B10 0000                    	dw	0		; number of hidden sectors
 21354 00000B12 4004                    	dw	440h		; Start of free HMA in K (1M+64K)
 21355                                  
 21356                                  EndVDiskHMAHead: ; label byte
 21357                                  
 21358                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21359                                  ;
 21360                                  ; procedure : InstVDiskHeader
 21361                                  ;
 21362                                  ;             Installs the VDISK header to reserve the 64k of HMA
 21363                                  ;	      It puts a 32 byte header at 10000:0 and
 21364                                  ;	      another header at (seg of int19):0
 21365                                  ;
 21366                                  ; Inputs : None
 21367                                  ;
 21368                                  ; Outputs : None
 21369                                  ;
 21370                                  ; USES : DS,SI,AX,CX,DX
 21371                                  ;
 21372                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21373                                  
 21374                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 21375                                  
 21376                                  InstVDiskHeader:
 21377 00000B14 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 21378 00000B16 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			; seg of int vect table
 21379                                  
 21380                                  ;-------------- save old int 19 vector
 21381                                  
 21382                                  	; 23/10/2022
 21383 00000B18 A16400                  	mov	ax,[19h*4]
 21384                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19],ax
 21385 00000B1B 2EA3[F00A]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19],ax
 21386 00000B1F A16600                  	mov	ax,[19h*4+2]
 21387                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19+2],ax
 21388 00000B22 2EA3[F20A]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19+2],ax
 21389                                  
 21390                                  ;-------------- calculate seg of new int 19 handler
 21391                                  
 21392 00000B26 B448                    	mov	ah,48h			; allocate memory
 21393                                  	;mov	bx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead+15)>>4
 21394                                  	; 23/10/2022
 21395 00000B28 BB0400                  	mov	bx,4
 21396 00000B2B CD21                    	int	21h
 21397                                  
 21398                                  ;	if carry, fatal hanging error!!!!!
 21399                                  
 21400 00000B2D 48                      	dec	ax			; point to arena
 21401 00000B2E 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 21402                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],8	; owner = System
 21403 00000B30 26C70601000800          	mov	word [es:1],8
 21404                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC' ; System Code
 21405 00000B37 26C70608005343          	mov	word [es:8],'SC'
 21406 00000B3E 40                      	inc	ax
 21407 00000B3F 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; get back to allocated memory
 21408                                  
 21409                                  ;-------------- install new int 19 vector
 21410                                  
 21411 00000B41 FA                      	cli				; no reboots at this time
 21412                                  	;mov	word [19h*4],(VDInt19-StartVDHead)
 21413 00000B42 C70664002F00            	mov	word [19h*4],47
 21414 00000B48 A36600                  	mov	[19h*4+2],ax
 21415                                  
 21416                                  ;-------------- move the code into proper place
 21417                                  
 21418                                  	;mov	cx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead)
 21419 00000B4B B93400                  	mov	cx,52
 21420 00000B4E BE[C00A]                	mov	si,StartVDHead
 21421 00000B51 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 21422 00000B53 0E                      	push	cs
 21423 00000B54 1F                      	pop	ds
 21424 00000B55 FC                      	cld
 21425 00000B56 F3A4                    	rep	movsb
 21426 00000B58 FB                      	sti				; BUGBUG is sti OK now?
 21427                                  
 21428                                  ;-------------- mov the HMA VDisk head into HMA
 21429                                  
 21430                                  	; 23/10/2022
 21431 00000B59 57                      	push	di
 21432 00000B5A 06                      	push	es
 21433                                  
 21434                                  	;mov	ax,0FFFFh
 21435                                  	;mov	es,ax
 21436                                  	; 03/09/2023
 21437 00000B5B 49                      	dec	cx
 21438                                  	; cx = 0FFFFh
 21439 00000B5C 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 21440                                  
 21441 00000B5E BF1000                  	mov	di,10h
 21442                                  	;mov	cx,(EndVDiskHMAHead-VDiskHMAHead)
 21443 00000B61 B92000                  	mov	cx,32
 21444 00000B64 BE[F40A]                	mov	si,VDiskHMAHead
 21445 00000B67 F3A4                    	rep	movsb			; ds already set to cs
 21446                                  
 21447 00000B69 5F                      	pop	di
 21448 00000B6A 07                      	pop	es
 21449                                  
 21450 00000B6B C3                      	retn
 21451                                  
 21452                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21453                                  ; procedure : ClrVDISKHeader
 21454                                  ;
 21455                                  ;		Clears the first 32 bytes at 1MB boundary
 21456                                  ;		So that DOS/HIMEM is not confused about the VDISK header
 21457                                  ;		left by previous DOS=HIGH session
 21458                                  ;
 21459                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21460                                  
 21461                                  struc desc
 21462 00000000 ????                     .seg_lim:	resw	1		; seg limit 64K 
 21463 00000002 ????                     .lo_word:	resw	1		; 24 bit seg physical 
 21464 00000004 ??                       .hi_byte:	resb 	1		; address
 21465 00000005 ??                       .acc_rights:	resb	1		; access rights ( CPL0 - R/W )
 21466 00000006 ????                     .reserved:	resw	1		;
 21467                                   .size:
 21468                                  endstruc
 21469                                  
 21470                                  		; 23/10/2022
 21471                                  bmove:		;label byte
 21472                                  
 21473                                  dummy:		;times desc.size db 0	; desc	<>
 21474 00000B6C 00<rep 8h>              		times 8 db 0		 
 21475                                  gdt:		;times desc.size db 0	; desc	<>
 21476 00000B74 00<rep 8h>              		times 8 db 0
 21477 00000B7C FFFF                    src_desc:	dw	0FFFFh		; desc	<0ffffh,0,0,93h,0>
 21478 00000B7E 0000                    		dw	0
 21479 00000B80 00                      		db	0
 21480 00000B81 93                      		db	93h
 21481 00000B82 0000                    		dw	0
 21482 00000B84 FFFF                    tgt_desc:	dw	0FFFFh		; desc	<0ffffh,0,10h,93h,0>  ; 1MB
 21483 00000B86 0000                    		dw	0
 21484 00000B88 10                      		db	10h
 21485 00000B89 93                      		db	93h
 21486 00000B8A 0000                    		dw	0
 21487                                  
 21488                                  rombios_code:	;times desc.size db 0	; desc	<>
 21489 00000B8C 00<rep 8h>              		times 8 db 0
 21490                                  temp_stack:	;times desc.size db 0	; desc	<>
 21491 00000B94 00<rep 8h>              		times 8 db 0
 21492                                  
 21493 00000B9C 00<rep 20h>             ClrdVDISKHead:	times 32 db 0		; db 32 dup (0)
 21494

 21496                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, MSDOS 6.0 SYSINIT1.ASM)
 21497                                  
 21498                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 21499                                  ; (SYSINIT:0CA6h)
 21500                                  
 21501                                  ClrVDISKHeader:	; proc	near
 21502                                  
 21503                                  ;; 04/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimized)
 21504                                  ;;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 21505                                  ;; The following workaround get around a problem with the	      ;I070
 21506                                  ;; Tortugas and PS/2 30-286 BIOS when password server mode	      ;I070
 21507                                  ;; is set. On those machines the INT 15h block move code	      ;I070
 21508                                  ;; goes through the 8042 to twiddle A20 instead of port 92h.	      ;I070
 21509                                  ;; In password server mode the 8042 is disabled so the block	      ;I070
 21510                                  ;; move crashes the system. We can do this because these	      ;I070
 21511                                  ;; systems clear all of memory on a cold boot.			      ;I070
 21512                                  ;								      ;I070
 21513                                  ;               in      al,64h         ; Test for password servr mode ;I070
 21514                                  ;               test    al,10h         ; Is keyboard inhibited?	      ;I070
 21515                                  ;               jnz     short ClrVDISKok ; No, go do block move.      ;I070
 21516                                  ;                                      ; Check for Tortugas...	      ;I070
 21517                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],19F8h                ;I070
 21518                                  ;               je      short ClrVDISKno                              ;I070
 21519                                  ;                                      ; Check for mod 30-286	      ;I070
 21520                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],09FCh                ;I070
 21521                                  ;               jne     short ClrVDISKok			      ;I070
 21522                                  ;ClrVDISKno: 	retn	               ; Return w/o block move.	      ;I070
 21523                                  ;								      ;I070
 21524                                  ;ClrVDISKok:							      ;I070
 21525                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 21526                                  
 21527                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21528                                  	; ds = cs
 21529                                  
 21530                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 21531                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS SYSINIT:0CBFh)
 21532                                  
 21533 00000BBC 06                      	push	es
 21534 00000BBD 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs
 21535 00000BBF 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax
 21536 00000BC1 B10C                    	mov	cl,12
 21537 00000BC3 D3EA                    	shr	dx,cl
 21538 00000BC5 B104                    	mov	cl,4
 21539 00000BC7 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 21540 00000BC9 05[9C0B]                	add	ax,ClrdVDISKHead
 21541 00000BCC 80D200                  	adc	dl,0
 21542                                  
 21543                                  	;; 23/10/2022
 21544                                  	;;mov	[cs:src_desc+desc.lo_word],ax
 21545                                  	;mov	[cs:src_desc+2],ax
 21546                                  	;;mov	[cs:src_desc+desc.hi_byte],dl
 21547                                  	;mov	[cs:src_desc+4],dl
 21548                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21549                                  	;mov	[src_desc+desc.lo_word],ax
 21550 00000BCF A3[7E0B]                	mov	[src_desc+2],ax
 21551                                  	;mov	[src_desc+desc.hi_byte],dl
 21552 00000BD2 8816[800B]              	mov	[src_desc+4],dl
 21553                                  
 21554 00000BD6 B91000                  	mov	cx,16	; 16 words
 21555 00000BD9 0E                      	push	cs
 21556 00000BDA 07                      	pop	es
 21557 00000BDB BE[6C0B]                	mov	si,bmove
 21558 00000BDE B487                    	mov	ah,87h
 21559 00000BE0 CD15                    	int	15h	; EXTENDED MEMORY - BLOCK MOVE (AT,XT286,PS)
 21560                                  			; CX = number of words to move 
 21561                                  			; ES:SI -> global descriptor table
 21562                                  			; Return: CF set on error, AH = status
 21563 00000BE2 07                      	pop	es
 21564 00000BE3 C3                      	retn

 21567                                  ;
 21568                                  ; procedure : SaveFreeHMAPtr
 21569                                  ;
 21570                                  ;		Save the Free HMA pointer in BIOS variable for later use.
 21571                                  ;		(INT 2f ax==4a01 call returns pointer to free HMA)
 21572                                  ;		Normalizes the pointer to ffff:xxxx format and stores only
 21573                                  ;		the offset.
 21574                                  ;
 21575                                  ; Inputs : ES:DI - pointer to free HMA
 21576                                  ; Output : FreeHMAPtr in BIOS data segment updated
 21577                                  ;
 21578                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21579                                  
 21580                                  SaveFreeHMAPtr:
 21581                                  	; 03/09/2023
 21582 00000BE4 1E                      	push	ds
 21583 00000BE5 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 21584 00000BE8 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 21585                                  	;
 21586 00000BEA 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es
 21587 00000BEC B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh	   ; HMA segment
 21588                                  	; 03/09/2023
 21589 00000BEF A2[0D00]                	mov	[inHMA],al ; 0FFh
 21590                                  	;
 21591 00000BF2 29D8                    	sub	ax,bx
 21592 00000BF4 83C70F                  	add	di,15		   ; para round
 21593 00000BF7 83E7F0                  	and	di,0FFF0h
 21594 00000BFA B104                    	mov	cl,4
 21595 00000BFC D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 21596 00000BFE 29C7                    	sub	di,ax
 21597                                  	;
 21598                                  	; 03/09/2023
 21599                                  	;push	ds
 21600                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 0070h
 21601                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 0070h
 21602                                  	; 21/10/2022
 21603                                  	; 03/09/2023
 21604                                  	;mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 21605                                  	;mov	ds,ax
 21606 00000C00 893E[8C08]              	mov	[FreeHMAPtr],di	   ; (ds:8F7h for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 21607                                  	;mov	byte [inHMA],0FFh  ; (ds:0Dh)
 21608 00000C04 1F                      	pop	ds
 21609 00000C05 C3                      	retn

 21652                                  ; procedure : CPMHack
 21653                                  ;
 21654                                  ;		Copies the code from 0:c0 into ffff:0d0h
 21655                                  ;		for CPM compatibility
 21656                                  ;
 21657                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21658                                  
 21659                                  	; 11/12/2022
 21660                                  CPMHack:
 21661 00000C2D 1E                      	push	ds
 21662 00000C2E B9FFFF                  	mov	cx,0FFFFh
 21663 00000C31 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx		; ES = FFFF
 21664                                  	;xor	cx,cx
 21665                                  	; 11/12/2022
 21666 00000C33 41                      	inc	cx  ; cx = 0
 21667 00000C34 8ED9                    	mov	ds,cx		; DS = 0
 21668 00000C36 BEC000                  	mov	si,0C0h
 21669 00000C39 BFD000                  	mov	di,0D0h
 21670                                  	;mov	cx,5
 21671 00000C3C B105                    	mov	cl,5
 21672 00000C3E FC                      	cld
 21673 00000C3F F3A4                    	rep	movsb		; move 5 bytes from 0:C0 to FFFF:D0
 21674 00000C41 1F                      	pop	ds
 21675 00000C42 C3                      	retn

 21701                                  TempCDS:

 21720 00000C61 8B36[A702]              	mov	si,[top_of_cdss] ; 31/12/2022
 21721                                  
 21722                                  ;	BUGBUG - we don't update confbot - won't someone else use it?
 21723                                  ;	chuckst -- answer: no. Confbot is used to access the CDSs,
 21724                                  ;	25 jul 92  which are stored BELOW it. Alloclim is the
 21725                                  ;		   variable which has the top of free memory for
 21726                                  ;		   device driver loads, etc.
 21727

 21731                                  ;		that automatically updates alloclim every time we
 21732                                  ;		set up some new CDSs. Instead, I've added code
 21733                                  ;		which pre-allocates space for 26 CDSs. This
 21734                                  ;	        way we've got room for worst case CDSs before
 21735                                  ;		we place MagicDrv.sys
 21736                                  ;

 21753                                  
 21754                                  ;*	Initialize our temporary CDSs. We'll init each CDS with the
 21755                                  ;	info from the corresponding DPB.
 21756                                  ;
 21757                                  ;	(cx) = count of CDSs left to process
 21758                                  ;	(es:di) = address of next CDS
 21759                                  
 21760                                  fooset:
 21761                                  	; 23/10/2022
 21762 00000C7A 2EA1[A902]              	mov	ax,[cs:DirStrng] ; "A:"
 21763 00000C7E AB                      	stosw				; setup the root as the curdir
 21764

 21782 00000C92 F3AA                    	rep	stosb			; zero out rest of CURDIR_TEXTs
 21783                                  
 21784                                  ;	should handle the system that does not have any floppies.
 21785                                  ;	in this case,we are going to pretended there are two dummy floppies
 21786                                  ;	in the system. still they have dpb and cds,but we are going to
 21787                                  ;	0 out curdir_flags,curdir_devptr of cds so ibmdos can issue
 21788                                  ;	"invalid drive specification" message when the user try to
 21789                                  ;	access them.
 21790                                  ;
 21791                                  ;	(ax) = 0
 21792                                  ;	(es:di) = CURDIR_FLAGS in the CDS records
 21793                                  ;	(ds:si) = Next DPB (-1 if none)
 21794

 21796 00000C97 740C                    	je	short fooset_zero	; don't have any physical drive.
 21797                                  
 21798                                  ;	check to see if we are faking floppy drives. if not go to normcds.
 21799                                  ;	if we are faking floppy drives then see if this cds being initialised
 21800                                  ;	is for drive a: or b: by checking the appropriate field in the dpb
 21801                                  ;	pointed to by ds:si. if not for a: or b: then go to normcds. if
 21802                                  ;	for a: or b: then execute the code given below starting at fooset_zero.
 21803                                  ;	for dpb offsets look at inc\dpb.inc.
 21804                                  
 21805                                  	; 03/09/2023

 21809                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:fake_floppy_drv],1
 21810 00000C9F 750A                    	jne	short normcds 		; machine has floppy drives
 21811                                  	;cmp	byte [si+DPB.drive],1	; if dpb_drive = 0 (a) or 1 (b).
 21812                                  	;cmp	byte [si],1

 21815                                  
 21816                                  	; 30/12/2023
 21817                                  	; ax = 0
 21818                                  fooset_zero:
 21819 00000CA5 B103                    	mov	cl,3			; the next dbp pointer
 21820                                  					; AX should be zero here
 21821 00000CA7 F3AB                    	rep	stosw
 21822                                  	; 30/12/2023
 21823                                  	;pop	cx
 21824 00000CA9 EB0F                    	jmp	short get_next_dpb ; findcds
 21825

 22281                                  ;memory size too.
 22282                                  ; default buffers = 2
 22283                                  ; if diskette media > 360 kb,then default buffers = 3
 22284                                  ; if memory size > 128 kb (2000h para),then default buffers = 5
 22285                                  ; if memory size > 256 kb (4000h para),then default buffers = 10
 22286                                  ; if memory size > 512 kb (8000h para),then default buffers = 15.
 22287                                  
 22288                                  chk_memsize_for_buffers:

 22595                                  ;global rearm command for shared interrupt devices attached in the system;
 22596                                  ;shared interrupt attachment has some problem when it issues interrupt
 22597                                  ;during a warm reboot. once the interrupt is presented by the attachment,
 22598                                  ;no further interrupts on that level will be presented until a global rearm
 22599                                  ;is issued. by the request of the system architecture group, msbio will
 22600                                  ;issue a global rearm after every device driver is loaded.
 22601                                  ;to issue a global rearm:	;for pc1,xt,palace
 22602                                  ;
 22603                                  ;			  out 02f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 2
 22604                                  ;			  out 02f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 3
 22605                                  ;			  out 02f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 4
 22606                                  ;			  out 02f5h,xx  ; interrupt level 5
 22607                                  ;			  out 02f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 6
 22608                                  ;			  out 02f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 7
 22609                                  ;
 22610                                  ;	for pc at,in addition to the above commands,
 22611                                  ;	need to handle the secondary interrupt handler
 22612                                  ;
 22613                                  ;			  out 06f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 10
 22614                                  ;			  out 06f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 11
 22615                                  ;			  out 06f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 12
 22616                                  ;			  out 06f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 14
 22617                                  ;			  out 06f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 15
 22618                                  ;
 22619                                  ;	for round-up machine
 22620                                  ;
 22621                                  ;			  none.
 22622                                  
 22623                                  ; where xx stands for any value.
 22624                                  ;
 22625                                  ; for your information,after naples level machine,the system service bios
 22626                                  ; call (int 15h),function ah=0c0h returns the system configuration parameters
 22627                                  
 22628                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22629

 22834                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22835                                  ; Do_Install_Exec
 22836                                  ;
 22837                                  ; This procedure is used to EXEC a program being loaded via the 
 22838                                  ; "install=" mechanism in config.sys. It does this by setting up
 22839                                  ; the parameters, and then jumping to sysinit_base, which has been
 22840                                  ; setup in low memory. When complete, sysinit_base will jump back
 22841                                  ; up to this procedure (if sysinit remains uncorrupted by the installed
 22842                                  ; program).

 22853                                  ; after the filename. so parameter starts after that. if next

 22855                                  ; we already encountered used to be a carrage return. in this
 22856                                  ; case,let's set the length to 0 which will be followed by
 22857                                  ; carridge return.

 22860                                  ;character after =.

 22867

 23007                                  ;**	ParaRound - Round Up length to paragraph multiple
 23008                                  ;
 23009                                  ;	ParaRound rounds a byte count up to a multiple of 16, then divides
 23010                                  ;	by 16 yielding a "length in paragraphs" value.
 23011                                  ;
 23012                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = byte length
 23013                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = rounded up length in paragraphs
 23014                                  ;	USES	ax, flags
 23015                                  
 23016                                  ParaRound:
 23017 0000112F 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 23018 00001132 D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 23019 00001134 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 23020 00001136 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 23021 00001138 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 23022 0000113A C3                      	retn
 23023                                  
 23024                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23025                                  ; sysinit_base module.
 23026                                  ;
 23027                                  ; This module is relocated by the routine EndFile to a location in low
 23028                                  ; memory. It is then called by SYSINIT to perform the EXEC of programs
 23029                                  ; that are being loaded by the "install=" command. After the EXEC call
 23030                                  ; completes, this module performs a checksum on the SYSINIT code (at the
 23031                                  ; top of memory) to be sure that the EXECed program did not damage it.
 23032                                  ; If it did, then this module will print an error message and stop the
 23033                                  ; system. Otherwise, it returns control to SYSINIT.
 23034                                  ;
 23035                                  ;in: after relocation,
 23036                                  ;    ax = 4b00h - load and execute the program dos function.
 23037                                  ;    ds = confbot. segment of config.sys file image
 23038                                  ;    es = sysinitseg. segment of sysinit module itself.
 23039                                  ;    ds:dx = pointer to asciiz string of the path,filename to be executed.
 23040                                  ;    es:bx = pointer to a parameter block for load.
 23041                                  ;    SI_end (byte) - offset vaule of end of sysinit module label
 23042                                  ;    bigsize (word) - # of word from confbot to SI_end.
 23043                                  ;    chksum (word) - sum of every byte from confbot to SI_end in a
 23044                                  ;			word boundary moduler form.
 23045                                  ;    sysinit_ptr (dword ptr) - return address to sysinit module.
 23046                                  ;
 23047                                  ;note: sysinit should save necessary registers and when the control is back
 23048                                  
 23049                                  	; 24/10/2022
 23050                                  	; (SYSINIT:115Ch for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 23051                                  sysinit_base:				
 23052 0000113B 2E8C166200              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_ss],ss	; save stack
 23053 00001140 2E89266400              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_sp],sp	
 23054 00001145 CD21                    	int	21h			; load/exec dos call.
 23055 00001147 2E8E166200              	mov	ss,[cs:sysinit_base_ss]	; restore stack
 23056 0000114C 2E8B266400              	mov	sp,[cs:sysinit_base_sp]
 23057 00001151 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore confbot seg
 23058 00001152 07                      	pop	es			; restore sysinitseg
 23059 00001153 7216                    	jc	short sysinit_base_end	; load/exec function failed.
 23060                                  					; at this time,i don't have to worry about
 23061                                  					; that sysinit module has been broken or not.
 23062 00001155 E81800                  	call	sum_up			; otherwise,check if it is good.
 23063 00001158 263906[DA02]            	cmp	[es:checksum],ax
 23064 0000115D 740C                    	je	short sysinit_base_end
 23065                                  
 23066                                  ;	memory broken. show "memory allocation error" message and stall.
 23067                                  
 23068 0000115F B409                    	mov	ah,9
 23069 00001161 0E                      	push	cs
 23070 00001162 1F                      	pop	ds
 23071                                  	; 30/12/2022
 23072                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:12B8h)
 23073                                  	;mov	dx,102
 23074 00001163 BA6600                  	mov	dx,mem_alloc_err_msgx-sysinit_base ; 65h (for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 23075                                  					; 66h (for MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT)
 23076 00001166 CD21                    	int	21h
 23077                                  		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 23078                                  		; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 23079                                  
 23080                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 23081                                  stall:
 23082                                  	; 24/10/2022
 23083                                  _stall: 
 23084                                  	; 11/12/2022
 23085 00001168 F4                      	hlt 
 23086                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 23087                                  	;hlt				;use HLT to minimize energy consumption
 23088 00001169 EBFD                            jmp	short _stall
 23089                                  
 23090                                  sysinit_base_end: 
 23091 0000116B 26FF2E[D602]            	jmp	far [es:sysinit_ptr]	;return back to sysinit module
 23092                                  
 23093                                  ;-------------------------------------
 23094                                  
 23095                                  sum_up:
 23096                                  
 23097                                  ;in:   es - sysinitseg.
 23098                                  ;out:  ax - result
 23099                                  ;
 23100                                  ;remark: since this routine will only check starting from "locstack" to the end of
 23101                                  ;	 sysinit segment,the data area, and the current stack area are not
 23102                                  ;	 coverd. in this sense,this check sum routine only gives a minimal
 23103                                  ;	 gaurantee to be safe.
 23104                                  ;
 23105                                  ;first sum up confbot seg.
 23106                                  
 23107 00001170 1E                      	push	ds
 23108                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 23109                                  	; (SYSINIT:12C6h)
 23110 00001171 26A1[A302]              	mov	ax,[es:CONFBOT]
 23111                                  	; 24/10/2022
 23112                                  	;mov	ax,[es:top_of_cdss]
 23113 00001175 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 23114 00001177 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 23115 00001179 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 23116 0000117B 268B0E[D002]            	mov	cx,[es:config_size]	; if config_size has been broken,then this
 23117                                  					; whole test better fail.
 23118 00001180 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1			; make it a word count
 23119 00001182 7406                    	jz	short sum_sys_code	; when config.sys file not exist.
 23120                                  sum1:
 23121 00001184 0304                    	add	ax,[si]
 23122 00001186 46                      	inc	si
 23123 00001187 46                      	inc	si
 23124 00001188 E2FA                    	loop	sum1
 23125                                  ;now,sum up sysinit module.
 23126                                  sum_sys_code:
 23127                                  	; 24/10/2022
 23128 0000118A BE8A11                  	mov	si,locstack ; 5A6h (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23129                                  			    ; 532h (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23130                                  				        ; starting after the stack.  M069
 23131                                  					;  this does not cover the possible stack code!!!
 23132                                  	;;mov	cx,22688  ; for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
 23133                                  	; 02/11/2022
 23134                                  	;mov	cx,3D20h  ; (15648) for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS (SYSINIT)	
 23135                                  	; 30/12/2022  
 23136 0000118D B9[504D]                	mov	cx,SI_end ; (22688) 	; SI_end is the label at the end of sysinit
 23137 00001190 29F1                    	sub	cx,si			;  from after_checksum to SI_end
 23138 00001192 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 23139                                  sum2:
 23140 00001194 260304                  	add	ax,[es:si]
 23141 00001197 46                      	inc	si
 23142 00001198 46                      	inc	si
 23143 00001199 E2F9                    	loop	sum2
 23144 0000119B 1F                      	pop	ds
 23145 0000119C C3                      	retn
 23146                                  
 23147                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23148                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS 4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23149                                  ; (SYSINIT:12F2h)
 23150

 23170                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23171                                  ; Set_Buffer
 23172                                  ;
 23173                                  ;function: set buffers in the real memory.				  
 23174                                  ;	   lastly set the memhi,memlo for the next available free address.
 23175                                  ;
 23176                                  ;input:    ds:bx -> buffinfo.
 23177                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo = 0] = available space for the hash bucket.	  
 23178                                  ;	   singlebuffersize = buffer header size + sector size		  
 23179                                  ;
 23180                                  ;output:   buffers Queue established.	       				   
 23181                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo] = address of the next available free space.	   
 23182                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23183                                  
 23184                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23185                                  	; (SYSINIT:11DCh)
 23186                                  
 23187                                  set_buffer:
 23188 000011BC 30D2                    	xor	dl,dl				; assume buffers not in HMA
 23189 000011BE E85500                  	call	GetBufferAddr
 23190 000011C1 7402                    	jz	short set_buff_1
 23191                                  	;mov	dl,1				; buffers in HMA
 23192                                  	; 17/09/2023
 23193 000011C3 FEC2                    	inc	dl ; mov dl,1
 23194                                  set_buff_1:
 23195                                  	; 25/10/2022
 23196                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue],di	; head of Buff Q
 23197 000011C5 893F                    	mov	[bx],di
 23198                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue+2],es
 23199 000011C7 8C4702                  	mov	[bx+2],es
 23200                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Dirty_Buff_Count],0 ;set dirty_count to 0.
 23201 000011CA C747040000              	mov	word [bx+4],0
 23202                                  
 23203 000011CF 89F8                    	mov	ax,di
 23204 000011D1 2E8B0E[9902]            	mov	cx,[cs:buffers]
 23205 000011D6 57                      	push	di				; remember first buffer
 23206                                  
 23207                                  ;	for each buffer
 23208                                  
 23209                                  nxt_buff:
 23210 000011D7 E86100                  	call	set_buffer_info 		; set buf_link,buf_id...
 23211 000011DA 89C7                    	mov	di,ax
 23212 000011DC E2F9                    	loop	nxt_buff
 23213                                  
 23214 000011DE 2E2B3E[9D02]            	sub	di,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; point to last buffer
 23215                                  
 23216 000011E3 59                      	pop	cx				; get first buffer
 23217                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],cx	; last->next = first
 23218 000011E4 26890D                  	mov	[es:di],cx
 23219 000011E7 87F9                    	xchg	cx,di
 23220                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_prev],cx	; first->prev = last
 23221                                  	; 25/10/2022
 23222 000011E9 26894D02                	mov	[es:di+2],cx
 23223                                  
 23224 000011ED 08D2                    	or	dl,dl				; In HMA ?
 23225 000011EF 7417                    	jz	short set_buff_2		; no
 23226                                  	;mov	byte [bx+BUFFINF.Buff_In_HMA],1
 23227 000011F1 C6470C01                	mov	byte [bx+12],1
 23228 000011F5 2EA1[6403]              	mov	ax,[cs:memhi]			; seg of scratch buff
 23229                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff],0	; offset of sctarch buff is 0
 23230 000011F9 C7470D0000              	mov	word [bx+13],0
 23231                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff+2],ax
 23232 000011FE 89470F                  	mov	word [bx+15],ax
 23233 00001201 2EA1[9D02]              	mov	ax,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; size of scratch buff
 23234                                  	;sub	ax,bufinsiz ; 20		; buffer head not required
 23235                                  	;; 05/09/2023
 23236                                  	;;sub	ax,24 ; bufinsiz		; (bufinsiz is 24 in PCDOS 7.1)
 23237 00001205 83E814                  	sub	ax,20
 23238                                  set_buff_2:
 23239 00001208 2E0106[6203]            	add	[cs:memlo],ax
 23240                                  	;or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],for_devmark ; 2
 23241 0000120D 2E800E[9E14]02          	or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],2
 23242                                  	;call	round
 23243                                  	;retn
 23244                                  	; 12/12/2022
 23245 00001213 E93430                  	jmp	round
 23246                                  
 23247                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23248                                  ; procedure : GetBufferAddr
 23249                                  ;
 23250                                  ;	      Gets the buffer address either in HMA or in Lo Mem
 23251                                  ;
 23252                                  ; returns in es:di the buffer adress
 23253                                  ; returns NZ if allocated in HMA
 23254                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23255                                  
 23256                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 23257                                  GetBufferAddr:
 23258 00001216 53                      	push	bx
 23259 00001217 52                      	push	dx
 23260 00001218 2EA1[9D02]              	mov	ax, [cs:singlebuffersize]
 23261 0000121C 2EF726[9902]            	mul	word [cs:buffers]
 23262                                  	;add	ax,0Fh
 23263 00001221 83C00F                  	add	ax,15 
 23264                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 23265                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; para round
 23266                                  	; 12/12/2022
 23267 00001224 24F0                    	and	al,~15	; 0F0h
 23268 00001226 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 23269 00001228 B8024A                  	mov	ax,4A02h
 23270                                  	;mov	ax,((multMULT<<8)+multMULTALLOCHMA)
 23271 0000122B CD2F                    	int	2Fh	; DOS 5+ - ALLOCATE HMA SPACE
 23272                                  			;     AX = 4A02h
 23273                                  			;     BX = number of bytes
 23274                                  			; Return:
 23275                                  			;     ES:DI -> start of allocated HMA block or FFFFh:FFFFh
 23276                                  			;     BX = number of bytes actually allocated
 23277                                  			;	   (rounded up to next paragraph)
 23278                                  			; Notes:
 23279                                  			;     this call is not valid unless DOS is loaded in the HMA
 23280                                  			;     (DOS=HIGH)
 23281                                  
 23282 0000122D 83FFFF                  	cmp	di,0FFFFh
 23283 00001230 7506                    	jne	short got_hma
 23284                                  	
 23285                                  	;mov	di,0			; dont xor di,di Z flag needed
 23286                                  	; 05/09/2023
 23287                                  	; zf=1
 23288 00001232 47                      	inc	di ; 0FFFFh -> 0
 23289                                  	; zf=1
 23290                                  	
 23291                                  	;zf=1
 23292                                  	;xor	di,di	; 25/10/2022
 23293                                  	;zf=1
 23294 00001233 2E8E06[6403]            	mov	es,[cs:memhi]
 23295                                  got_hma:
 23296 00001238 5A                      	pop	dx
 23297 00001239 5B                      	pop	bx
 23298 0000123A C3                      	retn
 23299                                  
 23300                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23301                                  
 23302                                  set_buffer_info:
 23303                                  
 23304                                  ;function: set buf_link,buf_id,buf_sector
 23305                                  ;
 23306                                  ;in: es:di -> buffer header to be set.
 23307                                  ;    ax = di
 23308                                  ;
 23309                                  ;out:
 23310                                  ;    above entries set.
 23311                                  
 23312                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 23313 0000123B 2EFF36[BD02]            	push	word [cs:buf_prev_off]
 23314                                  	;pop	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_prev]
 23315 00001240 268F4502                	pop	word [es:di+2]
 23316 00001244 2EA3[BD02]              	mov	[cs:buf_prev_off],ax
 23317 00001248 2E0306[9D02]            	add	ax,[cs:singlebuffersize]	;adjust ax
 23318                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],ax
 23319 0000124D 268905                  	mov	[es:di],ax
 23320                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_ID],00FFh  ; new buffer free
 23321 00001250 26C74504FF00            	mov	word [es:di+4],00FFh
 23322                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector],0   ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 23323 00001256 26C745060000            	mov	word [es:di+6],0
 23324                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector+2],0 ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 23325 0000125C 26C745080000            	mov	word [es:di+8],0
 23326 00001262 C3                      	retn

 23328                                  ; ======================================================================
 23329                                  ; MSSTACK initialization routine - MSDOS 6.0 - SYSDINIT1.ASM - 1991
 23330                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23331                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23332                                  
 23333                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23334                                  ; ibmstack initialization routine.
 23335                                  ;
 23336                                  ;	to follow the standard interrupt sharing scheme, msstack.asm
 23337                                  ;	has been modified. this initialization routine also has to
 23338                                  ;	be modified because for the interrupt level 7 and 15, firstflag
 23339                                  ;	should be set to signal that this interrupt handler is the
 23340                                  ;	first handler hooked to this interrupt vector.
 23341                                  ;	we determine this by looking at the instruction pointed by
 23342                                  ;	this vector. if it is iret, then this handler should be the
 23343                                  ;	first one. in our case, only the interrupt vector 77h is the
 23344                                  ;	interrupt level 15. (we don't hook interrupt level 7.)
 23345                                  ;
 23346                                  ;	the followings are mainly due to m.r.t; ptm fix of p886 12/3/86
 23347                                  ;	some design changes are needed to the above interrupt sharing
 23348                                  ;	method. the above sharing scheme assumes that 1). interrupt
 23349                                  ;	sharing is never done on levels that have bios support. 2). "phantom"
 23350                                  ;	interrupts would only be generated on levels 7 and 15.
 23351                                  ;	these assumptions are not true any more. we have to use the firstflag
 23352                                  ;	for every level of interrupt. we will set the firstflag on the following
 23353                                  ;	conditions:
 23354                                  ;
 23355                                  ;	 a.	 if the cs portion of the vector is 0000, then "first"
 23356                                  ;	 b. else if cs:ip points to valid shared header, then not "first"
 23357                                  ;	 c. else if cs:ip points to an iret, then "first"
 23358                                  ;	 d. else if cs:ip points to dummy, then "first"
 23359                                  ;
 23360                                  ;	where dummy is - the cs portion must be f000, and the ip portion must
 23361                                  ;	be equal to the value at f000:ff01. this location is the initial value
 23362                                  ;	from vector_table for interrupt 7, one of the preserved addresses in all
 23363                                  ;	the bioses for all of the machines.
 23364                                  ;
 23365                                  ;	system design group requests bios to handle the phantom interrupts.
 23366                                  ;
 23367                                  ;	the "phantom" interrupt is an illegal interrupt such as an interrupt
 23368                                  ;	produced by the bogus adapter card even without interrupt request is
 23369                                  ;	set.  more specifically, 1). the 8259 has a feature when running in
 23370                                  ;	edge triggered mode to latch a pulse and present the interrupt when
 23371                                  ;	the processor indicates interrupt acknowledge (inta). the interrupt
 23372                                  ;	pulse was exist at the time of inta to get a "phantom" interrupt.
 23373                                  ;	2). or, this is caused by adapter cards placing a glitch on the
 23374                                  ;	interrupt line.
 23375                                  ;
 23376                                  ;	to handle those "phantom" interrupts, the main stack code will check
 23377                                  ;	the own firstflag, and if it is not "first" (which means the forward
 23378                                  ;	pointer points to the legal shared interrupt handler), then pass the
 23379                                  ;	control. if it is the first, then the following action should be
 23380                                  ;	taken. we don't have to implement skack logic in this case.
 23381                                  ;
 23382                                  ;	to implement this logic, we rather choose a simple method.
 23383                                  ;	if ont of the above "firstflag" conditions is met, we are not
 23384                                  ;	going to hook this interrupt vector. the reason is if the original
 23385                                  ;	vector points to "iret" and do nothing, we don't need
 23386                                  ;	to implement the stack logic for it. this will simplify implementation
 23387                                  ;	while maintaining compatibility with the old version of dos.
 23388                                  ;	this implies that in the main stack code, there might be a stack code
 23389                                  ;	that will never be used, a dead code.
 23390                                  ;
 23391                                  ;in - cs, ds -> sysinitseg, es -> relocated stack code & data.
 23392                                  
 23393                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23394                                  	; (SYSINIT:1287h)
 23395                                  
 23396                                  	; 14/12/2022
 23397                                  stackinit:
 23398 00001263 50                      	push	ax
 23399 00001264 1E                      	push	ds
 23400 00001265 06                      	push	es
 23401 00001266 53                      	push	bx
 23402 00001267 51                      	push	cx
 23403 00001268 52                      	push	dx
 23404 00001269 57                      	push	di
 23405 0000126A 56                      	push	si
 23406 0000126B 55                      	push	bp
 23407                                  
 23408                                  ;currently es -> stack code area
 23409                                  
 23410                                  	; 12/12/2022
 23411                                  	; ds = cs
 23412 0000126C A1[8C02]                	mov	ax,[stack_count]
 23413 0000126F 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax  ; *!*!*  
 23414                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 23415                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1290h)
 23416                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_count] ; !!	;defined in cs
 23417 00001271 26A3[0200]              	mov	[es:stackcount],ax		;defined in stack code area
 23418                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1298h)

 23421                                  	; 12/12/2022

 23423                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 23424                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 23425                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr]  ; !!
 23426 0000127F 26A3[0800]              	mov	[es:stacks],ax
 23427                                  	; 12/12/2022
 23428 00001283 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax ; *!*
 23429 00001285 A1[9202]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr+2]

 23431                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)

 23433 00001288 26A3[0A00]              	mov	[es:stacks+2],ax
 23434

 23436

 23438

 23440                                  	; 12/12/2022

 23443                                  
 23444                                  ; the stacks will always immediately follow the table entries
 23445                                  
 23446 00001291 B80800                  	mov	ax,entrysize ; 8

 23451 00001296 01E8                    	add	ax,bp
 23452 00001298 26A3[0400]              	mov	[es:stackat],ax
 23453 0000129C 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 23454 0000129E 83EB02                  	sub	bx,2
 23455

 23457                                  
 23458 000012A1 268B3E[0400]            	mov	di,[es:stackat]
 23459 000012A6 26A1[0600]              	mov	ax,[es:stacksize]
 23460 000012AA F7E1                    	mul	cx

 23462 000012AE 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 23463 000012B0 06                      	push	es
 23464 000012B1 1F                      	pop	ds				;ds = relocated stack code seg.
 23465                                  
 23466                                  ;now, ds -> stack code area
 23467                                  
 23468 000012B2 8E06[0A00]              	mov	es,[stacks+2]			; get segment of stack area.
 23469 000012B6 FC                      	cld
 23470 000012B7 F3AA                    	rep	stosb
 23471                                  
 23472 000012B9 8B0E[0200]              	mov	cx,[stackcount]
 23473                                  
 23474                                  ; loop for "count" times, building a table entry
 23475                                  ;  cs = sysinitseg, ds = relocated stack code seg, es = segment of stack space
 23476                                  ;  cx = number of entries
 23477                                  ;  es:bp => base of stacks - 2
 23478                                  ;  es:bx => first table entry

 24199 0000142C 26C51C                  	lds	bx,[es:si]
 24200 0000142F 1E                      	push	ds
 24201 00001430 5A                      	pop	dx
 24202                                  		
 24203                                  	;cmp	dx,0
 24204                                  	;je	short int_xx_first
 24205                                  	; 05/09/2023
 24206 00001431 21D2                    	and	dx,dx
 24207 00001433 741E                    	jz	short int_xx_first
 24208                                  	
 24209 00001435 803FCF                  	cmp	byte [bx],0CFh
 24210 00001438 7419                    	je	short int_xx_first
 24211                                  	
 24212 0000143A 817F064B42              	cmp	word [bx+6],424Bh
 24213 0000143F 7411                    	je	short int_xx_not_first
 24214                                  	
 24215 00001441 81FA00F0                	cmp	dx,0F000h
 24216 00001445 750B                    	jne	short int_xx_not_first
 24217                                  
 24218 00001447 06                      	push	es
 24219                                  	;push	dx
 24220                                  	;mov	dx,0F000h
 24221 00001448 8EC2                    	mov	es,dx
 24222 0000144A 263B1E01FF              	cmp	bx,[es:0FF01h]
 24223                                        	;pop	dx
 24224 0000144F 07                      	pop	es
 24225 00001450 7401                    	je	short int_xx_first
 24226                                  
 24227                                  int_xx_not_first:
 24228 00001452 F9                      	stc
 24229                                  int_xx_first:
 24230 00001453 1F                      	pop	ds
 24231 00001454 C3                      	retn
 24232                                  
 24233                                  ;%endif
 24234                                  
 24235                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 24236                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24237                                  
 24238                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 24239                                  ; (SYSINIT:1610h)
 24240                                  
 24241                                  ; 13/04/2024 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.22 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 24242                                  ; (SYSINIT:1745h)
 24243                                  
 24244                                  new_init_loop:
 24245                                  
 24246                                  ;input: si=ofset into vector table of the particular int vector being adjusted
 24247                                  ;	bx=ds:offset of oldxx, where will be saved the pointer to original owner
 24248                                  ;	dx=ds:offset of intxx, the new interrupt handler
 24249                                  ;	di=offset value of int19old&aa variable in bios.
 24250                                  ;	es=zero, segid of vector table
 24251                                  ;	ds=relocated stack code segment
 24252                                  
 24253                                  ; 13/04/2024
 24254                                  %if 0
 24255                                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 24256                                  	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 24257                                  	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 24258                                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 24259                                  
 24260                                  	push	ds
 24261                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 70h
 24262                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 70h
 24263                                  	; 21/10/2022
 24264                                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 24265                                  	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 24266                                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;int 19 handler
 24267                                  	mov	[di],ax
 24268                                  	mov	ax,[es:si+2]
 24269                                  	mov	[di+2],ax
 24270                                  	pop	ds
 24271                                  %else
 24272                                  	; 13/04/2024 - Retro DOS v4.2
 24273 00001455 1E                      	push	ds
 24274 00001456 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 24275 0000145A 894702                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 24276 0000145D 50                      	push	ax
 24277 0000145E 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 24278 00001461 8907                    	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 24279 00001463 50                      	push	ax
 24280 00001464 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 24281 00001467 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 24282 00001469 58                      	pop	ax			;int 19 handler
 24283 0000146A 8905                    	mov	[di],ax
 24284 0000146C 58                      	pop	ax
 24285 0000146D 894502                  	mov	[di+2],ax
 24286 00001470 1F                      	pop	ds
 24287                                  %endif
 24288 00001471 268914                  	mov	[es:si],dx  	;set vector to point to new int handler
 24289 00001474 268C5C02                	mov	[es:si+2],ds
 24290 00001478 C3                      	retn
 24291                                  
 24292                                  ; End of STACK initialization routine
 24293                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 24294

 24298                                  ;    [memlo] = 0
 24299                                  ;    al = id for devmark_id
 24300                                  ;out: devmark established.

 24319 0000147E 2E890E[9C14]            	mov	[cs:devmark_addr],cx
 24320 00001483 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx

 24323 00001485 26A20000                	mov	[es:0],al
 24324 00001489 41                      	inc	cx
 24325                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.seg],cx
 24326 0000148A 26890E0100              	mov	[es:1],cx
 24327                                  
 24328                                  	; 04/09/2023
 24329                                  	;pop	cx
 24330                                  	;pop	es
 24331                                  	
 24332 0000148F 2EFF06[6403]            	inc	word [cs:memhi]
 24333 00001494 C3                      	retn

 24538                                  ;		DB	2		; NUMBER OF STRINGS (0, 1, 2)
 24539                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 24540                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA DELIMITER LIST,
 24541                                  ;					; TYPICAL ARE ";", "="
