 24573                                  struc _$P_PARMSX_Blk		;AN000;
 24574 00000000 ??                       .MinP: resb 1			;AN000; Minimum positional number
 24575 00000001 ??                       .MaxP:	resb 1			;AN000; Maximum positional number
 24576 00000002 ????                     .1st_Control: resw 1		;AN000; Address of the 1st CONTROL block
 24577                                  endstruc
 24578                                  
 24579                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24580                                  ; << Control field definition  >>
 24581                                  ;
 24582                                  ;
 24583                                  ;CONTROL   LABEL   BYTE
 24584                                  ;	   DW	   MATCH_FLAGS	   ; CONTROLS TYPE MATCHED
 24585                                  ;				   ; 8000H=NUMERIC VALUE, (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 24586                                  ;				   ; 4000H=SIGNED NUMERIC VALUE (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 24587                                  ;				   ; 2000H=SIMPLE STRING(VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 24588                                  ;				   ; 1000H=DATE STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 24589                                  ;				   ; 0800H=TIME STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 24590                                  ;				   ; 0400H=COMPLEX LIST (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 24591                                  ;				   ; 0200H=FILE SPEC (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 24592                                  ;				   ; 0100H=DRIVE ONLY (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 24593                                  ;				   ; 0080H=QUOTED STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 24594                                  ;				   ; 0010H=IGNORE ":" AT END IN MATCH
 24595                                  ;				   ; 0002H=REPEATS ALLOWED
 24596                                  ;				   ; 0001H=OPTIONAL
 24597                                  ;	   DW	   FUNCTION_FLAGS
 24598                                  ;				   ; 0001H=CAP RESULT BY FILE TABLE
 24599                                  ;				   ; 0002H=CAP RESULT BY CHAR TABLE
 24600                                  ;				   ; 0010H=REMOVE ":" AT END
 24601                                  ; (tm10)			   ; 0020H=colon is not necessary for switch
 24602                                  ;	   DW	   RESULT	   ; RESULT BUFFER
 24603                                  ;	   DW	   VALUES	   ; VALUE LISTS
 24604                                  ;	   DB	   nid		   ; NUMBER OF KEYWORD/SWITCH SYNONYMS IN FOLLOWING LIST
 24605                                  ;	   DB	   "...",0         ; IF n >0, KEYWORD 1
 24606                                  ;	   :
 24607                                  ;
 24608                                  ;Note:
 24609                                  ;    - The MATCH_FLAG is bit significant. You can set, for example, TIME bit and
 24610                                  ;      DATE bit simalteniously.
 24611                                  ;
 24612                                  ;      The parser examins each bit along with the following priority.
 24613                                  ;
 24614                                  ;      COMPLEX -> DATE -> TIME -> NUMERIC VAL -> SIGNED NUMERIC VAL -> DRIVE ->
 24615                                  ;      FILE SPEC -> SIMPLE STRING.
 24616                                  ;
 24617                                  ;    - When the FUNCTION_FLAG is 0001 or 0002, the STRING pointed to by a pointer
 24618                                  ;      in the result buffer is capitalized.
 24619                                  ;
 24620                                  ;    - Match_Flags 0001H and 0002H have meaning only for the positional.
 24621                                  ;
 24622                                  ;    - The "...",0 (bottom most line) does require '=' or '/'. When you need a
 24623                                  ;      switch, for example, '/A', then STRING points to;
 24624                                  ;
 24625                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 24626                                  ;			DB   '/A',0
 24627                                  ;
 24628                                  ;      When you need a keyword, for example, 'CODEPAGE=', then "...",0 will be;
 24629                                  ;
 24630                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 24631                                  ;			DB   'CODEPAGE=',0
 24632                                  ;
 24633                                  ;    - "..." must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 24634                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 24635                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 24636                                  ;
 24637                                  ;    - One "..." can contain only one switch or keyword. If you need, for
 24638                                  ;      example /A and /B, the format will be;
 24639                                  ;
 24640                                  ;			DB    2 	; number of following synonyms
 24641                                  ;			DB    '/A',0
 24642                                  ;			DB    '/B',0
 24643                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24644                                  
 24645                                  ;**** Match_Flags
 24646                                  
 24647                                  _$P_Num_Val	   equ	8000h		;AN000; Numeric Value
 24648                                  _$P_SNum_Val	   equ	4000h		;AN000; Signed numeric value
 24649                                  _$P_Simple_S	   equ	2000h		;AN000; Simple string
 24650                                  _$P_Date_S	   equ	1000h		;AN000; Date string
 24651                                  _$P_Time_S	   equ	0800h		;AN000; Time string
 24652                                  _$P_Cmpx_S	   equ	0400h		;AN000; Complex string
 24653                                  _$P_File_Spc	   equ	0200h		;AN000; File Spec
 24654                                  _$P_Drv_Only	   equ	0100h		;AN000; Drive Only
 24655                                  _$P_Qu_String	   equ	0080h		;AN000; Quoted string
 24656                                  _$P_Ig_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Ignore colon at end in match
 24657                                  _$P_Repeat	   equ	0002h		;AN000; Repeat allowed
 24658                                  _$P_Optional	   equ	0001h		;AN000; Optional
 24659                                  
 24660                                  ;**** Function flags
 24661                                  
 24662                                  _$P_CAP_File	   equ	0001h		;AN000; CAP result by file table
 24663                                  _$P_CAP_Char	   equ	0002h		;AN000; CAP result by character table
 24664                                  _$P_Rm_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Remove ":" at the end
 24665                                  _$P_colon_is_not_necessary equ 0020h	;AN000;(tm10) /+10 and /+:10
 24666                                  
 24667                                  ;-------------------------------- Control block structure
 24668                                  struc _$P_Control_Blk
 24669 00000000 ????                     .Match_Flag:	 resw 1		;AN000; Controls type matched
 24670 00000002 ????                     .Function_Flag: resw 1		;AN000; Function should be taken
 24671 00000004 ????                     .Result_Buf:	 resw 1		; Result buffer address
 24672 00000006 ????                     .Value_List:	 resw 1		;AN000; Value list address
 24673 00000008 ??                       .nid:		 resb 1		;AN000; # of keyword/SW synonyms
 24674 00000009 ??                       .KEYorSW:	 resb 1		;AN000; keyword or sw
 24675                                  endstruc
 24676                                  
 24677                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24678                                  ; << Value List Definition >>
 24679                                  ;
 24680                                  ;VALUES 	LABEL	BYTE
 24681                                  ;		DB	nval			; NUMBER OF VALUE DEFINITIONS (0 - 3)
 24682                                  ;	     +-
 24683                                  ;	     |	DB	nrng			; NUMBER OF RANGES
 24684                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF RANGE MATCHED
 24685                                  ;	     | +DD	X,Y			; RANGE OF VALUES
 24686                                  ;	     |	:
 24687                                  ;	     |	DB	nnval			; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 24688                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF NUMBER CHOICE MATCHED
 24689                                  ;	     | +DD	VALUE			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF NUMBER
 24690                                  ;	     |	:
 24691                                  ;	     |	DB	nstrval 		; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 24692                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF STRING CHOICE MATCHED
 24693                                  ;	     | +DW	STRING			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF STING
 24694                                  ;	     +-	:
 24695                                  ;
 24696                                  ;STRING 	DB	"...",0                 ; ASCIIZ STRING IMAGE
 24697                                  ;
 24698                                  ;Note:
 24699                                  ;    - ITEM_TAG must not be 0FFH, which will be used in the result buffer
 24700                                  ;      when no choice lists are provided.
 24701                                  ;
 24702                                  ;    - STRING must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 24703                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 24704                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 24705                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24706                                  
 24707                                  _$P_nval_None	   equ	0		;AN000; no value list ID
 24708                                  _$P_nval_Range	   equ	1		;AN000; range list ID
 24709                                  _$P_nval_Value	   equ	2		;AN000; value list ID
 24710                                  _$P_nval_String	   equ	3		;AN000; string list ID
 24711                                  _$P_Len_Range	   equ	9		;AN000; Length of a range choice(two DD plus one DB)
 24712                                  _$P_Len_Value	   equ	5		;AN000; Length of a value choice(one DD plus one DB)
 24713                                  _$P_Len_String	   equ	3		;AN000; Length of a string choice(one DW plus one DB)
 24714                                  _$P_No_nrng	   equ	0		;AN000; (tm07) no nrng. nnval must not be 0.
 24715                                  
 24716                                  struc _$P_Val_List
 24717 00000000 ??                       .NumofList: resb 1			;AN000; number of following choice
 24718 00000001 ????                     .Val_XL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of value
 24719 00000003 ????                     .Val_XH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of value
 24720 00000005 ????                     .Val_YL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of another value
 24721 00000007 ????                     .Val_YH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of another value
 24722                                  endstruc
 24723                                  
 24724                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24725                                  ; << Result Buffer Definition  >>
 24726                                  ;
 24727                                  ;RESULT 	LABEL	BYTE			; BELOW FILLED IN FOR DEFAULTS
 24728                                  ;		DB	type			; TYPE RETURNED: 0=RESERVED,
 24729                                  ;						;	1=NUMBER, 2=LIST INDEX,
 24730                                  ;						;	3=STRING, 4=COMPLEX,
 24731                                  ;						;	5=FILESPEC, 6=DRIVE
 24732                                  ;						;	7=DATE, 8=TIME
 24733                                  ;						;	9=QUOTED STRING
 24734                                  ;		DB	ITEM_TAG		; MATCHED ITEM TAG
 24735                                  ;
 24736                                  ;		dw	synonym@		; es:@ points to found SYNONYM if provided.
 24737                                  ;
 24738                                  ;            +-
 24739                                  ;	    | DD	n			; VALUE IF NUMBER
 24740                                  ;	    | or
 24741                                  ;	    |	DW	i			; INDEX (OFFSET) INTO VALUE LIST
 24742                                  ;	    |					; (ES presents Segment address)
 24743                                  ;	    | or
 24744                                  ;	    |	DD	STRING			; OFFSET OF STRING VALUE
 24745                                  ;	    | or
 24746                                  ;	    |	DB	drv			; DRIVE NUMBER (1-A, 2-B,..., 26-Z)
 24747                                  ;	    | or
 24748                                  ;	    |	DW	YEAR	   ;(1980-2099)  IN CASE OF DATE
 24749                                  ;	    |	DB	MONTH	   ;(1-12)	 Note: Range check is not performed.
 24750                                  ;	    |	DB	DATE	   ;(1-31)	       0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified.
 24751                                  ;	    | or
 24752                                  ;	    |	DB	HOUR	   ;(0-23)	  IN CASE OF TIME
 24753                                  ;	    |	DB	MINUTES    ;(0-59)	  Note: Range check is not performed .
 24754                                  ;	    |	DB	SECONDS    ;(0-59)		0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified .
 24755                                  ;	    |	DB	HUNDREDTHS ;(0-99)
 24756                                  ;	    +-
 24757                                  ;
 24758                                  ;
 24759                                  ;Note: ITEM_TAG is 0FFH when the caller does not specify the choice
 24760                                  ;      list.
 24761                                  ;
 24762                                  ;      YEAR: If the input value for the year is less than 100, parser
 24763                                  ;	     adds 1900 to it.  For example, when 87 is input to parser for
 24764                                  ;	     the year value, he returns 1987.
 24765                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24766                                  
 24767                                  ;-------------------------------- Result block structure
 24768                                  struc _$P_Result_Blk
 24769 00000000 ??                       .Type:        resb 1		;AN000; Type returned
 24770 00000001 ??                       .Item_Tag:    resb 1		;AN000; Matched item tag
 24771 00000002 ????                     .SYNONYM_Ptr: resw 1		;AN000; pointer to Synonym list returned
 24772 00000004 ????????                 .Picked_Val:  resb 4		;AN000; value
 24773                                  endstruc
 24774

 24780                                  _$P_List_Idx	   equ	2		;AN000; List Index
 24781                                  _$P_String	   equ	3		;AN000; String
 24782                                  _$P_Complex	   equ	4		;AN000; Complex
 24783                                  _$P_File_Spec	   equ	5		;AN000; File Spec
 24784                                  _$P_Drive	   equ	6		;AN000; Drive
 24785                                  _$P_Date_F	   equ	7		;AN000; Date
 24786                                  _$P_Time_F	   equ	8		;AN000; Time
 24787                                  _$P_Quoted_String  equ	9		;AN000; Quoted String

 24796                                  _$P_Too_Many	   equ	1		;AN000; Too many operands
 24797                                  _$P_Op_Missing	   equ	2		;AN000; Required operand missing
 24798                                  _$P_Not_In_SW	   equ	3		;AN000; Not in switch list provided
 24799                                  _$P_Not_In_Key	   equ	4		;AN000; Not in keyword list provided
 24800                                  _$P_Out_Of_Range   equ	6		;AN000; Out of range specified
 24801                                  _$P_Not_In_Val	   equ	7		;AN000; Not in value list provided
 24802                                  _$P_Not_In_Str	   equ	8		;AN000; Not in string list provided
 24803                                  _$P_Syntax	   equ	9		;AN000; Syntax error
 24804                                  _$P_RC_EOL	   equ	-1		;AN000; End of command line

 24890                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24891                                  ; SysParse;
 24892                                  ;
 24893                                  ;  Function : Parser Entry
 24894                                  ;
 24895                                  ;  Input: DS:SI -> command line
 24896                                  ;	  ES:DI -> parameter block
 24897                                  ;	  cs -> psdata.inc
 24898                                  ;	  CX = operand ordinal
 24899                                  ;
 24900                                  ;	  Note:  ES is the segment containing all the control blocks defined
 24901                                  ;		 by the caller, except for the DOS COMMAND line parms, which
 24902                                  ;		 is in DS.
 24903                                  ;
 24904                                  ;  Output: CY = 1   error of caller, means invalid parameter block or
 24905                                  ;		    invalid value list. But this parser does NOT implement
 24906                                  ;		    this feature. Therefore CY always zero.
 24907                                  ;
 24908                                  ;	   CY = 0   AX = return code
 24909                                  ;		    BL = terminated delimiter code
 24910                                  ;		    CX = new operand ordinal
 24911                                  ;		    SI = set past scaned operand
 24912                                  ;		    DX = selected result buffer
 24913                                  ;
 24914                                  ; Use:	_$P_Skip_Delim, _$P_Chk_EOL, _$P_Chk_Delim, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 24915                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Swtch, _$P_Chk_Pos_Control, _$P_Chk_Key_Control
 24916                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Sw_Control, _$P_Fill_Result
 24917                                  ;
 24918                                  ; Vars: _$P_Ordinal(RW), _$P_RC(RW), _$P_SI_Save(RW), _$P_DX(R), _$P_Terminator(R)
 24919                                  ;	_$P_SaveSI_Cmpx(W), _$P_Flags(RW), _$P_Found_SYNONYM(R), _$P_Save_EOB(W)
 24920                                  ;
 24921                                  ;-------- Modification History -----------------------------------------
 24922                                  ;
 24923                                  ;  4/04/87 : Created by K. K,
 24924                                  ;  4/28/87 : _$P_Val_YH assemble error (tm01)
 24925                                  ;	   : JMP SHORT assemble error (tm02)
 24926                                  ;  5/14/87 : Someone doesn't want to include psdata (tm03)
 24927                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_Bridge is missing when TimeSw equ 0 and (CmpxSw equ 1 or
 24928                                  ;	     DateSW equ 1)	      (tm04)
 24929                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_SorD_Quote is missing when QusSw equ 0 and CmpxSW equ 1
 24930                                  ;				      (tm05) in PSDATA.INC
 24931                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_FileSp_Char and _$P_FileSP_Len are missing
 24932                                  ;	     when FileSW equ 0 and DrvSW equ 1 (tm06) in PSDATA.INC
 24933                                  ;  6/18/87 : $VAL1 and $VAL3, $VAL2 and $VAL3 can be used in the same
 24934                                  ;	     value-list block	      (tm07)
 24935                                  ;  6/20/87 : Add _$P_SW to check if there's an omiting parameter after
 24936                                  ;	     switch (keyword) or not. If there is, backup si for next call
 24937                                  ;	     (tm08)
 24938                                  ;  6/24/87 : Complex Item checking does not work correctly when CmpSW equ 1
 24939                                  ;	     and DateSW equ 0 and TimeSW equ 0 (tm09)
 24940                                  ;  6/24/87 : New function flag _$P_colon_is_not_necessary for switch
 24941                                  ;	     /+15 and /+:15 are allowed for user (tm10)
 24942                                  ;  6/29/87 : ECS call changes DS register but it causes the address problem
 24943                                  ;	     in user's routines. _$P_Chk_DBCS (tm11)
 24944                                  ;  7/10/87 : Switch with no_match flag (0x0000H) does not work correctly
 24945                                  ;					  (tm12)
 24946                                  ;  7/10/87 : Invalid switch/keyword does not work correctly
 24947                                  ;					  (tm13)
 24948                                  ;  7/10/87 : Drive_only breaks 3 bytes after the result buffer
 24949                                  ;					  (tm14)
 24950                                  ;  7/12/87 : Too_Many_Operands sets DX=0 as the PARSE result
 24951                                  ;					  (tm15)
 24952                                  ;  7/24/87 : Negative lower bound on numeric ranges cause trouble
 24953                                  
 24954                                  ;  7/24/87 : Quoted strings being returned with quotes.
 24955                                  
 24956                                  ;  7/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN018;)
 24957                                  ;	     Non optional value on switch (match flags<>0 and <>1) not flagged
 24958                                  ;	     as an error when missing.	Solution: return error 2.  Modules
 24959                                  ;	     affected: _$P_Chk_SW_Control.
 24960                                  
 24961                                  ;  7/29/87 : Kerry S (;AN019;)
 24962                                  ;	     Now allow the optional bit in match flags for switches.  This
 24963                                  ;	     allows the switch to be encountered with a value or without a
 24964                                  ;	     value and no error is returned.
 24965                                  ;
 24966                                  
 24967                                  ;  8/28/87 : Ed K, Kerry S (;AN020;)
 24968                                  ;  9/14/87   In PROC _$P_Get_DecNum, when checking for field separators
 24969                                  ;	     within a date response, instead of checking just for the one
 24970                                  ;	     character defined by the COUNTRY DEPENDENT INFO, check for
 24971                                  ;	     all three chars, "-", "/", and ".". Change _$P_Chk_Switch to allow
 24972                                  ;	     slashes in date strings when DateSw (assembler switch) is set.
 24973                                  
 24974                                  ;  9/1/87  : Kerry S (;AN021)
 24975                                  ;	     In PROC _$P_String_Comp, when comparing the switch or keyword on
 24976                                  ;	     the command line with the string in the control block the
 24977                                  ;	     comparing was stopping at a colon (switch) or equal (keyword)
 24978                                  ;	     on the command line and assuming a match.	This allowed a shorter
 24979                                  ;	     string on the command line than in the synonym list in the control
 24980                                  ;	     block.  I put in a test for a null in the control block so the
 24981                                  ;	     string in the control block must be the same length as the string
 24982                                  ;	     preceeding the colon or equal on the command line.
 24983                                  
 24984                                  ;  8/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN022;)
 24985                                  ;	     All references to data in PSDATA.INC had CS overrides.  This caused
 24986                                  ;	     problems for people who included it themselves in a segment other
 24987                                  ;	     than CS.  Added switch to allow including PSDATA.INC in any
 24988                                  ;	     segment.
 24989                                  
 24990                                  ;  9/16/87 : Ed K (;AN023;) PTM1040
 24991                                  ;	     in _$P_set_cdi PROC, it assumes CS points to psdata. Change Push CS
 24992                                  ;	     into PUSH cs.  In _$P_Get_DecNum PROC, fix AN020
 24993                                  ;	     forced both TIME and DATE to use the delims, "-","/",".".
 24994                                  ;	     Created FLag, in _$P_time_Format PROC, to request the delim in
 24995                                  ;	     BL be used if TIME is being parsed.
 24996

 24998                                  ;	     Removed the include to STRUC.INC.	Replaced the STRUC macro
 24999                                  ;	     invocations with their normally expanded code; made comments

 25591                                  ; _$P_Fill_Result
 25592                                  ;
 25593                                  ; Function: Fill the result buffer
 25594                                  ;
 25595                                  ; Input:    AH = Item tag
 25596                                  ;	    AL = type
 25597                                  ;		  AL = 1: CX,DX has 32bit number (CX = high)
 25598                                  ;		  AL = 2: DX has index(offset) into value list
 25599                                  ;		  AL = 6: DL has driver # (1-A, 2-B, ... , 26 - Z)
 25600                                  ;		  AL = 7: DX has year, CL has month and CH has date
 25601                                  ;		  AL = 8: DL has hours, DH has minutes, CL has seconds,
 25602                                  ;			  amd CH has hundredths
 25603                                  ;		  AL = else: cs:SI points to returned string buffer
 25604                                  ;	    ES:BX -> CONTROL block

 26007                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26008                                  ; _$P_Value / _$P_SValue
 26009                                  ;
 26010                                  ; Function:  Make 32bit value from cs:SI and see value list
 26011                                  ;	     and make result buffer.
 26012                                  ;	     _$P_SValue is an entry point for the signed value
 26013                                  ;	     and this will simply call _$P_Value after the handling
 26014                                  ;	     of the sign character, "+" or "-"
 26015                                  ;
 26016                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 26017                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 26018                                  ;
 26019                                  ; Output:    None
 26020                                  ;
 26021                                  ; Use:	_$P_Fill_Result, _$P_Check_OVF
 26022                                  ;
 26023                                  ; Vars: _$P_RC(W), _$P_Flags(RW)
 26024                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26025                                  
 26026                                  	; 26/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
 26027                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1B0Bh)
 26028                                  
 26029                                  	; 07/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 26030                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1C46h)  	
 26031                                  _$P_SValue:				;AN000; when signed value here
 26032 0000190B 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 26033 0000190C 2E800E[B214]80          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Signed ;AC034; indicate a signed numeric
 26034 00001912 2E8026[B214]FD          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Neg ;AC034; assume positive value
 26035                                  	;and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],~_$P_Neg ; 07/07/2023 
 26036 00001918 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get sign
 26037 0000191B 3C2B                    	cmp	al,_$P_Plus		;AN000; "+" ?
 26038 0000191D 740A                    	je	short _$P_SVal00	;AN000;
 26039                                  
 26040 0000191F 3C2D                    	cmp	al,_$P_Minus		;AN000; "-" ?
 26041 00001921 7507                    	jne	short _$P_Sval01	;AN000; else
 26042                                  
 26043 00001923 2E800E[B214]02          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; set this is negative value
 26044                                  _$P_SVal00:				;AN000;
 26045 00001929 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; skip sign char
 26046                                  _$P_Sval01:				;AN000;
 26047 0000192A E80200                  	call	_$P_Value		;AN000; and process value
 26048 0000192D 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 26049 0000192E C3                      	retn

 26980                                  	; 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)

 26982                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:2451h) ; (Retro DOS v5.0)
 26983                                  
 26984                                  _$P_Chk_Delim:
 26985 00001C4D 53                      	push	bx			;AN000;
 26986 00001C4E 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 26987 00001C4F 2EC606[AC14]20          	mov	byte [cs:_$P_Terminator],_$P_Space 
 26988                                  					;AC034; Assume terminated by space
 26989                                  	;and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags20,0DFh
 26990 00001C55 2E8026[B214]DF          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Extra ;AC034;
 26991 00001C5B 3C20                    	cmp	al,_$P_Space ; 20h	;AN000; Space ?
 26992 00001C5D 7423                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 26993                                  
 26994 00001C5F 3C09                    	cmp	al,_$P_TAB		;AN000; TAB ?
 26995 00001C61 741F                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 26996                                  
 26997 00001C63 3C2C                    	cmp	al,_$P_Comma		;AN000; Comma ?
 26998 00001C65 741E                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 26999                                  
 27000                                  ; Note: _$P_Chk_Delim00 part of code is nonsense here
 27001                                  ;        because _$P_Space = _$P_DBSP1 = 20h
 27002                                  ;        Erdogan Tan - 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 27003                                  ;_$P_Chk_Delim00:
 27004                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:246Bh)
 27005                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1FC8h)
 27006                                  %if 0
 27007                                  	; 26/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27008                                  _$P_Chk_Delim00: 			;AN000;
 27009                                  	cmp	al,_$P_DBSP1	; 20h	;AN000; 1st byte of DBCS Space ?
 27010                                  	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 27011                                  
 27012                                  	cmp	byte [si],_$P_DBSP2 ; 20h ;AN000; 2nd byte of DBCS Space ?
 27013                                  	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 27014                                  
 27015                                  	mov	al,_$P_Space		;AN000;
 27016                                  	inc	si			;AN000; make si point to next character
 27017                                  	cmp	al,al			;AN000; Set ZF
 27018                                  	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 27019                                  %endif
 27020                                  
 27021                                  _$P_Chk_Delim01: 			;AN000;
 27022 00001C67 26807DFE01              	cmp	byte [es:di-_$P_PARMS_Blk.Num_Extra],_$P_I_Have_Delim 
 27023                                  					;AN000; delimiter character specified ?
 27024 00001C6C 7214                    	jb	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 27025                                  
 27026                                  	;xor	cx,cx			;AN000;
 27027 00001C6E 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch
 27028                                  	;mov	cl,[es:di+3]
 27029 00001C70 268A4D03                	mov	cl,[es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Len_Extra_Delim] 
 27030                                  					;AN000; get length of delimiter list
 27031                                  	;or	cx,cx			;AN000; No extra Delim character ?
 27032                                  	;jz	short _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ 	;AN000;
 27033                                  	; 08/07/2023
 27034 00001C74 E30B                    	jcxz	_$P_Chk_Delim_NZ
 27035                                  
 27036 00001C76 BB0300                  	mov	bx,_$P_Len_PARMS-1 ; 3	;AN000; set bx to 1st extra delimiter
 27037                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Loop:			;AN000;
 27038 00001C79 43                      	inc	bx			;AN000;
 27039 00001C7A 263A01                  	cmp	al,[es:bx+di]		;AN000; Check extra Delim character
 27040 00001C7D 7406                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 27041                                  
 27042 00001C7F E2F8                    	loop	_$P_Chk_Delim_Loop	;AN000; examine all extra delimiter
 27043                                  
 27044                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ:			;AN000;
 27045                                  	;cmp	al,_$P_Space		;AN000; reset ZF
 27046                                  	; 08/07/2023
 27047                                  	; cx=0 here
 27048 00001C81 41                      	inc	cx ; cx=1, zf=0
 27049                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit:			;AN000;
 27050                                  _$P_ChkDfin:				;AN000;

 27052 00001C83 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000;
 27053 00001C84 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 27054                                  
 27055                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0:			;AN000;
 27056 00001C85 2EA2[AC14]              	mov	[cs:_$P_Terminator],al ;AC034; keep terminated delimiter
 27057 00001C89 2EF606[B214]01          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_equ ;AN027;AC034;; if terminating a key=
 27058 00001C8F 7506                    	jnz	short _$P_No_Set_Extra 	;AN027; then do not set the EXTRA bit
 27059                                  
 27060 00001C91 2E800E[B214]20          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Extra 
 27061                                  					;AC034; flag terminated extra delimiter or comma
 27062                                  _$P_No_Set_Extra:			;AN027;
 27063 00001C97 38C0                    	cmp	al,al			;AN000; set ZF
 27064 00001C99 EBE7                    	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;

 27066                                  ;***********************************************************************
 27067                                  ; _$P_Chk_Switch;
 27068                                  ;
 27069                                  ; Function: Check if AL is the switch character not in first position of
 27070                                  ;	    _$P_STRING_BUF
 27071                                  ;
 27072                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 27073                                  ;	    BX = current pointer within _$P_String_Buf
 27074                                  ;	    SI =>next char on command line (following the one in AL)
 27075                                  ;
 27076                                  ; Output:   CF = 1 (set)if AL is switch character, and not in first
 27077                                  ;		 position, and has no chance of being part of a date string,
 27078                                  ;		 i.e. should be treated as a delimiter.
 27079                                  
 27080                                  ;	    CF = 0 (reset, cleared) if AL is not a switch char, is in the first
 27081                                  ;		 position, or is a slash but may be part of a date string, i.e.
 27082                                  ;		 should not be treated as a delimiter.
 27083                                  ;
 27084                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W)
 27085                                  
 27086                                  ; Use:	 _$P_0099
 27087                                  ;***********************************************************************
 27088                                  
 27089                                  _$P_Chk_Switch:
 27090                                  	;;lea	bp,[cs:_$P_STRING_BUF]	;AN020;AC034
 27091                                  	;lea	bp,[_$P_STRING_BUF]	;BP=OFFSET of _$P_String_Buf even in group addressing
 27092                                  	; 08/07/2023
 27093 00001C9B BD[BB14]                	mov	bp,_$P_STRING_BUF
 27094                                  
 27095                                  ;	.IF <BX NE BP> THEN		;AN020;IF not first char THEN
 27096 00001C9E 39EB                    	cmp	bx,bp			;AN000;
 27097 00001CA0 7406                    	je	short _$P_STRUC_L2	;AN000;
 27098                                  
 27099                                  ;	.IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;otherwise see if a slash
 27100 00001CA2 3C2F                    	cmp	al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 27101 00001CA4 750C                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L5 	;AN000;
 27102                                  
 27103 00001CA6 F9                      	stc				;AN020;not in first position and is slash
 27104                                  	;jmp     short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 27105                                  	; 12/12/2022
 27106 00001CA7 C3                      	retn
 27107                                  
 27108                                  ; 12/12/2022
 27109                                  ;_$P_STRUC_L5:				;AN000;
 27110                                  ;	CLC				;AN020;not a slash
 27111                                  ;;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 27112                                  ;;	.ELSE				;AN020;is first char in the buffer, ZF=0
 27113                                  ;	jmp	short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 27114                                  
 27115                                  _$P_STRUC_L2:				;AN000;
 27116                                  ;	.IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;
 27117 00001CA8 3C2F                    	cmp     al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 27118 00001CAA 7506                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L12	;AN000;
 27119                                  
 27120 00001CAC 2E800E[B214]40          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW ;AN020 ;AC034;;could be valid switch, first char and is slash
 27121                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 27122                                  
 27123                                  	; 12/12/2022
 27124                                  	; cf=0
 27125                                  	;retn
 27126                                  
 27127                                  _$P_STRUC_L5:
 27128                                  	; 12/12/2022
 27129                                  _$P_STRUC_L12:				;AN000;
 27130 00001CB2 F8                      	clc				;AN020;CF=0 indicating first char
 27131                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 27132                                  _$P_STRUC_L1:				;AN000;
 27133 00001CB3 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 27135                                  ;**************************************************************************
 27136                                  ; _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 27137                                  ;
 27138                                  ;  Function: Check if a specified byte is in ranges of the DBCS lead bytes
 27139                                  ;
 27140                                  ;  Input:
 27141                                  ;	  AL	= Code to be examineed
 27142                                  ;
 27143                                  ;  Output:
 27144                                  ;	  If CF is on then a lead byte of DBCS
 27145                                  ;
 27146                                  ; Use: INT 21h w/AH=63
 27147                                  ;
 27148                                  ; Vars:  _$P_DBCSEV_Seg(RW), _$P_DBCSEV_Off(RW)
 27149                                  ;***************************************************************************
 27150                                  
 27151                                  _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 27152 00001CB4 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000;
 27153 00001CB5 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 27154 00001CB6 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 27155                                  	;cmp	word [cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],0 ;AC034; ALREADY SET ?
 27156                                  	;jne	short _$P_DBCS00	;AN000;
 27157                                  	; 08/07/2023
 27158 00001CB7 2E8B36[AF14]            	mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]
 27159 00001CBC 21F6                    	and	si,si ; 0 ?
 27160 00001CBE 7525                    	jnz	short _$P_DBCS00 ; already set
 27161 00001CC0 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 27162 00001CC1 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 27163 00001CC2 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 27164 00001CC3 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 27165 00001CC4 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 27166 00001CC5 55                      	push	bp			;AN000;
 27167 00001CC6 06                      	push	es			;AN000;
 27168                                  	; si = 0 ; 08/07/2023
 27169                                  	;xor	si,si			;AN000;
 27170 00001CC7 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si ; 0		;AN000;
 27171 00001CC9 B80063                  	mov	ax,_$P_DOS_GetEV ; 6300h ;AN000; GET DBCS EV CALL
 27172 00001CCC CD21                    	int	21h			;AN000;
 27173                                  		; DOS - 3.2+ only - GET DOUBLE BYTE CHARACTER SET LEAD TABLE
 27174 00001CCE 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 27175 00001CD0 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 27176 00001CD2 07                      	pop	es			;AN000;
 27177 00001CD3 5D                      	pop	bp			;AN000;
 27178 00001CD4 5F                      	pop	di			;AN000;
 27179 00001CD5 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 27180 00001CD6 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 27181 00001CD7 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 27182 00001CD8 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 27183 00001CD9 7424                    	jz	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000;
 27184                                  _$P_DBCS02:				;AN000;
 27185 00001CDB 2E8936[AD14]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF],si	;AC034; save EV offset
 27186 00001CE0 2E891E[AF14]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],bx	;AC034; save EV segment (tm11)
 27187                                  _$P_DBCS00:				;AN000;
 27188                                  	;mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]	;AC034; load EV offset
 27189                                  	;mov	ds,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]	;AC034; and segment
 27190                                  	; 08/07/2023
 27191 00001CE5 2EC536[AD14]            	lds	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]
 27192                                  _$P_DBCS_LOOP:				;AN000;
 27193 00001CEA 833C00                  	cmp	word [si],0		;AN000; zero vector ?
 27194 00001CED 7410                    	je	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000; then exit
 27195 00001CEF 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si] 		;AN000;
 27196 00001CF1 7208                    	jb	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000; Check if AL is in
 27197 00001CF3 3A4401                  	cmp	al,[si+1]		;AN000;   range of
 27198 00001CF6 7703                    	ja	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000;      the vector
 27199 00001CF8 F9                      	stc				;AN000; if yes, indicate DBCS and exit
 27200 00001CF9 EB04                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_EXIT	;AN000;
 27201                                  _$P_DBCS01:				;AN000;
 27202 00001CFB 46                      	inc	si			;AC035; add '2' to
 27203 00001CFC 46                      	inc	si			;AC035;  SI reg
 27204                                  					;AN000; get next vector
 27205 00001CFD EBEB                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_LOOP	;AN000; loop until zero vector found
 27206                                  _$P_NON_DBCS:				;AN000;
 27207                                  	; 12/12/2022
 27208                                  	; cf=0
 27209                                  	;clc				;AN000; indicate SBCS
 27210                                  _$P_DBCS_EXIT:				;AN000;
 27211 00001CFF 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 27212 00001D00 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 27213 00001D01 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000;
 27214 00001D02 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 27776                                  
 27777                                  ;include	highvar.inc	; devicehigh variables (used by loadhigh also)
 27778                                  
 27779                                  ; 30/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 27780                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27781                                  
 27782                                  ;   Module:   HIGHVAR.INC - Data common to LOADHIGH and DEVICEHIGH, res seg
 27783                                  ;
 27784                                  ;   Date:     May 14, 1992
 27785                                  ;
 27786                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27787                                  ;
 27788                                  ;   Modification log:
 27789                                  ;
 27790                                  ;     DATE    WHO      DESCRIPTION
 27791                                  ;   --------  -------  --------------------------------------------------------
 27792                                  ;   05/14/92  t-richj  Original
 27793                                  ;   06/21/92  t-richj  Final revisions before check-in
 27794                                  ;
 27795                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27796                                  ;
 27797                                  ; There are two primary definitions which need to be made, selectively, before
 27798                                  ; this include file should be used.  These are:
 27799                                  ;    HV_Extern - If this has been defined, variables for this module will be
 27800                                  ;                declared as external.  Otherwise, variables will be declared
 27801                                  ;                public, as well as defined, here.  LoadHigh declares HV_Extern
 27802                                  ;                in stub.asm and loadhi.asm, and does not declare it in
 27803                                  ;                rdata.asm... DeviceHigh does not declare HV_Extern anywhere
 27804                                  ;                (as only one module, sysconf.asm, includes this file).
 27805                                  ;    HV_LoadHigh - This should be defined when this module is going into
 27806                                  ;                  command.com, for LoadHigh.  All of loadhi.asm, stub.asm and
 27807                                  ;                  rdata.asm define this, while io.sys' sysconf.asm does not.
 27808                                  ;
 27809                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27810                                  
 27811                                  ; To keep track of which UMBs were specified on the DH/LH command lines, and
 27812                                  ; to keep track of the minimum sizes given for each, there're two arrays kept
 27813                                  ; in { IO.SYS: sysinitseg / COMMAND.COM: DATARES }... each is MAXUMB elements
 27814                                  ; big.  16 should be around 14 too many for most users, so there's no expected
 27815                                  ; space problem (it's just such a nice round number, eh?).
 27816                                  
 27817                                  MAXUMB	equ	16
 27818                                  
 27819                                  ; Memory elements owned by the system are marked as PSP address 8 in both the
 27820                                  ; USA and Japan; Japanese systems also use 9 under more bizzarre conditions.
 27821                                  
 27822                                  FreePSPOwner	equ	0	; Free MCBs all have an owner PSP address of 0
 27823                                  SystemPSPOwner	equ	8
 27824                                  ;JapanPSPOwner	equ	9
 27825                                  
 27826                                  ; for LoadHigh and DeviceHigh:
 27827                                  ;
 27828                                  ;	fInHigh - Is set to 1 during HideUMBs(), and back to zero in
 27829                                  ;	          UnHideUMBs().
 27830                                  ;	fUmbTiny - Is set to 1 iff the user has specified /S on the command-
 27831                                  ;	           line.
 27832                                  ;	SegLoad - Segment address for first UMB specified; set automatically.
 27833                                  ;	UmbLoad - The load UMB number; for example, this is 3 if the user has
 27834                                  ;	          given a command-line like "/L:3,500;4"
 27835                                  ;	UmbUsed - An array of characters, each of which is 1 iff the UMB
 27836                                  ;	          matching its index number was specified on the command-line;
 27837                                  ;	          for example, after "/L:3,500;4;7", UmbUsed[3], [4] and [7]
 27838                                  ;	          will be set to 1.  All others will be set to 0.
 27839                                  ;	UmbSize - An array of words, each of which is interpereted as a size
 27840                                  ;	          specified by the user for a UMB (in the above example, all
 27841                                  ;	          elements would be zero save UmbSize[3], which would be 500.
 27842                                  ;	fm_umb - Set to the old UMB link-state (0x80 or 0x00)
 27843                                  ;	fm_strat - Set to the old memory-allocation strategy (0$00000???)
 27844                                  ;	fm_argc  - Number of arguments received by ParseVar() (see ParseVar()
 27845                                  ;	           for details).
 27846                                  
 27847 00001F02 00                      fInHigh:  db	0
 27848 00001F03 00                      fUmbTiny: db	0
 27849 00001F04 0000                    SegLoad:  dw	0
 27850 00001F06 00                      UmbLoad:  db	0
 27851 00001F07 00<rep 10h>             UmbUsed:  times MAXUMB db 0 ; times 16 db 0  ; db 16 dup(?)
 27852 00001F17 0000<rep 10h>           UmbSize:  times MAXUMB dw 0 ; times 16 dw 0  ; dw 16 dup(?)
 27853 00001F37 00                      fm_umb:   db	0
 27854 00001F38 00                      fm_strat: db	0
 27855 00001F39 00                      fm_argc:  db	0	
 27856                                  
 27857                                  ; UmbLoad is set to UNSPECIFED, below, until /L:umb is read; at which point
 27858                                  ; UmbLoad is set to the UMB number given.
 27859                                  
 27860                                  UNSPECIFIED	equ	-1
 27861                                  
 27862                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 27863                                  
 27864                                  ;****************************************************************** RICHID ****
 27865                                  
 27866                                  ; 30/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, SYSCONF.ASM)
 27867                                  ; ((MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS -> SYNINIT:22BAh))
 27868                                  
 27869                                  ; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 27870                                  ; (SYSINIT:212Bh)	
 27871                                  
 27872                                  		;public	DevEntry
 27873                                  
 27874 00001F3A 0000                    DevSize:	dw	0	; size of the device driver being loaded(paras)
 27875 00001F3C 0000                    DevLoadAddr:	dw	0	; Mem addr where the device driver is 2 b loaded

 27882                                  ;

 27988                                  ; 31/12/2022
 27989                                  ; 27/10/2022
 27990                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27991                                  ;
 27992                                  ;  The size of the CONFIG.SYS workspace (for recreating the in-memory
 27993                                  ;  CONFIG.SYS image, and later for building the initial environment) need
 27994                                  ;  not be any larger than CONFIG.SYS itself, EXCEPT for the fact that
 27995                                  ;  we (may) add a variable to the environment that does not explicity appear
 27996                                  ;  in CONFIG.SYS, and that variable is CONFIG (as in CONFIG=COMMON).
 27997                                  ;  The default setting for CONFIG cannot result in more than 1 paragraph
 27998                                  ;  of extra space, so here we account for it (the worst case of course is
 27999                                  ;  when CONFIG.SYS is some very small size, like 0 -JTP)
 28000                                  ;

 28002 00001FB6 8916[9714]              	mov	[config_wrkseg],dx      ;this is the segment to be used for
 28003 00001FBA 29C2                    	sub	dx,ax                   ;rebuilding the config.sys memory image
 28004                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG

 28025 00001FCD 8EC2                    	mov	es,dx
 28026                                  
 28027 00001FCF 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx

 28029                                  	;mov	cx,[cs:count]

 28035                                  
 28036                                  ; find the eof mark in the file. if present,then trim length.
 28037                                  
 28038 00001FD7 50                      	push	ax
 28039 00001FD8 57                      	push	di
 28040 00001FD9 51                      	push	cx
 28041 00001FDA B01A                    	mov	al,1Ah			; eof mark
 28042 00001FDC 89D7                    	mov	di,dx			; point to buffer
 28043 00001FDE E305                    	jcxz	puteol			; no chars
 28044 00001FE0 F2AE                    	repnz	scasb			; find end
 28045 00001FE2 7501                    	jnz	short puteol		; none found and count exhausted
 28046

 28048                                  
 28049 00001FE4 4F                      	dec	di			; backup past 1Ah
 28050                                  
 28051                                  ;  just for the halibut, stick in an extra eol
 28052                                  
 28053                                  puteol:
 28054 00001FE5 B00D                    	mov	al,cr ; 0Dh
 28055 00001FE7 AA                      	stosb
 28056 00001FE8 B00A                    	mov	al,lf  ;0Ah
 28057 00001FEA AA                      	stosb
 28058 00001FEB 29D7                    	sub	di,dx			; difference moved
 28059                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 28060                                  	;mov	[cs:count],di		; new count
 28061                                  
 28062                                  	; 11/12/2022	
 28063                                  	; 31/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 28064 00001FED 0E                      	push	cs
 28065 00001FEE 1F                      	pop	ds
 28066                                  
 28067 00001FEF 893E[5603]              	mov	[count],di		; new count
 28068                                  
 28069 00001FF3 59                      	pop	cx
 28070 00001FF4 5F                      	pop	di
 28071 00001FF5 58                      	pop	ax
 28072                                  
 28073                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28074                                  	; 27/10/2022
 28075                                  	;push	cs
 28076                                  	;pop	ds
 28077                                  
 28078 00001FF6 50                      	push	ax
 28079                                  	;mov	ah,CLOSE
 28080 00001FF7 B43E                    	mov	ah,3Eh
 28081 00001FF9 CD21                    	int	21h
 28082 00001FFB 58                      	pop	ax
 28083 00001FFC 9D                      	popf
 28084 00001FFD 7204                    	jc	short conferr 		;if not we've got a problem
 28085 00001FFF 39C1                    	cmp	cx,ax
 28086 00002001 742C                    	jz	short getcom		;couldn't read the file
 28087                                  conferr:
 28088 00002003 BA[2A45]                	mov	dx,config		;want to print config error
 28089 00002006 E87724                  	call	badfil
 28090                                  	; 17/09/2023
 28091                                  endconv:	; 01/01/2023
 28092 00002009 C3                      	retn
 28093                                  
 28094                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28095                                  ;
 28096                                  ; entry : multi_pass
 28097                                  ;
 28098                                  ;             called to execute device=,install= commands

 28101                                  
 28102                                  	; 27/10/2022
 28103                                  multi_pass:
 28104 0000200A 0E                      	push	cs
 28105 0000200B 1F                      	pop	ds
 28106                                  
 28107 0000200C 803E[CD02]0A            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],10
 28108                                  ;jae_endconv:
 28109 00002011 73F6                    	jae	short endconv 		; do nothing. just return.
 28110                                  
 28111                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 28112 00002013 FF36[A302]              	push	word [CONFBOT]
 28113                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 28114                                  	;push	word [top_of_cdss]
 28115 00002017 07                      	pop	es			; es -> confbot
 28116                                  
 28117 00002018 8B36[5803]              	mov	si,[org_count]
 28118 0000201C 8936[5603]              	mov	[count],si		; set count
 28119 00002020 31F6                    	xor	si,si ; 0
 28120 00002022 8936[5A03]                      mov     [chrptr],si		; reset chrptr
 28121 00002026 8936[AF02]                      mov     [linecount],si		; reset linecount
 28122                                  
 28123 0000202A E8DA21                  	call	getchr
 28124 0000202D EB06                    	jmp	short conflp
 28125                                  
 28126                                  	; 17/09/2023
 28127                                  	; 01/01/2023
 28128                                  ;endconv:
 28129                                  	;retn	
 28130                                  
 28131                                  getcom:
 28132                                  	; 03/01/2023
 28133                                  	; ds = cs
 28134 0000202F E81216                          call    organize                ; organize the file
 28135 00002032 E8D221                  	call	getchr
 28136                                  conflp: 
 28137 00002035 72D2                    	jc	short endconv
 28138                                  
 28139 00002037 FF06[AF02]                      inc     word [linecount]	; increase linecount
 28140                                  
 28141                                  	; 08/09/2023
 28142 0000203B 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah ; 0
 28143                                  	;mov	byte [multdeviceflag],0	; reset multdeviceflag.
 28144                                  	;mov	byte [setdevmarkflag],0	; reset setdevmarkflag.
 28145 0000203D 8826[9B14]              	mov	[multdeviceflag],ah ; 0
 28146 00002041 8826[9E14]              	mov	[setdevmarkflag],ah ; 0
 28147                                  
 28148 00002045 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf			; linefeed?
 28149 00002047 7448                    	je	short blank_line	;  then ignore this line.
 28150                                  
 28151                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 28152                                  ; (SYSINIT:23CCh)
 28153                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 28154                                  ;%if 0
 28155                                  
 28156                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 28157                                  
 28158                                  ;   If this is a genuine CONFIG.SYS command, then there should be a line
 28159                                  ;   number immediately following it....
 28160                                  
 28161 00002049 A2[9914]                        mov     [config_cmd],al         ; save original command code
 28162                                  	;and	al,NOT CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY
 28163 0000204C 247F                    	and	al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; and al,7Fh
 28164                                  
 28165                                  	; 08/09/2023
 28166 0000204E 3826[9A14]              	cmp	[config_multi],ah ; 0
 28167                                  	;cmp	byte [config_multi],0	; is this a multi-config config.sys?
 28168 00002052 7427                            je      short not_final		; no, line number is not embedded
 28169                                  
 28170 00002054 50                              push    ax                      ;
 28171 00002055 E8AF21                          call    getchr                  ; ignore end-of-image errors,
 28172 00002058 88C4                            mov     ah,al                   ; because if there's an error
 28173 0000205A E8AA21                          call    getchr                  ; fetching the line number that's
 28174 0000205D 86E0                            xchg    al,ah                   ; supposed to be there, the next
 28175 0000205F A3[AF02]                        mov     [linecount],ax          ; getchr call will get the same error
 28176 00002062 58                              pop     ax
 28177                                  ;
 28178                                  ;   HACK: when 4DOS.COM is the shell and it doesn't have an environment from
 28179                                  ;   which to obtain its original program name, it grovels through all of
 28180                                  ;   memory to find the filename that was used to exec it; it wants to find
 28181                                  ;   the SHELL= line in the in-memory copy of CONFIG.SYS, and it knows that
 28182                                  ;   sysinit converts the SHELL= keyword to an 'S', so it expects to find an 'S'
 28183                                  ;   immediately before the filename, but since we are now storing line # info
 28184                                  ;   in the config.sys memory image, 4DOS fails to find the 'S' in the right
 28185                                  ;   spot.
 28186                                  ;
 28187                                  ;   So, on the final pass of CONFIG.SYS, copy the command code (eg, 'S')
 28188                                  ;   over the line number info, since we no longer need that info anyway. This
 28189                                  ;   relies on the fact that getchr leaves ES:SI pointing to the last byte
 28190                                  ;   retrieved.
 28191                                  ;
 28192 00002063 803E[CD02]02                    cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; final pass?
 28193 00002068 7211                            jb	short not_final		; no
 28194                                          ;test	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 28195 0000206A F606[CE02]01            	test	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 28196 0000206F 7407                            jz	short final		; no install cmds, so yes it is
 28197 00002071 803E[CD02]03                    cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; final pass?
 28198 00002076 7203                            jb	short not_final		; no
 28199                                  final:                                  ;
 28200 00002078 268804                  	mov	[es:si],al		; save backward-compatible command code
 28201                                  not_final:                              ;
 28202                                  ;endif
 28203                                  
 28204                                  ; 31/12/2022
 28205                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 28206                                  
 28207 0000207B 88C4                    	mov	ah,al
 28208 0000207D E88721                  	call	getchr
 28209 00002080 7314                    	jnc	short tryi
 28210                                  
 28211 00002082 803E[CD02]02            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2
 28212                                  	;jae	short jae_endconv	; do not show badop again for multi_pass.
 28213                                  	; 27/10/2022
 28214 00002087 7380                    	jnb	short endconv	
 28215 00002089 E95408                  	jmp	badop
 28216                                  	
 28217                                  coff:	
 28218                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28219                                  	; ds = cs
 28220                                  	;push	cs
 28221                                  	;pop	ds
 28222 0000208C E86F21                  	call	newline
 28223 0000208F EBA4                    	jmp	short conflp	; 13/05/2019
 28224                                  
 28225                                  blank_line:
 28226 00002091 E87321                  	call	getchr
 28227 00002094 EB9F                    	jmp	short conflp
 28228                                  
 28229                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 28230                                  ; 11/12/2022
 28231                                  ; (there is not a jump or call to here from anywhere!)
 28232                                  ;coff_p:
 28233                                  	;push	cs
 28234                                  	;pop	ds
 28235                                  
 28236                                  ;to handle install= commands,we are going to use multi-pass.
 28237                                  ;the first pass handles the other commands and only set install_flag when
 28238                                  ;it finds any install command. the second pass will only handle the
 28239                                  ;install= command.
 28240                                  
 28241                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28242                                  ;install command
 28243                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28244                                  
 28245                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 28246                                  	; (SYSINIT:2250h)
 28247                                  tryi:
 28248 00002096 803E[CD02]00            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],0	; the initial pass for DOS=HI
 28249 0000209B 7503                    	jne	short not_init_pass
 28250 0000209D E97F01                  	jmp	multi_try_doshi
 28251                                  not_init_pass:
 28252 000020A0 803E[CD02]02            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; the second pass was for ifs=
 28253                                          ; 11/12/2022
 28254                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff2	; now it is NOPs
 28255 000020A5 74E5                    	je	short coff
 28256                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 28257                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff	
 28258                                  					; This pass can be made use of if
 28259                                  					; we want do some config.sys process
 28260                                  					; after device drivers are loaded
 28261                                  					; and before install= commands
 28262                                  					; are processed
 28263                                  
 28264 000020A7 803E[CD02]03            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; the third pass for install= ?
 28265 000020AC 741D                    	je	short multi_try_i
 28266 000020AE 80FC48                          cmp     ah, CONFIG_DOS  ; 'H'
 28267                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28268                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff2
 28269 000020B1 74D9                    	je	short coff
 28270                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 28271                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff	
 28272                                  
 28273                                  ;       make note of any INSTALL= or INSTALLHIGH= commands we find,
 28274                                  ;       but don't process them now.        
 28275                                          
 28276 000020B3 80FC49                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALL ; 'I'	; install= command?
 28277                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 28278 000020B6 7507                    	jne	short precheck_installhigh ; the first pass is for normal operation.
 28279                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 28280                                  	;jne	short tryb	
 28281                                  	
 28282                                  	;or	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; set the flag
 28283 000020B8 800E[CE02]01            	or	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 28284                                  multi_pass_coff2:
 28285 000020BD EBCD                    	jmp	short coff ; 13/05/2019	; and handles the next command
 28286                                  
 28287                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 28288                                  ; (SYSINIT:2448h)
 28289                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 28290                                  ;%if 0
 28291                                  precheck_installhigh:
 28292 000020BF 80FC57                  	cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALLHIGH ; 'W' ; signifier for INSTALLHIGH
 28293 000020C2 756B                    	jne     short tryb		; carry on with normal processing
 28294                                  	;or	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 28295 000020C4 800E[CE02]01            	or	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 28296 000020C9 EBC1                    	jmp	short coff
 28297                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 28298                                  
 28299                                  multi_try_i:
 28300 000020CB 80FC49                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALL ; 'I' ; install= command?
 28301                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 28302 000020CE 750A                    	jne	short multi_try_n	; no, check for installhigh
 28303                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 28304                                  	;jne	short multi_pass_filter
 28305                                  
 28306                                  ; 31/12/2022
 28307                                  ;%if 1 
 28308                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 28309                                  ;%if 0
 28310                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 28311 000020D0 E8A11F                  	call	query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 28312 000020D3 7241                    	jc	short multi_pass_filter	; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 28313                                  ;endif
 28314                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 28315                                  
 28316 000020D5 E8DBEF                  	call	do_install_exec 	;install it.
 28317 000020D8 EBB2                    	jmp	short coff		;to handle next install= command.
 28318                                  
 28319                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 28320                                  ; (SYSINIT:2463h)
 28321                                  ;%if 1
 28322                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 28323                                  ;%if 0
 28324                                  
 28325                                  multi_try_n:
 28326 000020DA 80FC57                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALLHIGH   ; installhigh= command?
 28327 000020DD 7537                            jne	short multi_pass_filter	; no. ignore this.
 28328                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 28329 000020DF E8921F                          call    query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd

 28391                                  ;******************************************************************************
 28392                                  ;									      *
 28393                                  ; function: parse the parameters of buffers= command.			      *
 28394                                  ;									      *
 28395                                  ; input :								      *
 28396                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 28397                                  ; output:								      *
 28398                                  ;	buffers set							      *
 28399                                  ;	buffer_slash_x	flag set if /x option chosen.			      *
 28400                                  ;	h_buffers set if secondary buffer cache specified.		      *
 28401                                  ;									      *
 28402                                  ; subroutines to be called:						      *
 28403                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *
 28404                                  ; logic:								      *
 28405                                  ; {									      *
 28406                                  ;	set di points to buf_parms;  /*parse control definition*/	      *
 28407                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						      *
 28408                                  ;	reset buffer_slash_x;						      *

 28410                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						      *
 28411                                  ;	  if (no error) then						      *
 28412                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_synonym_ptr == slash_e) then /*not a switch *
 28413                                  ;		    buffer_slash_x = 1					      *
 28414                                  ;	       else if	 (cx == 1) then 	    /* first positional */    *
 28415                                  ;			  buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val;		      *
 28416                                  ;		    else  h_buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val; 	      *
 28417                                  ;	  else	{show error message;error exit} 			      *
 28418                                  ;	};								      *
 28419                                  ;	if (buffer_slash_x is off & buffers > 99) then show_error;	      *
 28420                                  ; };									      *
 28421                                  ;									      *
