 28517                                  ;****************************************************************************
 28518                                  ;									    *
 28519                                  ; function: parse the parameters of break = command.			    *
 28520                                  ;									    *
 28521                                  ; input :								    *
 28522                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				    *
 28523                                  ; output:								    *
 28524                                  ;	turn the control-c check on or off.				    *
 28525                                  ;									    *
 28526                                  ; subroutines to be called:						    *
 28527                                  ;	sysinit_parse							    *

 28534                                  ;	  if (no error) then						    *
 28535                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_item_tag == 1) then	  /*on		 */ *

 28537                                  ;	       else					  /*off 	 */ *

 28540                                  ;	};								    *

 28543                                  ; };									    *

 29185                                  ;	Note: sysi_numio (in DOS DATA) currently reflects the REAL
 29186                                  ;	number of installed devices (including DblSpace drives) where
 29187                                  ;	"drivenumber" is the number that the next block device will
 29188                                  ;	be assigned to. Because some naughty device drivers (like
 29189                                  ;	interlnk) look at the internal DOS variable instead of the

 30125                                  
 30126                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30127                                  ; setting internal stack parameters
 30128                                  ; stacks=m,n where
 30129                                  ;	m is the number of stacks (range 8 to 64,default 9)
 30130                                  ;	n is the stack size (range 32 to 512 bytes,default 128)
 30131                                  ; j.k. 5/5/86: stacks=0,0 implies no stack installation.
 30132                                  ;	any combinations that are not within the specified limits will
 30133                                  ;	result in "unrecognized command" error.
 30134                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30135                                  
 30136                                  ;**************************************************************************
 30137                                  ;									  *
 30138                                  ; function: parse the parameters of stacks= command.			  *
 30139                                  ;	    the minimum value for "number of stacks" and "stack size" is  *
 30140                                  ;	    8 and 32 each.  in the definition of sysparse value list,they *
 30141                                  ;	    are set to 0.  this is for accepting the exceptional case of  *
 30142                                  ;	    stacks=0,0 case (,which means do not install the stack.)	  *
 30143                                  ;	    so,after sysparse is done,we have to check if the entered	  *
 30144                                  ;	    values (stack_count,stack_size) are within the actual range,  *
 30145                                  ;	    (or if "0,0" pair has been entered.)			  *
 30146                                  ; input :								  *
 30147                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				  *
 30148                                  ; output:								  *
 30149                                  ;	set the variables stack_count,stack_size.			  *
 30150                                  ;									  *
 30151                                  ; subroutines to be called:						  *
 30152                                  ;	sysinit_parse							  *
 30153                                  ; logic:								  *
 30154                                  ; {									  *
 30155                                  ;	set di points to stks_parms;					  *
 30156                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						  *
 30157                                  ;	while (end of command line)					  *
 30158                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						  *
 30159                                  ;	  if (no error) then						  *
 30160                                  ;	     { if (cx == 1) then /* first positional = stack count */	  *
 30161                                  ;		   p_stack_count = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 30162                                  ;	       if (cx == 2) then /* second positional = stack size */	  *
 30163                                  ;		   p_stack_size = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 30164                                  ;	     }								  *
 30165                                  ;	  else	/*error exit*/						  *
 30166                                  ;	     error exit;						  *
 30167                                  ;	};								  *
 30168                                  ;	here check p_stack_count,p_stack_size if it meets the condition;  *
 30169                                  ;	if o.k.,then set stack_count,stack_size;			  *
 30170                                  ;	 else error_exit;						  *
 30171                                  ; };									  *
 30172                                  ;**************************************************************************
 30173                                  
 30174                                  tryk:

 30920                                  sysinit_parse:
 30921                                  
 30922                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30923                                  ;set up registers for sysparse
 30924                                  ;in)	es:si -> command line in confbot
 30925                                  ;	di -> offset of the parse control definition.
 30926                                  ;
 30927                                  ;out)	calls sysparse.
 30928                                  ;	carry will set if parse error.
 30929                                  ;	*** the caller should check the eol condition by looking at ax
 30930                                  ;	*** after each call.
 30931                                  ;	*** if no parameters are found,then ax will contain a error code.
 30932                                  ;	*** if the caller needs to look at the synomym@ of the result,
 30933                                  ;	***  the caller should use cs:@ instead of es:@.
 30934                                  ;	cx register should be set to 0 at the first time the caller calls this
 30935                                  ;	 procedure.
 30936                                  ;	ax - exit code
 30937                                  ;	bl - terminated delimeter code
 30938                                  ;	cx - new positional ordinal
 30939                                  ;	si - set to pase scanned operand
 30940                                  ;	dx - selected result buffer
 30941                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30942

 31234                                  ;

 31284                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31285                                  ;
 31286                                  ; procedure : LieInt12Mem
 31287                                  ;
 31288                                  ;	Input : DevEntry points to Device Start address (offset == 0)
 31289                                  ;		alloclim set to the limit of low memory.
 31290                                  ;
 31291                                  ;	Output : none
 31292                                  ;
 31293                                  ;	Changes the ROM BIOS variable which stores the total low memory
 31294                                  ;	If a 3com device driver (any character device with name 'PROTMAN$')
 31295                                  ;	is being loaded alloclim is converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 31296                                  ;	Else if a device driver being loaded into UMB the DevLoadEnd is
 31297                                  ;	converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 31298                                  ;
 31299                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31300

 31302                                  	; 11/12/2022
 31303                                  	; ds = cs

 31306                                  					; assuming that it is 3Com
 31307 00002969 E84200                  	call	IsIt3Com		; Is it 3Com driver?
 31308 0000296C 740A                    	jz	short lim_set		; yes, lie to him differently
 31309                                  	; 13/05/2019
 31310                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:DeviceHi],0	; Is the DD being loaded in UMB
 31311                                  	;je	short limx		; no, don't lie
 31312                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:DevLoadEnd]	; lie INT 12 as end of UMB

 31316 00002973 74F0                    	je	short limx
 31317 00002975 A1[3E1F]                	mov	ax,[DevLoadEnd]
 31318                                  lim_set:
 31319                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 31320                                  	; 11/12/2022

 31328                                  ;
 31329                                  ; procedure : SetInt12Mem
 31330                                  ;
 31331                                  ;	Input : AX = Memory size to be set (in paras)
 31332                                  ;	Output : none
 31333                                  ;
 31334                                  ;	Sets the variable 40:13 to the memory size passed in AX
 31335                                  ;	It saves the old value in 40:13 in OldInt12Mem,
 31336                                  ;	It also sets a flag Int12Lied to 0ffh, which is checked before
 31337                                  ;	restoring the value of 40:13
 31338                                  ;
 31339                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31340                                  
 31341                                  	; 01/11/2022
 31342                                  SetInt12Mem:
 31343 00002978 1E                      	push	ds
 31344 00002979 BB4000                  	mov	bx,40h
 31345 0000297C 8EDB                    	mov	ds,bx			; ROM BIOS Data Segment
 31346 0000297E 8B1E1300                	mov	bx,[13h]		; INT 12 memory variable
 31347                                  	;mov	[cs:OldInt12Mem],bx	; save it
 31348 00002982 B106                    	mov	cl,6
 31349 00002984 D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl			; convert paras into Ks
 31350 00002986 A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; Lie
 31351                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0FFh ; mark that we are lying
 31352 00002989 1F                      	pop	ds
 31353                                  	; 14/04/2024
 31354                                  	; ds = cs
 31355 0000298A 891E[5C1F]              	mov	[OldInt12Mem],bx
 31356 0000298E C606[5B1F]FF            	mov	byte [Int12Lied],0FFh
 31357                                  ;limx:
 31358 00002993 C3                      	retn
 31359                                  
 31360                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31361                                  ;
 31362                                  ; procedure : TrueInt12Mem
 31363                                  ;

 31365                                  ;			  = 0ffh if we are lying
 31366                                  ;		OldInt12Mem = Saved value of 40:13h
 31367                                  ;

 31369                                  ;

 31371                                  ;	and resets the flag which indicates that we were lying
 31372                                  ;

 31383                                  	; 18/12/2022

 31385 0000299E 8826[5B1F]              	mov	[Int12Lied],ah ; 0
 31386                                  	;mov	byte [Int12Lied],0
 31387                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0

 31389                                  	;mov	ax,40h
 31390 000029A3 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 31391 000029A5 2EA1[5C1F]              	mov	ax,[cs:OldInt12Mem]

 31393 000029AC 1F                      	pop	ds
 31394                                  timx:

 31447                                  
 31448                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 31449                                  ; (SYSINIT:2EEEh)
 31450                                  
 31451                                  ;include highload.inc	; Routines for devicehigh parsing, control of HIDDEN
 31452                                  ;include highexit.inc	; umb's, etc
 31453                                  
 31454                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 31455                                  ; HIGHLOAD.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 31456                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 31457                                  ; 07/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31458                                  
 31459                                  ;******************************************************************************
 31460                                  ;
 31461                                  ; This file contains routines needed to parse and implement user-given
 31462                                  ; command-line options of the form "/S/L:3,0x500;2;7,127;0x0BE4". InitVar()
 31463                                  ; and Parsevar() are used to parse this data and place it in encoded form into
 31464                                  ; the variables in highvar.inc, for use by the rest of the routines.
 31465                                  ;
 31466                                  ; DeviceHigh accepts this command-line (handled in sysconf.asm, not here):
 31467                                  ;    DEVICEHIGH SIZE=hhhhhh module opts
 31468                                  ; Or, DeviceHigh and LoadHigh accept any of the following:
 31469                                  ;    DH/LH module opts
 31470                                  ;    DH/LH [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] module opts
 31471                                  ;    DH/LH [/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*][/S] module opts
 31472                                  ; The initial UMB,SIZE pair designates the module's load address; the remainder
 31473                                  ; of the UMB and SIZE pairs are used to indicate specific UMBs to be left
 31474                                  ; available during the load.
 31475                                  ;
 31476                                  ; When an actual load is ready to be performed, a call to HideUMBs() will
 31477                                  ; temporarily allocate (as owner 8+"HIDDEN  ") all free elements in any
 31478                                  ; upper-memory block which was not specified by the user... in addition, if
 31479                                  ; UMBs were marked to shrink (/S option) to a certain size ("umb,size"), any
 31480                                  ; elements in that umb SAVE the lower-half of the newly-shrunken one are also
 31481                                  ; allocated. After the load, the function UnHideUMBs() (in highexit.inc) will
 31482                                  ; free any UMBs so allocated.
 31483                                  ;
 31484                                  ; When a device driver loads, there is the additional problem of allocating its
 31485                                  ; initial load site; this should be restricted to the first UMB specified on
 31486                                  ; the command-line. The function FreezeUM temporarily allocates all remaining
 31487                                  ; free upper-memory elements (as owner 8+"FROZEN  "), except those in the load
 31488                                  ; UMB. Then the initial allocation may be made, and a call to UnFreeze will
 31489                                  ; return any so-allocated memory elements to FREE, for the true load. Note
 31490                                  ; that UnFreeze leaves HIDDEN elements allocated; it only frees FROZEN ones.
 31491                                  ;
 31492                                  ;******************************************************************************
 31493                                  
 31494                                  SWTCH	equ	'/'		; Switch character
 31495                                  
 31496                                  DOS_CHECK_STRATEGY  equ	5800h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 0 = check alloc strat
 31497                                  DOS_SET_STRATEGY    equ	5801h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 1 = set alloc strategy
 31498                                  DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK   equ	5802h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 2 = check link state
 31499                                  DOS_GET_UMBLINK	    equ 5802h ; 20/04/2019
 31500                                  DOS_SET_UMBLINK     equ	5803h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 3 = set link state
 31501                                  DOS_GET_DOS_LISTS   equ	  52h	; Int 21h, Func 52h = return list of lists
 31502                                  DOS_UMB_HEAD        equ	  8Ch	; Offset from ES (after func52h) to get UMBHead
 31503                                  
 31504                                  CR	equ	0Dh		; Carriage Return
 31505                                  LF	equ	0Ah		; Line Feed
 31506                                  TAB	equ	09h		; Tab character (^I)
 31507                                  
 31508                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31509                                  ;*** InitVar - initializes all the variables used in ParseVar and HideUMBs
 31510                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31511                                  ; ENTRY:       None
 31512                                  ; EXIT:        Variables listed in highvar.inc are initialized
 31513                                  ; ERROR EXIT:  None
 31514                                  ; USES:        Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 31515                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31516                                  ; Note that element 0 references UMB 0 (conventional), not UMB 1. Its contents
 31517                                  ; are largely ignored, but it is initialized nonetheless.
 31518                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31519                                  
 31520                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 31521                                  ; (SYSINIT:2EEEh)
 31522                                  
 31523                                  InitVar:
 31524                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31525                                  	; ds = cs
 31526                                  
 31527                                  	;pushreg <ax, cx, di, es>
 31528                                  	; 03/01/2023
 31529                                  	;push	ax
 31530                                  	;push	cx
 31531                                  	;push	di
 31532 000029D8 06                      	push	es
 31533                                  
 31534                                  	;dataseg es			;Point ES into appropriate data segment
 31535 000029D9 0E                      	push	cs
 31536 000029DA 07                      	pop	es
 31537                                  
 31538 000029DB 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 31539                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],al	;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 31540                                  	;mov	[es:fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 31541                                  	;mov	[es:SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 31542                                  	;mov	byte [es:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 31543                                  	;				;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 31544                                  	;mov	[es:fm_argc], al	;Start with zero args having been read
 31545                                  
 31546                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31547                                  	; ds = cs
 31548 000029DD A2[031F]                	mov	[fUmbTiny],al		;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 31549 000029E0 A2[021F]                	mov	[fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 31550 000029E3 A3[041F]                	mov	[SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 31551 000029E6 C606[061F]FF            	mov	byte [UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 31552                                  					;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 31553 000029EB A2[391F]                	mov	[fm_argc], al		;Start with zero args having been read
 31554                                  
 31555 000029EE FC                      	cld
 31556                                  
 31557 000029EF B91000                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;For each entry
 31558 000029F2 BF[071F]                	mov	di,UmbUsed		;on the UmbUsed array,
 31559 000029F5 F3AA                    	rep	stosb			;	Store 0
 31560                                  
 31561                                  	;mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;Okay... for each entry
 31562                                  	; 01/01/2033
 31563 000029F7 B110                    	mov	cl,MAXUMB ; 16
 31564 000029F9 BF[171F]                	mov	di,UmbSize		;on the UmbSize array,
 31565 000029FC F3AB                    	rep	stosw			;	Store 0
 31566                                  
 31567                                  	;normseg es			; Return ES
 31568                                  
 31569                                  	;popreg	<es, di, cx, ax>
 31570 000029FE 07                      	pop	es
 31571                                  	; 03/01/2023
 31572                                  	;pop	di
 31573                                  	;pop	cx
 31574                                  	;pop	ax	 	
 31575                                  
 31576 000029FF C3                      	retn
 31577                                  
 31578                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31579                                  ;*** FixMem - scans the upper memory chain and concatenates adjacent free MCBs
 31580                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31581                                  ; ENTRY   : None
 31582                                  ; EXIT    : None
 31583                                  ; ERROR   : None
 31584                                  ; USES    : Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 31585                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31586                                  
 31587                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 31588                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F22h)
 31589                                  FixMem:
 31590                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31591                                  	;push	ax
 31592                                  	;push	bx
 31593                                  	;push	cx
 31594                                  	;push	dx
 31595 00002A00 06                      	push	es
 31596                                  
 31597 00002A01 E84900                  	call	fm_link		; Link in UMBs
 31598                                  
 31599 00002A04 E80002                  	call	UmbHead		; Get first upper-memory MCB address (0x9FFF)
 31600 00002A07 723F                    	jc	short fmX	; (if couldn't get it, leave now).
 31601                                  
 31602 00002A09 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax		; It returns in AX, so move it to ES.
 31603                                  
 31604                                  ; - Walk MCB Chain ------------------------------------------------------------
 31605                                  
 31606 00002A0B 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx		; We're keeping the address of the last MCB
 31607 00002A0D 89D1                    	mov 	cx,dx		; in CX... and the last owner
 31608 00002A0F 42                      	inc	dx		; in dx as we go through the loop:
 31609                                  
 31610                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 31611                                  ; FM10--DX  = last MCB's owner's PSP address
 31612                                  ;       CX  = last MCB's address (segment)
 31613                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 31614                                  
 31615 00002A10 26A00000                fm10:	mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE] ; if 'Z', don't repeat loop
 31616 00002A14 268B1E0100              	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; if not zero, do nothing
 31617 00002A19 09D3                    	or	bx,dx			; dx was owner of previous MCB
 31618 00002A1B 7516                    	jnz	short fm30		; If not both zero, don't cat.
 31619                                  
 31620                                  	; - Coalesce memory blocks at ES:00 and CX:00 -------------------------
 31621                                  
 31622 00002A1D 268B1E0300              fm20:	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Grab this block's Size,
 31623 00002A22 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx			; Go back to prev MCB's address
 31624 00002A24 26A20000                	mov	[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],al ; & move the SECOND sig here
 31625                                  
 31626 00002A28 26031E0300              	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Size += first MCB's size
 31627                                  	;add	bx,1			; And add one for the header
 31628                                  	; 11/07/2023
 31629 00002A2D 43                      	inc	bx
 31630 00002A2E 26891E0300              	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],bx	; Write the size
 31631                                  
 31632                                  	; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 31633                                  
 31634 00002A33 8CC1                    fm30:	mov	cx,es			; Put this address on the stack
 31635 00002A35 268B160100              	mov	dx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; And remember its owner
 31636                                  
 31637 00002A3A 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es			; Move to the next MCB
 31638 00002A3C 26031E0300              	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 31639 00002A41 43                      	inc	bx
 31640 00002A42 8EC3                    	mov	es,bx
 31641                                  
 31642                                  	;cmp	al,'Z'
 31643 00002A44 3C5A                    	cmp	al,arena_signature_end
 31644 00002A46 75C8                    	jne	short fm10		; If signature != 'Z', there are more.
 31645                                  fmX:	
 31646 00002A48 E81300                  	call	fm_unlink		; Unlink UMBs
 31647                                  
 31648 00002A4B 07                      	pop	es
 31649                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31650                                  	;pop	dx
 31651                                  	;pop	cx
 31652                                  	;pop	bx
 31653                                  	;pop	ax
 31654                                  
 31655 00002A4C C3                      	retn
 31656                                  
 31657                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31658                                  ;*** fm_link - links UMBs not already linked in
 31659                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31660                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 31661                                  ; EXIT:     fm_umb == 0 if not linked in previously, 1 if already linked in
 31662                                  ; ERROR:    None
 31663                                  ; USES:     AX, BX, fm_umb
 31664                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31665                                  
 31666                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 31667                                  fm_link:
 31668 00002A4D B80258                  	mov	ax,DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK ; 5802h
 31669 00002A50 CD21                    	int	21h			; Current link-state is now in al
 31670                                  
 31671                                  	;putdata fm_umb,al		; So store it in fm_umb for later
 31672                                  	;
 31673                                  	;push	es
 31674                                  	;push	cs
 31675                                  	;pop	es
 31676                                  	;mov	[es:fm_umb],al
 31677                                  	;pop	es
 31678                                  	
 31679                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31680                                  	; ds = cs
 31681                                  	;mov	[cs:fm_umb],al
 31682 00002A52 A2[371F]                	mov	[fm_umb],al
 31683                                  
 31684 00002A55 B80358                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 31685 00002A58 BB0100                  	mov	bx,1
 31686 00002A5B CD21                    	int	21h
 31687 00002A5D C3                      	retn
 31688                                  
 31689                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31690                                  ;*** fm_unlink - unlinks UMBs if fm_umb is set to 0
 31691                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31692                                  ; ENTRY:    fm_umb == 1 : leave linked, else unlink
 31693                                  ; EXIT:     None
 31694                                  ; ERROR:    None
 31695                                  ; USES:     AX, BX
 31696                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31697                                  
 31698                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 31699                                  fm_unlink:
 31700 00002A5E 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx
 31701                                  	
 31702                                  	;getdata bl,fm_umb		; fm_umb already has the old link-state
 31703                                  	;
 31704                                  	;push	ds
 31705                                  	;push	cs
 31706                                  	;pop	ds
 31707                                  	;mov	bl,[fm_umb]	
 31708                                  	;pop	ds
 31709                                  	
 31710                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31711                                  	; ds = cs
 31712                                  	;mov	bl,[cs:fm_umb]
 31713 00002A60 8A1E[371F]              	mov	bl,[fm_umb]
 31714                                  
 31715 00002A64 B80358                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 31716 00002A67 CD21                    	int	21h			; so just use that, and call int 21h
 31717 00002A69 C3                      	retn
 31718                                  
 31719                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31720                                  
 31721                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31722                                  ;*** ParseVar - parses [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] and builds the table
 31723                                  ; laid out in highvar.inc
 31724                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31725                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to command tail of LoadHigh/DeviceHigh (whitespace ok)
 31726                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character in child program name
 31727                                  ; ERROR:    ES:SI points to character which caused error, carry set, AX == code
 31728                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, AX, flags, variables in highvar.inc
 31729                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31730                                  ; Error codes (in AX if carry set on return):
 31731                                  ;
 31732                                  PV_InvArg	equ	1	; Invalid argument passed
 31733                                  PV_BadUMB	equ	2	; Bad UMB number passed (duplicate?)
 31734                                  PV_InvSwt	equ	3	; Unrecognized switch passed
 31735                                  ;
 31736                                  ; This routine exects ES:SI to point to a string much like the following:
 31737                                  ;    "/S/L:1,200;2 module options"
 31738                                  ; Optionally, the string can begin with whitespace; neither /S nor /L is
 31739                                  ; required, though that's what this routine is supposed to parse.
 31740                                  ;
 31741                                  optS		equ	'S'	; /S
 31742                                  optL		equ	'L'	; /L:...
 31743                                  ;
 31744                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31745                                  ; LoadHigh has a list of arguments, returned by cparse, which is used to create
 31746                                  ; a command-line for spawning a child process. For a typical LH command, say,
 31747                                  ;     lh /l:1,1000;2 print/d:lpt2
 31748                                  ; the arguments would look like (one per line):
 31749                                  ;     lh
 31750                                  ;     /l
 31751                                  ;     1
 31752                                  ;     1000
 31753                                  ;     2
 31754                                  ;     print
 31755                                  ;     /d
 31756                                  ;     :lpt2
 31757                                  ; In short, if "print" were, say, "43", there'd be no way to determine which
 31758                                  ; arg was the filename. So, inside this routine, we keep a running counter
 31759                                  ; of the number of arguments LH will need to skip in order to get to the
 31760                                  ; program name. The "lh" is implicit--it'll always have to skip that. So if
 31761                                  ; there's no "/l" or "/s", fm_argc will be 0 ... other than that, 1 is added
 31762                                  ; for:
 31763                                  ;    Each /L
 31764                                  ;    Each /S (there should be only one)
 31765                                  ;    Each UMB number (they follow ":" or ";")
 31766                                  ;    Each UMB size   (they follow ",")
 31767                                  ; So, in the above example, fm_argc would be 4-- and LH would skip right to
 31768                                  ; "print".  Note that InitVar initializes fm_argc to zero.
 31769                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31770                                  
 31771                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 31772                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F9Fh)
 31773                                  
 31774                                  ParseVar:
 31775                                  	;pushreg <di, ds, es>
 31776                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31777                                  	;push	di ; * ; (not required) ; 01/01/2023
 31778 00002A6A 1E                      	push	ds
 31779 00002A6B 06                      	push	es
 31780                                  
 31781 00002A6C 06                      	push	es		; Make DS:SI point to it, as well as ES:SI
 31782 00002A6D 1F                      	pop	ds		; (regardless if we're in devhigh or loadhigh)
 31783 00002A6E FC                      	cld
 31784                                  
 31785                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 31786                                  ; PV10--ES:SI = any whitespace on the command-line
 31787                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 31788                                  
 31789 00002A6F AC                      pv10:	lodsb			; here, ES:SI=="  /L..."--must eat whitespace
 31790 00002A70 E8A200                  	call	isWhite
 31791 00002A73 74FA                    	jz	short pv10	;       ES:SI==" /L..."--keep eating.
 31792                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 31793 00002A75 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH
 31794 00002A77 7404                    	je	short pv20	;       ES:SI=="/L..."--go process a switch
 31795                                  
 31796 00002A79 4E                      	dec	si		; Backup--it's now "odule options", and we need
 31797 00002A7A F8                      	clc			; that "m" we just read (or whatever it is).
 31798 00002A7B EB2B                    	jmp	short pvX	; Then return with carry clear == we're done.
 31799                                  
 31800 00002A7D AC                      pv20:	lodsb			; Just read 'S' or 'L', hopefully
 31801                                  	;toUpper al		; So we make it upper-case, and...
 31802 00002A7E 24DF                    	and	al,0DFh
 31803                                  	;cmp	al,'S'
 31804 00002A80 3C53                    	cmp	al,optS		; just read 'S'?
 31805 00002A82 750D                    	jne	short pv30
 31806                                  
 31807                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /S, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 31808 00002A84 2EFE06[391F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 31809                                  
 31810                                  	;putdata fUmbTiny,1	; /S, so ES:SI=="  /L..." or " module opts", or
 31811                                  	;
 31812                                  	;push	es
 31813                                  	;push	cs
 31814                                  	;pop	es
 31815                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],1	
 31816                                  	;pop	es
 31817                                  
 31818 00002A89 2EC606[031F]01          	mov	byte [cs:fUmbTiny],1
 31819                                  
 31820 00002A8F EBDE                    	jmp	short pv10	; possibly even "/L...".
 31821                                  
 31822                                  pv30:	;cmp	al,'L'
 31823 00002A91 3C4C                    	cmp	al,optL		; If it's not 'L' either, then 'tis a bad
 31824 00002A93 750D                    	jne	short pvE1		; switch!
 31825                                  
 31826                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /L, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 31827 00002A95 2EFE06[391F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 31828                                  
 31829 00002A9A E80E00                  	call	parseL
 31830 00002A9D 73D0                    	jnc	short pv10	; If no carry, go back and look for more
 31831                                  
 31832 00002A9F 4E                      	dec	si		; Else, back up and exit.
 31833 00002AA0 EB03                    	jmp	short pvErr	; AX has already been set by parseL
 31834                                  
 31835                                  pvE1:	;mov	ax,3
 31836 00002AA2 B80300                  	mov	ax,PV_InvSwt	; Unrecognized switch passed
 31837 00002AA5 4E                      pvErr:	dec	si
 31838 00002AA6 4E                      	dec	si
 31839 00002AA7 F9                      	stc
 31840                                  pvX:	;popreg	<es, ds, di>
 31841 00002AA8 07                      	pop	es
 31842 00002AA9 1F                      	pop	ds
 31843                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31844                                  	;pop	di ; * ; (not required) ; 01/01/2023
 31845 00002AAA C3                      	retn
 31846                                  
 31847                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31848                                  ;*** parseL - parses ":nnnn[,nnnn][;nnnn[,nnnn]]*" for ParseVar
 31849                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31850                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to colon
 31851                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character not parsed
 31852                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set; rewind three characters and return (see ParseVar)
 31853                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, flags, AX, CX, DX, variables in highvar.inc
 31854                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31855                                  ; If the string here is terminated with anything other than whitespace or a
 31856                                  ; switchchar (perhaps it's /S or another /L:... ), then we return with carry
 31857                                  ; set, indicating that they've screwed up the syntax.  The 3-character rewind
 31858                                  ; makes sure the app /L: is reported as being the culprit.
 31859                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31860                                  
 31861                                  parseL:
 31862 00002AAB AC                      	lodsb
 31863 00002AAC 3C3A                    	cmp	al,':'		; Make sure they did /L:
 31864 00002AAE 754E                    	jne	short plE1	; If they didn't, return with carry set.
 31865                                  
 31866                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 31867                                  ; PL10--ES:SI = a UMB number, after /L: or ;
 31868                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 31869                                  
 31870 00002AB0 E8DB00                  pl10:	call	GetXNum		; After this, 'tis ",size" or ";umb" or " mod"
 31871 00002AB3 724F                    	jc	short plE2	; And error if it's a bad number.
 31872 00002AB5 E89D01                  	call	convUMB		; Convert any address to a UMB number
 31873                                  
 31874 00002AB8 88C1                    	mov	cl,al		; Remember the UMB number
 31875 00002ABA E87600                  	call	stowUMB		; Mark this UMB # as used;
 31876 00002ABD 7245                    	jc	short plE2	; If it was already marked, it'll error
 31877                                  
 31878                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB number is another arg for LH to skip
 31879 00002ABF 2EFE06[391F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31880                                  
 31881 00002AC4 AC                      	lodsb
 31882 00002AC5 3C3B                    	cmp	al,';'		; Did "umb;" ?
 31883 00002AC7 74E7                    	je	short pl10	; Yep: go back and get another UMB.
 31884                                  
 31885 00002AC9 E84900                  	call	isWhite		; Did "umb " ?
 31886 00002ACC 743B                    	jz	short plX	; Yep: return (it'll go back to whitespace)
 31887                                  
 31888 00002ACE E83900                  	call	isEOL		; Did "umb" ?
 31889 00002AD1 7435                    	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 31890                                  
 31891                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 31892 00002AD3 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH 	; Did "umb/" ? (as in, "/L:1,100;2/S")
 31893 00002AD5 7431                    	je	short plSwX	; If so, back up ES:SI one character and return
 31894                                  
 31895 00002AD7 3C2C                    	cmp	al,','		; Did "umb," ?
 31896 00002AD9 7523                    	jne	short plE1	; Just what the heck DID they do? Return error.
 31897                                  
 31898                                  ; --- Read a size -------------------------------------------------------------
 31899                                  
 31900 00002ADB E8B000                  	call	GetXNum		; Stop on "size;" or "size " or anything else
 31901 00002ADE 721E                    	jc	short plE1	; And error if it's a bad size.
 31902                                  
 31903 00002AE0 E81601                  	call	toPara		; Convert from bytes to paragraphs
 31904                                  
 31905 00002AE3 E8CE01                  	call	stowSiz		; CL still has the UMB number for this routine
 31906                                  
 31907                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB size is another arg for LH to skip
 31908 00002AE6 2EFE06[391F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31909                                  
 31910 00002AEB AC                      	lodsb
 31911 00002AEC 3C3B                    	cmp	al,';'		; They did "umb,size;", so get another UMB.
 31912 00002AEE 74C0                    	je	short pl10	;
 31913                                  
 31914 00002AF0 E82200                  	call	isWhite		; Did it end with whitespace?
 31915 00002AF3 7414                    	jz	short plX	; If so, we're done here--go back.
 31916                                  
 31917 00002AF5 E81200                  	call	isEOL		; Did they do "umb,size" and end??? (stupid)
 31918 00002AF8 740E                    	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 31919                                  
 31920                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 31921 00002AFA 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH	; Did they do "umb,size/" ?
 31922 00002AFC 740A                    	je	short plSwX	; If so, again, we're done here.
 31923                                  plE1:	
 31924                                  	;mov	ax,1
 31925 00002AFE B80100                  	mov	ax,PV_InvArg	; If not, we don't know WHAT they did...
 31926 00002B01 4E                      	dec	si
 31927 00002B02 F9                      	stc
 31928 00002B03 C3                      	retn
 31929                                  
 31930                                  plE2:	;mov	ax,2
 31931 00002B04 B80200                  	mov	ax,PV_BadUMB	; In this case, they've specified a UMB twice
 31932                                  	; 12/12/2022
 31933                                  	; cf=1
 31934                                  	;stc
 31935 00002B07 C3                      	retn
 31936                                  plSwX:	
 31937 00002B08 4E                      	dec	si		; If we hit a '/' character, back up one char
 31938                                  				; so the whitespace checker will see it too.
 31939                                  plX:	; 12/12/2022
 31940                                  	; cf=0
 31941                                  	;clc			; Then just return with carry clear, so
 31942 00002B09 C3                      	retn			; ParseVar will go about its business.
 31943

 31969                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31970                                  ;*** isEOL - returns with ZF set if AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 31971                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31972                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 31973                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 31974                                  ; ERROR:    None
 31975                                  ; USES:     ZF
 31976                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31977                                  
 31978                                  isEOL:
 31979 00002B0A 3C00                    	cmp	al,0		; Null-terminator
 31980 00002B0C 7406                    	je	short ieX
 31981 00002B0E 3C0D                    	cmp	al,CR ; 0Dh	; Carriage Return
 31982 00002B10 7402                    	je	short ieX
 31983 00002B12 3C0A                    	cmp	al,LF ; 0Ah	; LineFeed
 31984                                  ieX:	
 31985 00002B14 C3                      	retn
 31986                                  
 31987                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31988                                  ;*** isWhite - returns with ZF set if AL contains whitespace (or "=")
 31989                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31990                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 31991                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains space, tab, or equals
 31992                                  ; ERROR:    None
 31993                                  ; USES:     ZF
 31994                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31995                                  
 31996                                  isWhite:
 31997 00002B15 3C20                    	cmp	al,' '		; Space
 31998 00002B17 7406                    	je	short iwX
 31999 00002B19 3C3D                    	cmp	al,'='		; Equals (treat as whitespace)
 32000 00002B1B 7402                    	je	short iwX
 32001 00002B1D 3C09                    	cmp	al,tab ; 9	; Tab
 32002                                  iwX:	
 32003 00002B1F C3                      	retn

 32056                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32057                                  ;*** stowUMB - marks a given UMB as used, if it hasn't been so marked before
 32058                                  ;            -- accepts a UMB # in AL, and makes sure it hasn't yet been
 32059                                  ; listed in the /L:... chain. If it's the first one specified, it sets UmbLoad
 32060                                  ; to that UMB #... and in any case, it marks the UMB as specified.
 32061                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32062                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains UMB number, as specified by the user
 32063                                  ; EXIT:     None
 32064                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if UMB # is less than 0 or >= MAXUMB (see highvar.inc)
 32065                                  ; USES:     AX, Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 32066                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32067                                  
 32068                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 32069                                  stowUMB:
 32070 00002B33 3C10                    	cmp	al,MAXUMB ; 16
 32071 00002B35 7202                    	jb	short su10
 32072 00002B37 F9                      	stc
 32073 00002B38 C3                      	retn			; Ooops-- UMB>=MAXUMB
 32074                                  su10:	
 32075                                  	; 01/01/2023
 32076                                  	;push	bx
 32077                                  	;push	di
 32078                                  	;push	si
 32079                                  	;push	ds
 32080                                  	;push	es
 32081                                  	;push	cs
 32082                                  	;pop	es
 32083                                  	;push	cs
 32084                                  	;pop	ds
 32085                                  
 32086                                  	; 01/01/2023
 32087                                  	; ds <> cs
 32088                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:UmbLoad],0FFh
 32089 00002B39 2E803E[061F]FF          	cmp	byte [cs:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED
 32090                                  				; If this, we haven't been here before
 32091 00002B3F 7504                    	jne	short su20
 32092 00002B41 2EA2[061F]              	mov	[cs:UmbLoad],al	; So remember this UMB as the load UMB slot.
 32093                                  
 32094                                  	;;cmp	byte [UmbLoad],0FFh
 32095                                  	;cmp	byte [UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; If this, we haven't been here before
 32096                                  	;jne	short su20
 32097                                  	;mov	[UmbLoad],al	; So remember this UMB as the load UMB slot.
 32098                                  su20:	
 32099 00002B45 08C0                    	or	al,al		; If they gave UMB 0, there's really nothing
 32100 00002B47 740E                    	jz	short su30	; that we should do here.
 32101                                  
 32102                                  	;mov	bl,al
 32103                                  	;xor	bh,bh
 32104                                  	;mov	ax,1		; Now, AX = 1, and BX = UMB Number
 32105                                  	; 01/01/2023
 32106 00002B49 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah
 32107 00002B4B 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 32108 00002B4D B001                    	mov	al,1
 32109                                  
 32110                                  	;xchg	[es:bx+UmbUsed],al
 32111                                  	; 01/01/2023
 32112 00002B4F 2E8687[071F]            	xchg	[cs:bx+UmbUsed],al
 32113                                  
 32114                                  	;or	al,al		; If it was already 1, then al==1... and that
 32115                                  	;jz	short su30	; means an error.
 32116                                  	;
 32117                                  	;stc			; OOOPS!  This one's been used before.  :(
 32118                                  	
 32119                                  	; 01/01/2023
 32120 00002B54 3C01                    	cmp	al,1
 32121 00002B56 F5                      	cmc 	; if al > 0 -> cf = 1
 32122                                  su30:	
 32123                                  	; 01/01/2023
 32124                                  	;pop	es
 32125                                  	;pop	ds
 32126                                  	;pop	si
 32127                                  	;pop	di
 32128                                  	;pop	bx
 32129 00002B57 C3                      	retn
 32130                                  
 32131                                  ; 08/09/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (Optimization)
 32132                                  %if 0
