 32169                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32170                                  ;*** toDigit - converts a character-digit to its binary counterpart
 32171                                  ;            -- verifies that CL contains a valid character-digit; if so, it
 32172                                  ; changes CL to its counterpart binary digit ((CL-'0') or (CL-'A'+10)).
 32173                                  ; A-F are considered valid iff gnradix is 16.
 32174                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32175                                  ; ENTRY:    CL contains a digit ('0' to '9' or, if gnradix==16, 'A' to 'F')
 32176                                  ; EXIT:     CL contains digit in binary (0 to 9 or, if gnradix==16, 0 to 15)
 32177                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set indicates invalid digit; carry clear indicates good digit
 32178                                  ; USES:     CL, Flags
 32179                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32180                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 32181                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 32182                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 32183                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32184                                  
 32185                                  gnradix:
 32186 00002B58 0000                    	dw	0		; Must be a word--16x16 multiplication
 32187                                  
 32188                                  toDigit:
 32189 00002B5A 2E833E[582B]10          	cmp	word [cs:gnradix],16
 32190 00002B60 751C                    	jne	short td20	; Don't check hex digits if radix isn't 16
 32191                                  
 32192                                  toDigit_hex:
 32193 00002B62 80F961                  	cmp	cl,'a'	; 61h
 32194 00002B65 7209                    	jb	short td10
 32195 00002B67 80F966                  	cmp	cl,'f'	; 66h
 32196 00002B6A 7720                    	ja	short tdE	; Nothing valid above 'z' at all...
 32197 00002B6C 80E957                  	sub	cl,'a'-10 ; 57h	; Make 'a'==10 and return.
 32198                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 32199 00002B6F C3                      	retn
 32200                                  td10:	
 32201 00002B70 80F941                  	cmp	cl,'A'  ; 41h
 32202 00002B73 7209                    	jb	short td20	; Below 'A'?  Not a letter...
 32203 00002B75 80F946                  	cmp	cl,'F'	; 46h
 32204 00002B78 7712                    	ja	short tdE	; Above 'F'?  Not a digit.
 32205 00002B7A 80E937                  	sub	cl,'A'-10 ; 37h	; Make 'A'==10 and return.
 32206                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 32207 00002B7D C3                      	retn
 32208                                  toDigit_dec:
 32209                                  td20:	
 32210 00002B7E 80F930                  	cmp	cl,'0'		; If less than zero,
 32211                                  	;jb	short tdE	; Done.
 32212 00002B81 720A                    	jb	short tdEr ; 08/04/2019
 32213 00002B83 80F939                  	cmp	cl,'9'		; Or, if greater than nine,
 32214 00002B86 7704                    	ja	short tdE	; Done.
 32215 00002B88 80E930                  	sub	cl,'0'	; 30h	; Okay--make '0'==0 and return.
 32216                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 32217 00002B8B C3                      	retn
 32218                                  tdE:	
 32219 00002B8C F9                      	stc
 32220                                  tdEr:		; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0	
 32221 00002B8D C3                      	retn
 32222                                  
 32223                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32224                                  ;*** GetXNum - reads a 32-bit ASCII number at ES:SI and returns it in DX:AX
 32225                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32226                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to an ascii string to scan
 32227                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI moved to first invalid digit, DX:AX contains value read
 32228                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if # is too big, or has no digits (EOL possibly)
 32229                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, DX, AX, Flags, gnradix
 32230                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32231                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 32232                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 32233                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 32234                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32235                                  
 32236                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 32237                                  
 32238                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 32239                                  ; (SYSINIT:3109h)
 32240                                  
 32241                                  GetXNum:
 32242                                  	;pushreg <bx, cx, ds>
 32243                                  	; 01/01/2023
 32244                                  	;push	bx
 32245 00002B8E 51                      	push	cx ; *
 32246                                  	;push	ds
 32247                                  
 32248 00002B8F FC                      	cld
 32249 00002B90 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 32250 00002B92 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx
 32251 00002B94 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 32252 00002B96 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			; Start with 0 (makes sense)
 32253                                  
 32254 00002B98 2EC706[582B]0A00        	mov	word [cs:gnradix],10	; And default to a radix of 10 (dec)
 32255                                  
 32256 00002B9F 268A0C                  	mov	cl,[es:si]		; Now AX=0, BX=0, CH=0/CL=char, DX=0
 32257                                  	;call	toDigit
 32258 00002BA2 E8D9FF                  	call	toDigit_dec
 32259                                  	;jc	short gxnE		; If it's not a digit, leave now.
 32260                                  	; 01/01/2023
 32261 00002BA5 7233                    	jc	short gxnX
 32262                                  
 32263 00002BA7 08C9                    	or	cl,cl
 32264 00002BA9 7517                    	jnz	short gxn20		; Doesn't have '0x'
 32265 00002BAB 268A4C01                	mov	cl,[es:si+1]
 32266 00002BAF 80F978                  	cmp	cl,'x'			; Either 'x'...
 32267 00002BB2 7405                    	je	short gxn10
 32268 00002BB4 80F958                  	cmp	cl,'X'			; ...or 'X' means it's hexadecimal
 32269 00002BB7 7509                    	jne	short gxn20
 32270                                  
 32271                                  gxn10:	
 32272 00002BB9 2EC706[582B]1000        	mov	word [cs:gnradix], 16
 32273 00002BC0 46                      	inc	si			; Since we read "0x", march over it.
 32274 00002BC1 46                      	inc	si
 32275                                  
 32276                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------
 32277                                  ; GXN20--ES:SI = a digit in a number; if not, we're done
 32278                                  ;        DX:AX = current total
 32279                                  ;        BX    = 0
 32280                                  ;        CH    = 0
 32281                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------
 32282                                  
 32283                                  gxn20:	
 32284 00002BC2 268A0C                  	mov	cl,[es:si]	; Now DX:AX=current total, CH=0/CL=char
 32285 00002BC5 46                      	inc	si
 32286                                  
 32287 00002BC6 E891FF                  	call	toDigit		; Accepts only valid digits, A-F -> 10-16
 32288 00002BC9 720D                    	jc	short gxnQ	; <- Ah... wasn't a digit. Stop.
 32289                                  
 32290 00002BCB E80E00                  	call	mul32		; Multiply DX:AX by gnradix
 32291 00002BCE 720A                    	jc	short gxnX	; (if it's too big, error out)
 32292                                  
 32293 00002BD0 01C8                    	add	ax,cx		; Add the digit
 32294 00002BD2 11DA                    	adc	dx,bx		; (BX is 0!)--Adds 1 iff last add wrapped
 32295                                  	;jc	short gxnX	; If _that_ wrapped, it's too big.
 32296                                  	;jmp	short gxn20
 32297 00002BD4 73EC                    	jnc	short gxn20
 32298                                  gxnE:	
 32299                                  	;stc			; In this case, we need to set the carry
 32300 00002BD6 EB02                    	jmp	short gxnX	; and leave--there were no digits given.
 32301                                  gxnQ:	
 32302 00002BD8 4E                      	dec	si		; Don't read in the offensive character.
 32303 00002BD9 F8                      	clc			; And clear carry, so they know it's okay.
 32304                                  gxnX:	
 32305                                  	; 01/01/2023
 32306                                  	;pop	ds
 32307 00002BDA 59                      	pop	cx ; *
 32308                                  	;pop	bx
 32309 00002BDB C3                      	retn
 32310                                  
 32311                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32312                                  ;*** mul32 - multiplies the number in DX:AX by gnradix
 32313                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32314                                  ; ENTRY:   DX:AX = the number to be multiplied, BX = 0, gnradix = multiplier
 32315                                  ; EXIT:    DX:AX has been multiplied by gnradix if carry clear; BX still 0
 32316                                  ; ERROR:   Carry set if number was too large
 32317                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX, DX
 32318                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32319                                  
 32320                                  mul32:
 32321 00002BDC 50                      	push	ax		; DX=old:hi, AX=old:lo, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 32322 00002BDD 89D0                    	mov	ax,dx		; DX=old:hi, AX=old:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 32323 00002BDF 2EF726[582B]            	mul	word [cs:gnradix] ; DX=?, AX=new:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 32324 00002BE4 7211                    	jc	short m32E	; Too big?
 32325                                  
 32326 00002BE6 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 32327 00002BE8 58                      	pop	ax		; DX=new:hi, AX=old:lo, TOS=orig, BX=0
 32328                                  
 32329 00002BE9 87DA                    	xchg	dx,bx		; DX=0, AX=old:lo, TOS=orig, BX=new:hi
 32330 00002BEB 2EF726[582B]            	mul	word [cs:gnradix] ; DX=carry,  AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=new:hi
 32331 00002BF0 87DA                    	xchg	dx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=carry
 32332 00002BF2 01DA                    	add	dx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=carry
 32333 00002BF4 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=0
 32334 00002BF6 C3                      	retn
 32335                                  m32E:	
 32336 00002BF7 58                      	pop	ax
 32337 00002BF8 C3                      	retn
 32338                                  
 32339                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32340                                  ;*** toPara - divides DX:AX by 16; result in AX only (discards extra DX data)
 32341                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32342                                  ; ENTRY:   DX:AX = the number to be divided
 32343                                  ; EXIT:    Interpereting DX:AX as bytes, AX=paragraph equivalent, 0xFFFF max
 32344                                  ; ERROR:   None
 32345                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX, DX
 32346                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32347                                  ; Note: The 386 has a 32-bit SHR, which would work perfectly for this... but we
 32348                                  ;       can't ensure a 386 host machine. Sorry.
 32349                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32350                                  
 32351                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 32352                                  toPara:
 32353 00002BF9 51                      	push	cx		; DX:AX=HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh:LLLL llll llll llll
 32354                                  
 32355 00002BFA B104                    	mov	cl,4		;
 32356 00002BFC D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl		; DX:AX=HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh:0000 LLLL llll llll
 32357 00002BFE 92                      	xchg	ax,dx		; DX:AX=0000 LLLL llll llll:HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh
 32358 00002BFF B10C                    	mov	cl,12
 32359 00002C01 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl		; DX:AX=0000 LLLL llll llll:hhhh 0000 0000 0000
 32360 00002C03 09D0                    	or	ax,dx		;    AX=hhhh LLLL llll llll
 32361                                  
 32362 00002C05 59                      	pop	cx
 32363 00002C06 C3                      	retn
 32364                                  
 32365                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32366                                  ;*** UmbHead - returns in AX the address of the first UMB block (0x9FFF)
 32367                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32368                                  ; ENTRY:  Nothing
 32369                                  ; EXIT:   AX contains 0x9FFF for most systems
 32370                                  ; ERROR:  Carry set if pointer is 0xFFFF (if not set up yet--DH runs into this)
 32371                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 32372                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32373                                  ; Early in the boot-cycle, the pointer used to obtain this value isn't set up;
 32374                                  ; to be precise, before a UMB provider is around. In this event, the pointer
 32375                                  ; is always set to 0xFFFF; it changes once a provider is around. On most
 32376                                  ; machines (all of 'em I've seen), it changes to 0x9FFF at that point.
 32377                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32378                                  
 32379                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 32380                                  UmbHead:
 32381                                  	; 13/05/2019 (because of callers, pushs & pops are not needed here)
 32382                                  
 32383                                  	;push	si ; ?
 32384                                  	;push	ds ; ? 
 32385                                  	;push	es
 32386                                  	;push	bx ; *	
 32387                                  
 32388                                  	; 09/04/2019
 32389                                  	; !!! No need to save es,bx,ds,si above !!! (es,bx are changed here)
 32390                                  
 32391 00002C07 B452                    	mov	ah,GET_IN_VARS		; Call int 21h, function 52h...
 32392 00002C09 CD21                    	int	21h
 32393                                  
 32394 00002C0B 26A18C00                	mov	ax,[es:DOS_UMB_HEAD]	; And read what's in ES:[008C]
 32395                                  	
 32396                                  	; 01/01/2023
 32397 00002C0F 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,0FFFFh
 32398 00002C12 F5                      	cmc
 32399                                  	; if AX=0FFFFh -> CF=1
 32400 00002C13 C3                      	retn
 32401                                  
 32402                                  ; 01/01/2023
 32403                                  ;%if 0
 32404                                  ;	cmp	ax,0FFFFh
 32405                                  ;	je	short uhE		; If it's 0xFFFF, it's an error...
 32406                                  ;
 32407                                  ;	clc				; Else, it isn't (CLC done by prev cmp)
 32408                                  ;	;jmp	short uhX
 32409                                  ;	; 12/12/2022
 32410                                  ;	retn
 32411                                  ;uhE:	
 32412                                  ;	stc
 32413                                  ;uhX:	
 32414                                  ;	;pop	bx ; *
 32415                                  ;	;pop	es
 32416                                  ;	;pop	ds ; ?
 32417                                  ;	;pop	si ; ?
 32418                                  ;	retn
 32419                                  ;%endif
 32420                                  
 32421                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32422                                  ;*** isSysMCB - sets ZF if ES points to an MCB owned by "SC" + (8 or 9)
 32423                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32424                                  ; ENTRY:  ES:0 should point to a valid MCB
 32425                                  ; EXIT:   ZF set if owned by SC+8 or SC+9 (for japan)
 32426                                  ; USES:   Flags
 32427                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32428                                  
 32429                                  isSysMCB:
 32430                                  	;push	ax
 32431                                  
 32432                                  	;mov	ax,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; Check the owner...
 32433                                  	;cmp	ax,SystemPSPOwner	; 8 (for US OR Japan) is valid
 32434                                  	;je	short ism10
 32435                                  	;cmp	ax,JapanPSPOwner	; 9 (for Japan) is valid
 32436                                  	;;je	short ism10
 32437                                  	;;jmp	short ismX		; Anything else isn't.
 32438                                  	;jne	short ismX
 32439 00002C14 26833E010008            	cmp	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],SystemPSPOwner ; 8  ; 09/04/2019
 32440 00002C1A 7507                    	jne	short ismX 
 32441                                  ism10:	
 32442                                  	;mov	ax,[es:ARENA.NAME]	; Check the name...
 32443                                  	;cmp	ax,'SC' ; 4353h
 32444 00002C1C 26813E08005343          	cmp	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC'
 32445                                  ismX:	
 32446                                  	;pop	ax
 32447 00002C23 C3                      	retn
 32448                                  
 32449                                  ; 09/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 32450                                  
 32451                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32452                                  ;*** AddrToUmb - converts a segment address in AX to its appropriate UMB number
 32453                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32454                                  ; ENTRY:  AX contains a segment address
 32455                                  ; EXIT:   AX will contain the UMB number which contains the address (0==conv)
 32456                                  ; ERROR:  If the address is above UM Range, AX will return as FFFF.
 32457                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 32458                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32459                                  ; An address in the following areas is treated as:
 32460                                  ;    0      <-> umbhead (0x9FFF)          = Conventional memory
 32461                                  ;    0x9FFF <-> addr of first UM sys MCB  = UMB #1
 32462                                  ;      ...
 32463                                  ;    addr of last UM sys MCB <-> TOM      = invalid; returns #0xFFFF
 32464                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32465                                  
 32466                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 32467                                  AddrToUmb:
 32468                                  	; 01/01/2023
 32469                                  	;push	cx
 32470                                  	;push	dx
 32471 00002C24 06                      	push	es
 32472                                  
 32473 00002C25 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax		; DX = address to search for
 32474                                  
 32475 00002C27 E8DDFF                  	call	UmbHead		; AX = first segment
 32476 00002C2A 7222                    	jc	short atuE	; If it couldn't get it, error out.
 32477                                  
 32478                                  	; 22/07/2023
 32479                                  	;mov	es,ax ; *	; ES = first UMB segment
 32480 00002C2C 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx ; 0	; Pretend we're on UMB 0 for now... (cx = UMB#)
 32481                                  
 32482                                  	; 22/07/2023
 32483                                  atu10:
 32484 00002C2E 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax ; * ; ** ; 22/07/2023
 32485                                  ; ----------------------------------------
 32486                                  ; ATU10--ES - Current MCB address
 32487                                  ;        DX - Address given for conversion
 32488                                  ;        CX - Current UMB #
 32489                                  ; ----------------------------------------
 32490                                  
 32491                                  ;atu10:	
 32492                                  	;mov	ax,es ; * ; 18/07/2023
 32493 00002C30 39D0                            cmp	ax,dx		; Present segment >= given segment?
 32494 00002C32 731D                    	jae	short atuX	; Yep--done.
 32495                                  
 32496 00002C34 E8DDFF                  	call	isSysMCB	; Returns with ZF set if this is a system MCB
 32497 00002C37 7501                    	jnz	short atu20
 32498                                  
 32499 00002C39 41                      	inc	cx		; If it _was_ a system MCB, we're in a new UMB.
 32500                                  atu20:	
 32501                                  	;mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 32502                                  	;cmp	al,arena_signature_end  ; 'Z'
 32503                                  	; 22/07/2023
 32504                                  	; ax = es
 32505                                  	;mov	ax,es ; **
 32506 00002C3A 2603060300              	add	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 32507 00002C3F 26803E00005A            	cmp	byte [es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],arena_signature_end
 32508 00002C45 7403                    	je	short atu30		; 'Z' means this was the last MCB... that's it.
 32509                                  
 32510                                  	;NextMCB es,ax
 32511                                  
 32512                                  	;mov	ax,es ; **
 32513                                  	;;add	ax,[es:3]
 32514                                  	;add	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 32515 00002C47 40                      	inc	ax
 32516                                  	; 22/07/2023
 32517                                  	;mov	es,ax ; *
 32518 00002C48 EBE4                    	jmp	short atu10
 32519                                  
 32520                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32521                                  ; if we get to atu30, they specified a number that was past the last MCB.
 32522                                  ; make sure it's not _inside_ that MCB before we return an error condition.
 32523                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32524                                  
 32525                                  atu30:	
 32526                                  	; 22/07/2023
 32527                                  	; ax = es + [es:ARENA.SIZE] 
 32528                                  	;mov	ax,es ; **
 32529                                  	;add	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE] ; **
 32530 00002C4A 39D0                    	cmp	ax,dx		; Present >= given?
 32531 00002C4C 7303                    	jae	short atuX	; Yep! It _was_ inside.
 32532                                  atuE:	
 32533 00002C4E 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx ; 0	; Else, fall through with UMB # == -1
 32534 00002C50 49                      	dec	cx		; (that makes it return 0xFFFF and sets CF)
 32535                                  atuX:	
 32536 00002C51 89C8                    	mov	ax,cx		; Return the UMB number in AX
 32537                                  	
 32538 00002C53 07                      	pop	es	
 32539                                  	; 01/01/2023
 32540                                  	;pop	dx
 32541                                  	;pop	cx
 32542 00002C54 C3                      	retn
 32543                                  
 32544                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32545                                  ;*** convUMB - checks after GetXNum to convert an address to a UMB number
 32546                                  ;            -- if GetXNum read a hex number, we interperete that as a segment
 32547                                  ; address rather than a UMB number... and use that address to look up a UMB.
 32548                                  ; This routine checks for that condition and calls AddrToUmb if necessary.
 32549                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32550                                  ; ENTRY:  AX contains a UMB number or segment, gnradix has been set by GetXNum
 32551                                  ; EXIT:   AX will contain a UMB number
 32552                                  ; ERROR:  None
 32553                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 32554                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32555                                  
 32556                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 32557                                  convUMB:
 32558 00002C55 2E833E[582B]10          	cmp	word [cs:gnradix],16
 32559 00002C5B 7507                    	jne	short cu10	; If it didn't read in hex, it's not an address
 32560 00002C5D E8C4FF                  	call	AddrToUmb	; Else, convert the address to a UMB number
 32561                                  	;cmp	ax,0FFFFh
 32562                                  	;jne	short cu10
 32563                                  	;inc	ax		; If too high, ignore it (make it conventional)
 32564                                  	; 01/01/2023
 32565 00002C60 40                      	inc	ax
 32566 00002C61 7401                    	jz	short cu10	; If too high, ignore it (make it conventional)
 32567 00002C63 48                      	dec	ax
 32568                                  cu10:	
 32569 00002C64 C3                      	retn
 32570                                  
 32571                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 32572                                  ;%if 0
 32573                                  ;
 32574                                  ;; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32575                                  ;;*** setUMBs - links umbs and sets allocation strategy for a load
 32576                                  ;;            -- if LoadHigh, the allocation strategy MAY be LOW_FIRST instead
 32577                                  ;; of the usual HIGH_FIRST. See the code.
 32578                                  ;; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32579                                  ;; ENTRY:  None
 32580                                  ;; EXIT:   None

 32595                                  ; 18/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 32596                                  ; loadLow subroutine is not used anywhere of IO.SYS 6.22 (& 5.0)
 32597                                  %if 0
 32598                                  
 32599                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32600                                  ;*** loadLow - returns AL==0 if UMB0 == 0, else AL==1
 32601                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32602                                  ; ENTRY:  None
 32603                                  ; EXIT:   AL==0 if mem strategy should be set to LOW_FIRST, else AL==1
 32604                                  ;         Carry set if UMB0 not specified (_NOT_ an error)
 32605                                  ; ERROR:  None
 32606                                  ; USES:   Flags, fm_strat, fm_umb
 32607                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32608                                  ; We want to set the memory strategy to LOW_FIRST if the user specified a
 32609                                  ; load UMB, and it is 0. That 0 can be either from the user having _specified_
 32610                                  ; zero (/L:0;...), or from having specified a too-big min size (/L:1,99999999)
 32611                                  ; such that the load UMB is too small, and shouldn't be used.
 32612                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32613                                  
 32614                                  loadLow:
 32615                                  	;push	ds
 32616                                  	;push	cs		; Point DS into appropriate data segment
 32617                                  	;pop	ds	
 32618                                  
 32619                                  	;mov	al,[UmbLoad]
 32620                                  	mov	al,[cs:UmbLoad]
 32621                                  	cmp	al,UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh, -1
 32622                                  	jne	short ll10
 32623                                  
 32624                                  	stc
 32625                                  ll15:
 32626                                  	mov	al,1		; Return with AL==1 && STC if no UMBs specified
 32627                                  	;stc
 32628                                  	;jmp	short llX
 32629                                  	retn
 32630                                  ll10:	
 32631                                  	or	al,al		; AL=the load UMB: Is it == 0?
 32632                                  	;jz	short llX	; Yep... CF==0 (from OR) && AL=0, so just exit
 32633                                  
 32634                                  	jnz	short ll15	; 09/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 32635                                  	retn
 32636                                  
 32637                                  	;mov	al,1
 32638                                  	;clc
 32639                                  ;llX:
 32640                                  	;pop	ds		; Return DS to where it was
 32641                                  	;retn
 32642                                  
 32643                                  %endif

 32645                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32646                                  ;*** HideUMBs - links UMBs and hides upper-memory as appropriate
 32647                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32648                                  ; ENTRY:  None
 32649                                  ; EXIT:   None
 32650                                  ; ERROR:  None
 32651                                  ; USES:   Flags, fm_strat, fm_umb
 32652                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32653                                  
 32654                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)

 32667 00002C69 7232                    	jc	short husX	; ...if not, there's nothing for us to do.

 32670

 32672                                  	; 01/01/2023

 32675                                  	;putdata fInHigh,1	; Remember that we're now running high
 32676                                  	;mov	byte [cs:fInHigh],1
 32677                                  	; 01/01/2023
 32678 00002C71 C606[021F]01            	mov	byte [fInHigh],1
 32679                                  
 32680                                  	;call	GetLoadUMB	; See if they gave us a list to leave free
 32681                                  	;mov	al,[cs:UmbLoad] ; 09/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 32682                                  	; 01/01/2023
 32683 00002C76 A0[061F]                	mov	al,[UmbLoad]
 32684                                  
 32685 00002C79 3CFF                    	cmp	al,UNSPECIFIED	; If they didn't,
 32686 00002C7B 7420                    	je	short husX	; then we shouldn't do this loop:
 32687                                  
 32688 00002C7D 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 32689                                  
 32690                                  ; -----------------------------------------------
 32691                                  ; HUS10-CX - UMB number (after inc, 1==first UMB)

 33106                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33107                                  ;*** findUMB - makes ES:0 point to the first MCB in UMB given as AL
 33108                                  ;            -- returns UmbHEAD pointer (0x9FFF) if passed AL==0
 33109                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33110                                  ; ENTRY:    AL should be to a valid UMB number
 33111                                  ; EXIT:     ES:0 points to first MCB in UMB (_not_ the 8+SC MCB that heads it)
 33112                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if couldn't reach UMB (too high)
 33113                                  ; USES:     Flags, ES
 33114                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33115                                  
 33116                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 33117                                  	; (SYSINIT:3344h)
 33118                                  findUMB:
 33119                                  	; 01/01/2023
 33120                                  	;push	ax
 33121                                  	; 02/01/2023
 33122 00002D2D 51                      	push	cx ; *
 33123                                  	;push	dx
 33124                                  
 33125 00002D2E 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah		; Zap ah, so al==ax
 33126                                  
 33127 00002D30 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax		; Store the to-be-found UMB number in DX
 33128                                  
 33129 00002D32 E8D2FE                  	call	UmbHead		; Returns first UMB segment in AX
 33130                                  	; 22/07/2023
 33131                                  	;mov	es,ax ; *
 33132 00002D35 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx		; Pretend we're on UMB 0 for now...
 33133                                  
 33134                                  	; 22/07/2023
 33135                                  fu10:
 33136 00002D37 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax ; * ; **
 33137                                  ; ---------------------------------------------
 33138                                  ; FU10--CX - This UMB number; 0 == conventional
 33139                                  ;       DX - The UMB number they're looking for
 33140                                  ;       ES - The current MCB address
 33141                                  ; ---------------------------------------------
 33142                                  
 33143                                  ;fu10:	
 33144 00002D39 39D1                    	cmp	cx,dx		; If CX==DX, we've found the UMB we're
 33145 00002D3B 7417                    	je	short fuX	; searching for--so exit.
 33146                                  
 33147 00002D3D E8D4FE                  	call	isSysMCB	; Returns with ZF set if owner is SYSTEM
 33148 00002D40 7501                    	jnz	short fu20
 33149                                  
 33150 00002D42 41                      	inc	cx		; If it _was_ SYSTEM, we're in a new UMB.
 33151                                  fu20:	
 33152                                  	;mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 33153                                  	;cmp	al,arena_signature_end ; 'Z'
 33154                                  	; 19/07/2023
 33155 00002D43 26803E00005A            	cmp	byte [es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],arena_signature_end 
 33156 00002D49 7408                    	je	short fuE	; 'Z' means this was the last MCB... that's it.
 33157                                  
 33158                                  	;NextMCB es,ax		; Go on forward.
 33159                                  	; 22/07/2023
 33160                                  	; ax = es
 33161                                  	;mov	ax,es ; * ; 22/07/2023
 33162                                  	;add	ax,[es:3]
 33163 00002D4B 2603060300              	add	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 33164 00002D50 40                      	inc	ax
 33165                                  	; 22/07/2023
 33166                                  	;mov	es,ax ; **
 33167 00002D51 EBE4                    	jmp	short fu10
 33168                                  fuE:	
 33169 00002D53 F9                      	stc
 33170                                  fuX:
 33171                                  	; 01/01/2023
 33172                                  	;pop	dx
 33173                                  	; 02/01/2023
 33174 00002D54 59                      	pop	cx ; *
 33175                                  	;pop	ax		; The address is already in ES.
 33176 00002D55 C3                      	retn
 33177                                  
 33178                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33179                                  ;*** BigFree - makes ES:0 point to the largest free MCB in UMB given as AL
 33180                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33181                                  ; ENTRY:    AL should be to a valid UMB number
 33182                                  ; EXIT:     ES:0 points to largest free MCB in UMB, AX returns its size
 33183                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if couldn't reach UMB (0 or too high)
 33184                                  ; USES:     Flags, ES
 33185                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33186                                  
 33187                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 33188                                  BigFree:
 33189                                  	; 01/01/2023
 33190                                  	;push	bx
 33191 00002D56 51                      	push	cx
 33192                                  
 33193 00002D57 E8D3FF                  	call	findUMB			; Returns with CF if err, else ES==MCB
 33194 00002D5A 723A                    	jc	short bfX		; (would be "jc bfE"; it just does stc)
 33195                                  
 33196 00002D5C 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			; Segment address of largest free MCB
 33197 00002D5E 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx			; Size of largest free MCB
 33198                                  
 33199                                  ; ---------------------------------------------
 33200                                  ; BF10--ES - Current MCB address
 33201                                  ;       BX - Address of largest free MCB so far
 33202                                  ;       CX - Size of largest free MCB so far
 33203                                  ; ---------------------------------------------
 33204                                  
 33205                                  bf10:	
 33206 00002D60 E8B1FE                  	call	isSysMCB		; If we've left the MCB, we're done.
 33207 00002D63 7428                    	jz	short bf30
 33208                                  
 33209                                  	;call	isFreeMCB		; Returns with ZF set if owner is 0
 33210 00002D65 26830E010000            	or	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],0
 33211 00002D6B 750C                    	jnz	short bf20
 33212                                  
 33213 00002D6D 26A10300                	mov	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 33214                                  	;cmp	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Compare sizes...
 33215 00002D71 39C1                    	cmp	cx,ax
 33216                                  	;jg	short bf20		; Unless we're bigger,
 33217                                  	; 19/07/2023
 33218 00002D73 7D04                    	jge	short bf20
 33219                                  
 33220 00002D75 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es			; Store this new element's address,

 33223

 33292                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33293                                  ;*** shrinkMCB - breaks an MCB into two pieces, the lowest one's size==AX
 33294                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33295                                  ; ENTRY:    AX == new size, ES:0 == current MCB
 33296                                  ; EXIT:     None; MCB broken if carry clear
 33297                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if MCB isn't as large as AX+0x20 (not a useful split)
 33298                                  ; USES:     Flags
 33299                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33300                                  ; If the size of the to-be-split MCB isn't at least 0x20 bytes greater than
 33301                                  ; the specified new size, the split is useless; if it's only 0x10 bytes, that
 33302                                  ; 0x10 will be used to make a header that mentions a 0-byte free space, and
 33303                                  ; that just sucks up 0x10 bytes for nothing. So we make 0x20 bytes the
 33304                                  ; minimum for performing a split.
 33305                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33306                                  
 33307                                  MIN_SPLIT_SIZE	equ	20h
 33308                                  
 33309                                  	; 02/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 33310                                  
 33311                                  shrinkMCB:
 33312                                  	;pushreg <bx,cx,es>
 33313                                  	; 02/01/2023
 33314                                  	;push	bx
 33315 00002DA3 51                      	push	cx
 33316 00002DA4 06                      	push	es
 33317                                  
 33318 00002DA5 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax			; Move things around... and
 33319                                  	; 02/01/2023
 33320                                  	;mov	ax,es			; save this one for later.
 33321                                  
 33322 00002DA7 268B0E0300              	mov	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 33323                                  	; 02/01/2023
 33324 00002DAC 89C8                    	mov	ax,cx 
 33325                                  
 33326 00002DAE 83E820                  	sub	ax,MIN_SPLIT_SIZE ; 32
 33327                                  	;sub	cx,MIN_SPLIT_SIZE ; 32
 33328                                  	;;cmp	bx,cx			; {New size} vs {Current Size-20h}
 33329                                  	;ja	short smE		; if wanted_size > cur-20h, abort.
 33330                                  	; 18/12/2022
 33331                                  	;cmp	cx,bx
 33332                                  	; 02/01/2023
 33333 00002DB1 39D8                    	cmp	ax,bx
 33334 00002DB3 7228                    	jb	short smE ; (*)
 33335                                  
 33336 00002DB5 268A160000              	mov	dl,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 33337                                  	
 33338                                  	;mov	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 33339                                  	; 02/01/2023
 33340 00002DBA 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 33341                                  
 33342 00002DBC 26891E0300              	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],bx
 33343 00002DC1 26C60600004D            	mov	byte [es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],'M'
 33344                                  
 33345 00002DC7 01D8                    	add	ax,bx
 33346 00002DC9 40                      	inc	ax
 33347 00002DCA 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; Move to new arena area
 33348                                  
 33349 00002DCC 89C8                    	mov	ax,cx
 33350 00002DCE 29D8                    	sub	ax,bx
 33351                                  	; 12/12/2022
 33352                                  	; ax > 0
 33353 00002DD0 48                      	dec	ax			; And prepare the new size
 33354                                  
 33355                                  	; 18/12/2022
 33356 00002DD1 2688160000              	mov	[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],dl
 33357                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],0 ; (**)
 33358 00002DD6 26A30300                	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],ax
 33359                                  	;mov	ax,'  ' ; 2020h
 33360                                  	;mov	[es:ARENA.NAME+0],ax ; (**)
 33361                                  	;mov	[es:ARENA.NAME+2],ax ; (**)
 33362                                  	;mov	[es:ARENA.NAME+4],ax ; (**)
 33363                                  	;mov	[es:ARENA.NAME+6],ax ; (**)
 33364                                  
 33365                                  	; 18/12/2022
 33366 00002DDA E8A801                  	call	freeMCB	; (**)
 33367                                  
 33368                                  	; 12/12/2022
 33369                                  	; cf=0
 33370                                  	;clc
 33371                                  	; 18/12/2022
 33372                                  	;jmp	short smX
 33373                                  smE:	
 33374                                  	; 18/12/2022
 33375                                  	; cf=1 (*)
 33376                                  	;stc
 33377                                  smX:	
 33378                                  	;popreg	<es,cx,bx>
 33379 00002DDD 07                      	pop	es
 33380 00002DDE 59                      	pop	cx
 33381                                  	; 02/01/2023
 33382                                  	;pop	bx
 33383 00002DDF C3                      	retn
 33384                                  
 33385                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33386                                  ;*** hideUMB? - hides as appropriate the UMB in CL
 33387                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33388                                  ; ENTRY:    CL should be to a valid UMB number, and AX to its address (findUMB)
 33389                                  ; EXIT:     None; UMB is hidden as necessary
 33390                                  ; ERROR:    None
 33391                                  ; USES:     Flags, AX, CX
 33392                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33393                                  ; PRIMARY LOGIC:
 33394                                  ;
 33395                                  ; If the UMB is specified in the DH/LH statement, then:
 33396                                  ;    If the largest free segment is too small (check specified size), then:
 33397                                  ;       Pretend it wasn't ever specified, and fall out of this IF.
 33398                                  ;    Else, if largest free segment is LARGER than specified size, then:
 33399                                  ;       If /S was given on the command-line, then:
 33400                                  ;          Break that element into two pieces
 33401                                  ;          Set a flag that we're shrinking
 33402                                  ;       Endif
 33403                                  ;    Endif
 33404                                  ; Endif
 33405                                  ; If the UMB is NOT specified (or was removed by the above):
 33406                                  ;    Hide all free elements in the UMB
 33407                                  ;    If the flag that we're shrinking was set, then:
 33408                                  ;       UN-hide the lower portion of the shrunken UMB
 33409                                  ;    ENDIF
 33410                                  ; ENDIF
 33411                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33412                                  
 33413                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 33414                                  	; (SYSINIT:3426h)
 33415                                  _hideUMB_:
 33416                                  	; 02/01/2023
 33417                                  	; ds = cs
 33418                                  
 33419                                  	; 01/01/2023
 33420                                  	;push	bx
 33421                                  	;push	dx
 33422 00002DE0 06                      	push	es
 33423                                  
 33424 00002DE1 88C8                    	mov	al,cl
 33425 00002DE3 E8B2FF                  	call	isSpecified	; Returns ZF set if al's umb was NOT specified
 33426 00002DE6 742D                    	jz	short hu_20
 33427                                  
 33428 00002DE8 88C8                    	mov	al,cl		; Retrieve the size of the largest
 33429 00002DEA E869FF                  	call	BigFree		; free element in AX; put its address in ES
 33430 00002DED 7226                    	jc	short hu_20	; Oops. Errors mean skip this part.
 33431                                  
 33432 00002DEF 50                      	push	ax		; TOS==size of BigFree in UMB (popped as BX)
 33433 00002DF0 88C8                    	mov	al,cl		; Retrieve the user's specified
 33434 00002DF2 E8AAFE                  	call	GetSize		; minimum size for this umb (into AX)
 33435 00002DF5 5B                      	pop	bx		; Now BX==BigFree, AX==Specified Size
 33436                                  
 33437 00002DF6 09C0                    	or	ax,ax		; If they didn't specify one,
 33438 00002DF8 741B                    	jz	short hu_20	; Skip over all this.
 33439                                  
 33440 00002DFA 39D8                    	cmp	ax,bx		; Ah... if (specified > max free)
 33441 00002DFC 7607                    	jbe	short hu_10
 33442                                  
 33443 00002DFE 88C8                    	mov	al,cl		;  Then mark that UMB as unused. Nya nya.
 33444 00002E00 E81DFD                  	call	unMarkUMB
 33445 00002E03 EB10                    	jmp	short hu_20
 33446                                  hu_10:	
 33447                                  	;call	isTiny		; Returns ZF clear if user specified /S
 33448                                  	;jz	short hu_20
 33449                                  	; 02/01/2023
 33450                                  ;isTiny:
 33451                                  	;mov	al,[fUmbTiny] ; ds = cs
 33452                                  	;or	al,al
 33453 00002E05 800E[031F]00            	or	byte [fUmbTiny],0
 33454 00002E0A 7409                    	jz	short hu_20
 33455                                  
 33456 00002E0C E894FF                  	call	shrinkMCB	; They specified /S, so shrink the MCB to AX
 33457 00002E0F 7204                    	jc	short hu_20	; Ah... if didn't shrink after all, skip this:
 33458                                  
 33459 00002E11 8CC2                    	mov	dx,es
 33460 00002E13 EB09                    	jmp	short hu_30	; Skip the spec check.. we wanna hide this one.
 33461                                  
 33462 00002E15 89C8                    hu_20:	mov	ax,cx
 33463 00002E17 E87EFF                  	call	isSpecified	; If they specified this UMB, we're done...
 33464 00002E1A 7510                    	jnz	short hu_X	; so leave.
 33465                                  
 33466 00002E1C 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 33467                                  hu_30:	
 33468 00002E1E 88C8                    	mov	al,cl
 33469                                  
 33470 00002E20 E89DFE                  	call	hideUMB		; Hides everything in UMB #al
 33471                                  
 33472 00002E23 09D2                    	or	dx,dx		; Did we shrink a UMB? If not, DX==0,
 33473 00002E25 7405                    	jz	short hu_X	; So we should leave.
 33474                                  
 33475 00002E27 8EC2                    	mov	es,dx		; Ah, but if it isn't, DX==the MCB's address;
 33476 00002E29 E8E6FE                  	call	unHideMCB	; Un-hides the lower portion of that MCB.
 33477                                  hu_X:	
 33478 00002E2C 07                      	pop	es
 33479                                  	; 01/01/2023
 33480                                  	;pop	dx
 33481                                  	;pop	bx
 33482 00002E2D C3                      	retn
 33483                                  
 33484                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33485                                  ;*** UnFreeze - Marks FROZEN elements as FREE
 33486                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33487                                  ; Entry:  None
 33488                                  ; Exit:   None; all 8+FROZEN elements are marked as FREE, from any UMB.
 33489                                  ; Error:  None
 33490                                  ; Uses:   Flags
 33491                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33492                                  
 33493                                  	; 03/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 33494                                  UnFreeze:
 33495                                  	; 03/01/2023
 33496                                  	;push	ax
 33497 00002E2E 06                      	push	es
 33498                                  
 33499 00002E2F E8D5FD                  	call	UmbHead		; Returns with carry if err, else ES == MCB
 33500 00002E32 721C                    	jc	short ufX
 33501                                  
 33502                                  	; 22/07/2023
 33503                                  uf10:
 33504 00002E34 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax ; *
 33505                                  
 33506                                  ; ------------------------------
 33507                                  ; UF10--ES - Current MCB address
 33508                                  ; ------------------------------
 33509                                  
 33510                                  ;uf10:	
 33511 00002E36 E81900                  	call	isFrozMCB	; Returns with ZF set if MCB is FROZEN
 33512 00002E39 7505                    	jnz	short uf20

 33514                                  	; 09/09/2023
 33515                                  	; ax <> es
 33516 00002E3E 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es ; *
 33517                                  uf20:	
 33518                                  	;mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 33519                                  	;cmp	al,arena_signature_end ; 'Z'
 33520                                  	; 22/07/2023
 33521 00002E40 26803E00005A            	cmp	byte [es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],arena_signature_end ; 'Z'
 33522 00002E46 7408                    	jz	short ufX	; 'Z' means this was the last MCB.. that's it.
 33523                                  
 33524                                  	;NextMCB es,ax		; Go on forward.
 33525                                  	; 22/07/2023
 33526                                  	; ax = es
 33527                                  	;mov	ax,es ; *
 33528                                  	;add	ax,[es:3]
 33529 00002E48 2603060300              	add	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 33530 00002E4D 40                      	inc	ax

 33538 00002E51 C3                      	retn

 33544                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set if MCB is frozen, else !ZF

 33673                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33674                                  ;*** UmbTest - returns with carry set if UMBs are not available, else CF==false
 33675                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33676                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 33677                                  ; EXIT:     Carry is clear if UMBs are available, or set if they are not
 33678                                  ; ERROR:    None

 33706                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33707                                  ;*** WalkMem - travels memory chain and returns carry clear iff UMBs are linked
 33708                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33709                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 33710                                  ; EXIT:     Carry SET if MCB chain stops before 9FFF, CLEAR if stops >= 9FFF.
 33711                                  ; ERROR:    None

 34085                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 34086                                  ; SYSCONF.ASM (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 34087                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 34088                                  ; 09/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34089                                  
 34090                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34091                                  ;
 34092                                  ; procedure : InitDevLoad
 34093                                  ;
 34094                                  ;	Input : DeviceHi = 0 indicates load DD in low memory
 34095                                  ;			 = 1 indicates load in UMB:
 34096                                  ;		           ConvLoad = 0 indicates a new-style load (see below)
 34097                                  ;		                    = 1 indicates a DOS 5-style load
 34098                                  ;		DevSize  = Size of the device driver file in paras
 34099                                  ;
 34100                                  ;	Output : none
 34101                                  ;
 34102                                  ;	Initializes DevLoadAddr, DevLoadEnd & DevEntry.
 34103                                  ;	Also sets up a header for the Device driver entry for mem utility
 34104                                  ;
 34105                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34106                                  ; For a "new-style load", we break off the current DevEntry and link the umbs
 34107                                  ; as we see fit, using HideUMBs (and UnHideUMBs at exit, though _it_ decides
 34108                                  ; whether it's entitled to do anything). HideUMBs uses the chart built by
 34109                                  ; ParseVar to determine which UMBs to leave FREE, and which not.
 34110                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34111                                  
 34112                                  	; 01/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 34113                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 34114                                  	; (SYSINIT:364Ah)
 34115                                  InitDevLoad:
 34116                                  	; 01/01/2023
 34117                                  	;push	es ; *
 34118                                  
 34119                                  	; 11/12/2022
 34120                                  	; ds = cs
 34121 00002FBF 803E[581F]00            	cmp	byte [DeviceHi],0
 34122                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:DeviceHi],0	; Are we loading in UMB ?
 34123                                  	;je	short InitForLo		; no, init for lo mem
 34124 00002FC4 7439                    	je	short initforlo_x ; 09/04/2019
 34125                                  
 34126                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 34127                                  ; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 34128                                  ; %if 0
 34129                                  	; 01/01/2023
 34130 00002FC6 803E[481F]01            	cmp	byte [ConvLoad],1	; Are we loading as per DOS 5?
 34131                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:ConvLoad],1	; Are we loading as per DOS 5?
 34132 00002FCB 7413                    	je	short InitForConv
 34133                                  
 34134                                  ; There are two stages to preparing upper-memory; first, we mark as 8+HIDDEN
 34135                                  ; any areas not specified on the /L:... chain. Second, we mark as 8+FROZEN
 34136                                  ; any areas left in upper-memory, except for elements in the load UMB...
 34137                                  ; we then malloc space as per Dos-5 style, and mark as free any spaces which
 34138                                  ; are 8+FROZEN (but leave 8+HIDDEN still hidden). The load is performed,
 34139                                  ; and UnHideUMBs later on marks all 8+HIDDEN as free.
 34140                                  
 34141 00002FCD E85704                  	call	ShrinkUMB		; Stop using the old device arena
 34142                                  
 34143 00002FD0 E892FC                  	call	HideUMBs		; Mark up the UM area as we see fit
 34144 00002FD3 E8CBFE                  	call	FreezeUM		; Hide everything BUT the load area
 34145 00002FD6 E85700                  	call	GetUMBForDev		; And grab that load area as needed
 34146 00002FD9 9C                      	pushf
 34147 00002FDA E851FE                  	call	UnFreeze		; Then unhide everything frozen
 34148 00002FDD 9D                      	popf
 34149                                  	;jc	short InitForLo		; (if carry, it's loading low)
 34150                                  	;jmp	short InitForHi
 34151                                  	; 06/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 34152 00002FDE EB0B                    	jmp	short idl0
 34153                                  
 34154                                  ;%endif ; 01/11/2022
 34155                                  
 34156                                  	; 01/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 34157                                  	; (SYSINIT:2B67h)
 34158                                  InitForConv:
 34159                                  	; 11/12/2022
 34160                                  	; ds = cs
 34161 00002FE0 E83700                  	call	SpaceInUMB		; Do we have space left in the
 34162                                  					;  current UMB ?
 34163 00002FE3 7308                    	jnc	short InitForHi		; yes, we have
 34164 00002FE5 E83F04                  	call	ShrinkUMB		; shrink the current UMB in use
 34165 00002FE8 E84500                  	call	GetUMBForDev		; else try to allocate new UMB
 34166                                  idl0: ; 06/07/2023
 34167 00002FEB 720D                    	jc	short InitForLo		; we didn't succeed, so load
 34168                                  					;  in low memory
 34169                                  InitForHi:
 34170                                  	; 11/12/2022
 34171                                  	; ds = cs
 34172                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:DevUMBFree]	; get Para addr of free mem
 34173                                  	;mov	dx,[cs:DevUMBAddr]	; UMB start addr
 34174                                  	;add	dx,[cs:DevUMBSize]	; DX = UMB End addr
 34175 00002FED A1[4E1F]                	mov	ax,[DevUMBFree]
 34176 00002FF0 8B16[4A1F]              	mov	dx,[DevUMBAddr]
 34177 00002FF4 0316[4C1F]              	add	dx,[DevUMBSize]
 34178 00002FF8 EB0C                    	jmp	short idl1
 34179                                  
 34180                                  InitForLo:
 34181                                  	; 11/12/2022
 34182                                  	; ds = cs
 34183                                  	;mov	byte [cs:DeviceHi],0	; in case we failed to load
 34184 00002FFA C606[581F]00            	mov	byte [DeviceHi],0
 34185                                  initforlo_x:
 34186                                  	; 11/12/2022
 34187                                  	; ds = cs
 34188                                  					;  into UMB indicate that
 34189                                  					;  we are loading low
 34190                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:memhi]		; AX = start of Low memory
 34191                                  	;mov	dx,[cs:ALLOCLIM]	; DX = End of Low memory
 34192 00002FFF A1[6403]                	mov	ax,[memhi]
 34193 00003002 8B16[A502]              	mov	dx,[ALLOCLIM]
 34194                                  idl1:
 34195 00003006 E86600                  	call	DevSetMark		; setup a sub-arena for DD
 34196                                  	; 11/12/2022
 34197                                  	; ds = cs
 34198                                  	;mov	[cs:DevLoadAddr],ax	; init the Device load address
 34199                                  	;mov	[cs:DevLoadEnd],dx	; init the limit of the block
 34200                                  	;mov	word [cs:DevEntry],0	; init Entry point to DD
 34201                                  	;mov	[cs:DevEntry+2],ax
 34202 00003009 A3[3C1F]                	mov	[DevLoadAddr],ax
 34203 0000300C 8916[3E1F]              	mov	[DevLoadEnd],dx
 34204 00003010 C706[401F]0000          	mov	word [DevEntry],0
 34205 00003016 A3[421F]                	mov	[DevEntry+2],ax

 34320                                  	;dec	ax

 34375                                  ;

 34377                                  ;	Output : AX - Segment at which device can be loaded (AX=AX+1)

 34905                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34906                                  ;
 34907                                  ; procedure : GetHexNum
 34908                                  ;
 34909                                  ;	Converts an ascii string terminated by a delimiter into binary.
 34910                                  ;	Assumes that the ES:SI points to a Hexadecimal string
 34911                                  ;
 34912                                  ;	Returns in AX the number number of paras equivalent to the
 34913                                  ;	hex number of bytes specified by the hexadecimal string.
 34914                                  ;
 34915                                  ;	Returns carry in case it encountered a non-hex character or
 34916                                  ;	if it encountered crlf
 34917                                  ;
 34918                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34919                                  
 34920                                  ; 13/05/2019
 34921                                  
 34922                                  	; 03/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 34923                                  	; (SYSINIT:38C5h)
 34924                                  
 34925                                  	; 01/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 34926                                  	; (SYSINIT:2DA5h)
 34927                                  GetHexNum:
 34928 000031F3 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 34929 000031F5 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 34930                                  ghn_next:
 34931 000031F7 268A1C                  	mov	bl,[es:si]
 34932 000031FA 80FB0D                  	cmp	bl,cr  ; 0Dh
 34933 000031FD 7436                    	je	short ghn_err
 34934 000031FF 80FB0A                  	cmp	bl,lf  ; 0Ah
 34935 00003202 7431                    	je	short ghn_err
 34936 00003204 50                      	push	ax
 34937 00003205 88D8                    	mov	al,bl
 34938 00003207 E8D80F                  	call	delim
 34939 0000320A 58                      	pop	ax
 34940                                  	; 03/01/2023
 34941 0000320B B90400                  	mov	cx,4
 34942 0000320E 7410                    	jz	short ghn_into_paras
 34943 00003210 E82400                  	call	GetNibble
 34944                                  	;jc	short ghn_err
 34945                                  	; 11/12/2022
 34946 00003213 7221                    	jc	short ghn_ret ; cf=1
 34947                                  	; 03/01/2023
 34948                                  	;mov	cx,4
 34949                                  ghn_shift1:
 34950 00003215 D1E0                    	shl	ax,1
 34951 00003217 D1D2                    	rcl	dx,1
 34952 00003219 E2FA                    	loop	ghn_shift1
 34953 0000321B 08D8                    	or	al,bl
 34954 0000321D 46                      	inc	si
 34955 0000321E EBD7                    	jmp	short ghn_next
 34956                                  ghn_into_paras:
 34957 00003220 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 34958 00003223 83D200                  	adc	dx,0
 34959 00003226 F7C2F0FF                	test	dx,0FFF0h
 34960 0000322A 7509                    	jnz	short ghn_err
 34961                                  	; 03/01/2023
 34962                                  	;mov	cx,4
 34963                                  ghn_shift2:
 34964 0000322C F8                      	clc
 34965 0000322D D1DA                    	rcr	dx,1
 34966 0000322F D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 34967 00003231 E2F9                    	loop	ghn_shift2
 34968 00003233 F8                      	clc
 34969 00003234 C3                      	retn
 34970                                  	; 11/12/2022
 34971                                  ghn_err:
 34972                                  gnib_err:
 34973 00003235 F9                      	stc
 34974                                  ghn_ret:
 34975                                  gnib_ret:
 34976 00003236 C3                      	retn

 34980                                  ; procedure : GetNibble
 34981                                  ;
 34982                                  ;	Convert one nibble (hex digit) in BL into binary
 34983                                  ;
 34984                                  ;	Returns binary value in BL
 34985                                  ;
 34986                                  ;	Returns carry if BL contains non-hex digit
 34987                                  ;
 34988                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34989                                  
 34990                                  GetNibble:

 34992                                  	;jb	short gnib_err

 34996 0000323F 7704                    	ja	short is_it_hex
 34997 00003241 80EB30                  	sub	bl,'0'		; clc
 34998 00003244 C3                      	retn
 34999                                  is_it_hex:

 35004 0000324A 80FB46                  	cmp	bl,'F'
 35005 0000324D 77E6                    	ja	short gnib_err ; 11/12/2022
 35006 0000324F 80EB37                  	sub	bl,'A'- 10	; clc
 35007 00003252 C3                      	retn
